story:
HELLO.

My name is Patricia Ariel, and I am an artist and illustrator.

I have created images that have been licensed in several products and published and collected all over the world.




 

To me, creating art is a way to

INSPIRE

CONSCIENTIZE
and
PROMOTE CHANGES

and I want to use my skills and creativity to help shaping a better WORLD for all.

 

One of the most gratifying parts of my work is the making of portraits. It is so fascinating to decode the emotions brought out by the human face, their uniqueness, their stories. The process of creating a portrait can be very revealing. Through the lens of art, we end up seeing ourselves with different eyes, and finding out strengths - both physical and spiritual – we could never suspect we had.

 

 

 

And it was thinking about this unique empowerment and clarity that Art is able to bring, that I have designed a project that would help empower and inspire women to seek for their unique light and value – the one that lies beyond their physical look.

 

 

THE PROJECT.

The “Changing Woman” is a myth of the` Navajo people, and represents the personification of the Earth, the seasons, and the cycles of life. Nothing more appropriate to represent our strengths, our nurturing nature, but also our huge capacity to change ourselves and the world around us.

 

 

My project's goal is to tell twenty-one stories of “Changing Women” in form of art portraits. Women from different backgrounds, that have struggled for acceptance and equality in the contemporary model of society. By portraying women that, against all odds, have found their inner strength and thrived, I hope to enhance their power and make of them models and a voice for all women that have struggled with the challenges to be themselves and embrace their own choices. I want these stories to inspire and empower other women in seeking for their own path, and to raise awareness of how it is like to be a woman in today's world. I want to transform these women in modern muses, enhancing their real beauty in form of works of art.

 

The portraits will be exhibited in an art show and featured in a book, along with the stories and photos of the women who inspired them. There will also be a production of limited edition prints and possibly other merchandise products. A “behind the scene” video of the project will be produced. All the proceeds from the sales of prints and merchandise, will support an organization pro women's rights or a shelter.

 

 

YOUR SUPPORT WILL MAKE IT POSSIBLE.

To make this project possible, and help changing lives, minds, and hearts, I need your help. I have estimated a minimum of $29,000 to make it happen according to my vision. With your support it will be possible...

… to purchase quality art materials for the production and presentation of twenty-one works of art.

… to purchase electronic equipment and services that will produce quality graphic results for deliverables like prints and books.

… to cover expenses with art show preparation and reception, professional scanning, framing, promotion, video edition, and miscellaneous services like packing, shipping, and others.

… to cover the artist's hours so she can fully focus on giving her best. :)

… to cover runs of postcards, books, prints, and t-shirts, destined to reward backers.

… to cover the first runs of prints which sales will be destined to support our organization of choice.

I can find alternatives to keep  the project alive even without reaching my campaign goal, and this is why I have decided to opt for "Flexible funding". There will be, however, a bit more struggle, more time required until the completion,  and less resources, which  might force me to reduce the potential of all that the project could become.

 

THE TIMEFRAMES.

The project is scheduled to start on July 2013, when I will be doing my first studies on how the portraits will be conceptualized, the techniques, the execution, etc. I am planning to complete at least two portraits a month, but art is not an exact science and this can also vary. If everything goes as planned, all the portraits might be completed around April/May 2014. After that, I will be starting the design part of my work, preparing files for print and perks, designing the book, etc. I will be also sending the works for framing, support the edition of the video, planning the art show, and a myriad of other tasks. My plan is to deliver everything by the Harvest season, or the Autumn Equinox - around October 2012. Before December 2014, to close the year with a feeling of mission accomplished, I hope to have all the works hanging on a gallery wall, the perks shipped, and a check to give to the women's support organization we will help.

Notice that this is a projection made for a fully funded campaign. This timeframe can change depending on how much funding I will be able to raise, which will be a decisive factor on time and resources availability.

 

 

WHAT YOU WILL GET.

Along with recognition and acknowledgment for your generous support, your kindness will be rewarded with items specially created for this project. That includes:

  • exclusive postcards, t-shirts, posters, and art zines (all created only for the Indie Gogo backers!)
  • electronic and hard copies of the Changing Woman art book.
  • Contributions of $200 or more will win original artworks, including custom art portraits of a woman of your life. 
  • Contributions of $3,000 will take home one of the Changing Woman original artworks.
  • All backers from the Hummingbird to the Dragonfly sponsorships will have their names in a  drawing (per sponsorship category) that will give them a chance to win one of the limited edition art prints released by the project.
  • All backers will have premier online access to the Changing Woman behind the scenes video.

 

And, as I love to give away cool stuff with my art,  I will also be giving surprise gifts to my backers along the way, no matter how much they have contributed with! So, expect to have the chance to win prints and other goodies, and even original artworks, as the project progresses! 

 
UPDATE: First Surprise Perk!!
4.5″ × 6.5″ high quality journal featuring my painting “Witness” + my original 5″ × 7″ mix media painting “Natura #2”, matted and ready to frame. All the backers names will enter a drawing at the end of the campaign and one of them will take both items home by mid June. Yep, you won't need to wait until the project is completed to start receiving your perks!


 

THE CHANGE WE NEED.

We all know that, in spite of the many efforts towards abolishing inequality, there are still a lot to be done. Women still suffer discrimination in their communities and workplaces; the numbers of genre violence such as abuse, sexual harassment, rape, and domestic violence, are still astonishing; not mentioning that, in many countries, social exclusion, trafficking, restricted mobility, “honor” killings, genital mutilation, and other horrors, are still part of the reality of thousands of women.

To change this scenario, more than never, we need open eyes. We need inspiration, we need examples, we need role models. Real women, with real lives, and how they changed them and their reality.

 

I want to show through real stories and inspiring art that yes, it is possible to thrive and live our dreams and choices in a world that is still far from fairness, but that it is possible to be changed, and it is, every day, through the lives of powerful and brave women. I want to show that we all can be the change, and inspire others.

 

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP.

If for some reason you are not able to help with funding, there are other ways you can support the project.

 

  • You can simply share the campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, Google+, or other social network.

  • Share the images bellow on one of your Pinterest boards and spread the Love!
    http://bit.ly/12yrIW8

    http://bit.ly/11cNKek

    http://bit.ly/ZeqyOT

    http://bit.ly/11sS7DK
  • You can also purchase a product on our Zazzle store, a second alternative for funding the project.
  • Participate in art auctions on Patricia'a Facebook fanpage: http://facebook.com/PatriciaAriel.art

 

TO LEARN MORE

To learn more about me and my work, please visit my website
http://www.patricia-ariel.com


I also have a blog where I have been posting all my trajectory as an artist since the beginning of my professional carreer:
http://mesmerizedbythesirens.blogspot.com

 

Changing Woman website:
http://changingwomanproject.tumblr.com

 

I will also be open to any questions you might have! Please do not hesitate to email me at changingwomanproject[at]gmail.com

 

THANKS FOR TAKING THE TIME TO LEARN ABOUT THE CHANGING WOMAN PROJECT! HOPE YOU GET INVOLVED... AND DO NOT FORGET TO SPREAD THE LOVE!

story:
Howdy, 

I'm making my first run of artist-quality archival prints and a I need some help getting it to the presses.

You can take a gander at all the available pieces here:
http://benjaminwilliamallain.tumblr.com/a%20poutine%20eastern

Once you contribute, please email me at benjamin.allain@gmail.com to confirm which piece you'd like a print of.

A not-so-brief history:

Who would have thunk, but I suppose this whole idea here came into supposing sometime late this past winter one afternoon at the kitchen table in the home of my friend, a music-maker. I had never liked the idea of prints and having not touched the thing that someone has in their hands.  He said that he would never sell the master recording of one of his albums, but he would make available the albums. "An album is to music as a print is to an artpiece."

That's when it came to supposing, it became a reallife thing-I-wanted-to-do when more and more folks – really great folks – wanted to have my artwork adorn their homes' walls, but the only copy of the work – the original itself – was bravely cast off alone and unhinged.

I'd like to be able to share that with more than one person. While I do find something wonderful and singular about only one person and their close circle having that image in their home, I find it very comforting to know that a very few more may have a well-made print hanging in their attics.

You can take a gander at all of the drawings here:

http://benjaminwilliamallain.tumblr.com/a%20poutine%20eastern

By pre-ordering, you'll get a digital print (matte) of an original painting on +100lb archival paper, printed with archival pigmented inks. Depending on the package you select, you could also have the following shipped to your doorstep:

-a small (business card size) original drawing

-a hand-typed poem and doodle

-a randomly chosen hand-altered reproduction of my previous work

Once I recieve the prints, and make the original pieces to go along with them, they`ll be shipped. You can expect that mid-september.

And, if you're unable to contribute monetarily at this time, please share! That would be a real huge help.

story:
* (all texts are in english and in german - alle Texte sind in englisch und in deutsch)!

Abraham Danso‘s dream is to touch peoples emotions and souls with his creations & paintings.


YOUR SUPPORT FOR HIS FIRST EXHIBITION AT THE AGORA ART GALLERY IN NEW YORK WILL BRING HIM ONE STEP CLOSER.


The Goal


" I am looking to spread new tone-elements with the power of the spirit."


In more concrete terms - in the creation and painting of abstract expressionism, the dissolution of the visual shapes on the one hand while making energies and vibration visible on the other hand is primary. This alouds me, my dream to touch peoples emotions and souls with my artistic works and inspirate them. I have already accepted to participate in this prestigious Art Gallery.

" but I need your help to cover the costs of this Art Gallery Exhibition Project ".


The Agora Art Gallery in New York is a international renowned contemporary Art Gallery. With a audience of over 40‘000 art interested viewers and colectors, my art style will be able to make an impact on society. The Gallery is also the publisher of the ARTis-Spectrum Artmagazin in New York.

"The pieces i create are meant to touch and stimulate the viewers visually and mentally. This is done through the vibrant color combination and composition and the subject matter expands upon concepts of self-awerness, personal enhancement and hidden massages about the universe and the humans in it."

" My dream is to make life a better place through art and the joy of creativity. "


Creative Process

This is an introduction to the unique style of art called “ spiritually free creation with color material “. The mixture of abstract expressionism deeply spiritually infused, mixed with many other color design technologycal technics and other classical and modern art influences. By way of my senses, the various materials and textures, colors and implements I try to experiment and break with the known norms.

Below: A SLICE of the finished work "3 Ytilibissop" on canvas 47.3' x 63' inch
               mixed media with tiny inclusions of phosphorus fluorescent pigment.

    

"This enables me to create with the color materials not only on the pictorial surface. Through the actual work with painting media-shape illustration I am led back to the color material dissolution of shape and therefore arrive at the core essence of the original movement that arose to the surface."


About the Artist

Abraham Danso is born in London, UK, from there he moved in the infancy over
The Gambia / West Africa in to Zurich, Switzerland.

In the course of his life he visited the occupational school for bricklayers and educated further to himself with the main focus Interior design/decoration at the new art school of Zurich. Then he learnt the occupation to the dipl. painter/ decorator by Christian Schmidt in Zurich, a specialist in dealing and handling with material, form and color.

Fascinated by this craft tradition and artistic technologies he further specialised in this area and worked during the next years as a painter/decorator among other things on the Opera House Zurich. The advancement in the areas of Decoration painting, Space and object creation was deepened.

To allow more dimension to his activities he studied for the dipl. colour designer / creator HF/TS (prof. BEng. Color Design Technology). Abraham develops in the areas of the humanities, visual art, space and object design, and investigates the energetic effect from colors and materials.

With pleasure he would introduce himself in schools and programmes for children and youngsters to give an understanding of the most different creation possibilities of constructive creativity to them.


- Special Thanks to Mel, Zion, Nael and Tino for the amazing mental support.


Abraham Danso‘s Traum ist mit Kreation & Bild die Emotionen und Seelen der Menschen zu berühren.


IHRE UNTERSTÜTZUNG FÜR SEINE ERSTE AUSSTELLUNG IN DER AGORA KUNST GALERIE IN NEW YORK BRINGT IHM SEINEN TRAUM EIN STÜCK NÄHER.


Das Ziel


"Ich bemühe mich mit geistiger Kraft für die Verbreitung neuer Klang-Werte."

Konkret - bei meiner Art der Gestaltung und Malerei von abstraktem Expressionismus, ist die Auflösung der visuellen Formen und das sichtbar machen von Energien und deren Vibrationen primär. Dies ermöglicht mir meinen Traum andere Mitmenschen durch meine künstlerische Art zu berühren und zu inspieriren. Ich habe bereits die Anerkennung und Einladung der repräsentativen Agora Art Gallery bekommen.

"aber ich brauche Eure Hilfe um die Kosten für dieses Agora Art Gallery Austellungs -Projekt zu decken ".

Die Agora Art Gallery ist eine weltbekannte und zeitgenössische Kunst-Galerie. Mit einem Kundenstamm von über 40‘000 Interessenten, Sammlern und Käufern hat meine Kunst die Möglichkeit einem breiten Publikum präsentiert zu werden. Die Galerie ist auch der Herausgeber des ARTis-Spectrum Kunstmagazin in New York.

"Mit den Bildern die ich kreiere, der Spiegelung und Kraft des geistigen sowie über die Kombination, Komposition und Reflexion von Farbmaterialklängen möchte ich durch Vibrationen neue Klang-Werte schaffen und andere Mitmenschen visuell und emotional stimulieren, berühren. Diese Art von Kommunikation möchte ich mit anderen teilen und versuche dabei deren Emotionen zu wecken."

"Die Bildimformationen dehnen sich dem Betrachter subijektiv aus, verknüpfen sich mit dem Betrachter, seiner Wahrnemung, -Selbsterfahrung und persönlichen Weiterentwicklung, dabei transportieren sie versteckte Botschaften des Universum und schwingen mit dem Innenleben das Menschen in sich haben."

" Mein Traum ist es, durch die Kreativität und Kunst den Menschen Freude im Leben zu bereiten. "


Kreativ-Prozess

Ich nenne meinen Kunststyl “ Geistige freie Gestaltung mit Farben-Material “.
Der Mix von abstraktem Expressionismus verflochten mit geistigem Schaffen, gemischt mit vielen anderen Gestaltungs- Maltechniken, klassischen und modernen Einflüssen. Mittels meinen Sinnen, den Farben-Materialien und Transportmitteln experimentieren und bekannte Normen aufbrechen.

Unten: Erste künstlerische Arbeit nach meiner Schulter Operation im März 2014                      "Noitarebil" mix media auf Leinwand 33.5' x 59' inch /85 x 120 cm Aug. 14

     

"Dies ermöglicht mir mit den Farbmaterialien nicht nur auf der Bildoberfläche zu schaffen. Über die Arbeit der eigentlichen Farbmaterial-Formdarstellung wieder zurück zur farbmateriellen Formauflösung, dem eigentlichen und Wesentlichen."


Über den Künstler

Abraham Danso ist in London, UK geboren, von dort aus er im Kindesalter über
The Gambia / West Afrika in die Schweiz nach Zürich übersiedelte.

Im Laufe seines Lebens besuchte er die Berufschule für Maurer und bildete sich mit dem Schwerpunkt Innenarchitektur an der Neuen Kunst Schule Zürich weiter. Danach erlernte er den Beruf zum dipl. Maler/Dekorationsmaler bei Christian Schmidt in Zürich, einem Spezialisten im Umgang mit Material, Form und Farbe. Fasziniert von dieser Handwerkstradition und den künstlerischen Techniken spezialisierte er sich weiter auf diesem Gebiet und arbeitete in den darauffolgenden Jahren als Maler/Dekorationsmaler u.a. am Opern Haus Zürich.

Um seinem Tun mehr Dimension zu ermöglichen bildete er sich zum diplomierten Farbdesigner/Gestalter HF/TS (prof. B Eng. Color Design Technology) aus. Abraham entfaltet sich auf den Gebieten der Geisteswissenschaften, visuellen Kunst, Raum-und Objektgestaltung, und erforscht die energetische Wirkung von Farben-Material.

Gerne würde er sich in Schulen und Programmen für Kinder und Jugendliche einbringen, um Ihnen dieverschiedensten Gestaltungsmöglichkeiten von konstruktiver kreativität näher zu bringen.


- Besonderen Dank an Mel, Zion, Nael und Tino für die erstaunliche mentale Unterstützung.

story_txt:
* (all texts are in english and in german - alle Texte sind in englisch und in deutsch)!
Abraham Danso‘s dream is to touch peoples emotions and souls with his creations & paintings.
YOUR SUPPORT FOR HIS FIRST EXHIBITION AT THE AGORA ART GALLERY IN NEW YORK WILL BRING HIM ONE STEP CLOSER.
The Goal
" I am looking to spread new tone-elements with the power of the spirit."

In more concrete terms - in the creation and painting of abstract expressionism, the dissolution of the visual shapes on the one hand while making energies and vibration visible on the other hand is primary. This alouds me, my dream to touch peoples emotions and souls with my artistic works and inspirate them. I have already accepted to participate in this prestigious Art Gallery.
" but I need your help to cover the costs of this Art Gallery Exhibition Project ". 
The Agora Art Gallery in New York is a international renowned contemporary Art Gallery. With a audience of over 40‘000 art interested viewers and colectors, my art style will be able to make an impact on society. The Gallery is also the publisher of the ARTis-Spectrum Artmagazin in New York.
"The pieces i create are meant to touch and stimulate the viewers visually and mentally. This is done through the vibrant color combination and composition and the subject matter expands upon concepts of self-awerness, personal enhancement and hidden massages about the universe and the humans in it."
" My dream is to make life a better place through art and the joy of creativity. "


Creative Process
This is an introduction to the unique style of art called “ spiritually free creation with color material “. The mixture of abstract expressionism deeply spiritually infused, mixed with many other color design technologycal technics and other classical and modern art influences. By way of my senses, the various materials and textures, colors and implements I try to experiment and break with the known norms.

Below: A SLICE of the finished work "3 Ytilibissop" on canvas 47.3' x 63' inch               mixed media with tiny inclusions of phosphorus fluorescent pigment.      
"This enables me to create with the color materials not only on the pictorial surface. Through the actual work with painting media-shape illustration I am led back to the color material dissolution of shape and therefore arrive at the core essence of the original movement that arose to the surface."
About the Artist
Abraham Danso is born in London, UK, from there he moved in the infancy over The Gambia / West Africa in to Zurich, Switzerland. 
In the course of his life he visited the occupational school for bricklayers and educated further to himself with the main focus Interior design/decoration at the new art school of Zurich. Then he learnt the occupation to the dipl. painter/ decorator by Christian Schmidt in Zurich, a specialist in dealing and handling with material, form and color. 
Fascinated by this craft tradition and artistic technologies he further specialised in this area and worked during the next years as a painter/decorator among other things on the Opera House Zurich. The advancement in the areas of Decoration painting, Space and object creation was deepened. 
To allow more dimension to his activities he studied for the dipl. colour designer / creator HF/TS (prof. BEng. Color Design Technology). Abraham develops in the areas of the humanities, visual art, space and object design, and investigates the energetic effect from colors and materials. With pleasure he would introduce himself in schools and programmes for 
children and youngsters to give an understanding of the most different 
creation possibilities of constructive creativity to them.
- Special Thanks to Mel, Zion, Nael and Tino for the amazing mental support.

Abraham Danso‘s Traum ist mit Kreation & Bild die Emotionen und Seelen der 
Menschen zu berühren.
IHRE UNTERSTÜTZUNG FÜR SEINE ERSTE AUSSTELLUNG IN DER AGORA KUNST GALERIE IN NEW YORK BRINGT IHM SEINEN TRAUM EIN STÜCK NÄHER.
Das Ziel
"Ich
 bemühe mich mit geistiger Kraft für die Verbreitung neuer Klang-Werte."Konkret - bei meiner Art der Gestaltung und Malerei von abstraktem Expressionismus, ist die Auflösung der visuellen Formen und das sichtbar
 machen von Energien und deren Vibrationen primär. Dies ermöglicht mir 
meinen Traum andere Mitmenschen durch meine künstlerische Art zu 
berühren und zu inspieriren. Ich habe bereits die Anerkennung und 
Einladung der repräsentativen Agora Art Gallery bekommen."aber ich 
brauche Eure Hilfe um die Kosten für dieses Agora Art Gallery Austellungs -Projekt zu 
decken ". Die Agora Art Gallery ist eine weltbekannte und zeitgenössische 
Kunst-Galerie. Mit einem Kundenstamm von über 40‘000 
Interessenten, Sammlern und Käufern hat meine Kunst die Möglichkeit 
einem breiten Publikum präsentiert zu werden. Die Galerie ist auch der 
Herausgeber des ARTis-Spectrum Kunstmagazin in New York. "Mit den Bildern die ich kreiere, der Spiegelung und Kraft des geistigen 
sowie über die Kombination, Komposition und Reflexion von 
Farbmaterialklängen möchte ich durch Vibrationen neue Klang-Werte 
schaffen und andere Mitmenschen visuell und emotional stimulieren, berühren. Diese Art von Kommunikation möchte ich mit anderen teilen und
 versuche dabei deren Emotionen zu wecken." "Die Bildimformationen dehnen 
sich dem Betrachter subijektiv aus, verknüpfen sich mit dem Betrachter,
 seiner
 Wahrnemung, -Selbsterfahrung und persönlichen Weiterentwicklung, dabei 
transportieren sie versteckte Botschaften des Universum und schwingen 
mit 
dem Innenleben das Menschen in sich haben."" Mein Traum ist es, durch die Kreativität und Kunst den Menschen Freude 
im Leben zu bereiten. "
Kreativ-ProzessIch
 nenne meinen Kunststyl “ Geistige freie Gestaltung mit Farben-Material 
“. Der Mix von abstraktem Expressionismus verflochten mit geistigem 
Schaffen, gemischt mit vielen anderen Gestaltungs- Maltechniken, 
klassischen und modernen Einflüssen. Mittels meinen Sinnen, den 
Farben-Materialien und Transportmitteln experimentieren und bekannte 
Normen aufbrechen. Unten: Erste künstlerische Arbeit nach meiner Schulter Operation im März 2014                      "Noitarebil" mix media auf Leinwand 33.5' x 59' inch /85 x 120 cm Aug. 14
      
"Dies ermöglicht mir mit den Farbmaterialien nicht nur
 auf der Bildoberfläche zu schaffen. Über die Arbeit der 
eigentlichen Farbmaterial-Formdarstellung wieder zurück zur 
farbmateriellen Formauflösung, dem eigentlichen und Wesentlichen."Über den Künstler
Abraham
 Danso ist in London, UK geboren, von dort aus er im Kindesalter über The Gambia / West Afrika in die Schweiz nach Zürich übersiedelte. Im Laufe seines Lebens 
besuchte er die Berufschule für Maurer und bildete sich mit dem 
Schwerpunkt Innenarchitektur an der Neuen Kunst Schule Zürich weiter. 
Danach erlernte er den Beruf zum dipl. Maler/Dekorationsmaler bei 
Christian Schmidt in Zürich, einem Spezialisten im Umgang mit Material,
 Form und Farbe. Fasziniert von dieser Handwerkstradition und den 
künstlerischen Techniken spezialisierte er sich weiter auf diesem 
Gebiet und arbeitete in den darauffolgenden Jahren als Maler/Dekorationsmaler u.a. am Opern Haus Zürich. Um seinem Tun mehr Dimension zu ermöglichen bildete er sich zum diplomierten Farbdesigner/Gestalter HF/TS (prof. B Eng. Color Design Technology) aus. Abraham entfaltet sich auf den Gebieten der Geisteswissenschaften, visuellen Kunst, Raum-und Objektgestaltung, und erforscht die energetische Wirkung von Farben-Material. Gerne würde er sich in Schulen und Programmen für Kinder und Jugendliche einbringen, um Ihnen dieverschiedensten Gestaltungsmöglichkeiten von konstruktiver kreativität näher zu bringen.

- Besonderen Dank an Mel, Zion, Nael und Tino für die erstaunliche mentale Unterstützung.

story:
Short Summary

In order to learn from the mistakes of nations before us it is imperative to view the current deficit as an opportunity and not a stagnant:

Benjamin Bugs is an underground rap artist with 21 years in the ent. field.

Personally experiencing power struggles along with strenuous workloads in the corporate world to cut costs and witnessing irrelevant excessive spending amongst low income individuals gave me insight on how to bring balance to the economy when factoring in higher education. 

Contributors to the "Lowering campaign" will expand the focused voice of conflict resolution to world groups who may not sufficiently receive the current collective message from political leaders because of how it is conveyed. At the same time elite groups can hear it and get a better understanding of what approaches can be used to support and finance the unemployed and dependent based on behavioral statistics and how it correlates with disadvantage rather than failed existing market strategies that cause large deficits. Subsidized incentives should be only given to programs that are competent.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

$4,194 is needed (perks included) for a soundcloud solo account ($103.85), a LinkedIn business account ($239.40) and a Facebook ad ($1,850) [all accounts are annual]. These accounts will be used to expand my networks in the music, social and business forums giving the project more prestige. This particular project is not-for-profit so you will not receive a return on investment unless you participate in one of the perks offered; however, you will be an investor in all pervading intellectual accomplishments from the project which hopefully ignites economized action.

Benjamin Bugs stands firm on the decision to  NOT sign deals with major music labels in the existing market to ensure there will be no misrepresentation or dilution of content.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

This project is being projected on a widescale from my point of view in order  to make myself one with the world. In my travels I learned people don't value advice as much as they value opinions so this LP is my opinion. I am aware some may disagree with what I say so I put formal research behind it along with my experience. The addition of accredited education gives "Nerdcore Hiphop" more exposure with the hope of gaining attention of aspiring students and people interested in education.

I have a history of performing on cards with the greatest hip hop artists as well as having audio placements on television and movies when I was working with mainstream; however, this is my solo effort combining business and art to address actual world issues proactively. Basically the money is not as important as the results. The results will determine how and if I will pursue  my career independently. 

Contributing may not be something you can do which I understand completely. The click of a play button just to hear the material is greatly appreciated. If you value it then by all means using the share option on my page along with indiegogo tools will gain the attention of someone else. Tweet the link to your favorite song amongst your associates or in forums where you feel it would be of help. All interaction are factors that can be used for  financial projections and viable when financing future endeavors. Stay encouraged and thank you for giving your attention to "Lowering of the Light Knight".

Other Ways You Can Help

story:
UPDATE: I’ve pulled in enough for the 6×6 square! WooHoo! Now, in the final hours, I just need to get another $240 and I’ve got enough for the biggie 9×9 square. And remember: this money goes to Youth in Arts and arts education. Thanks for you interest and support!

The annual Street Painting Festival in San Rafael is a benefit for Youth in Arts, a wonderful organization that is struggling to pick up some of the arts education slack left by dwindling budgets.

This year the festival theme is Bella Terra (or Beautiful Earth) and my take on it is mildly satiric, pro-environmental, and rather anti-development (it also tastes a bit steampunk but I don’t think that’s at issue). I sent my submission in and after a brief and very friendly email correspondence the folks from Youth in Arts said that they would be happy to admit my piece but they think it’s too controversial for them to find a sponsor.

So here I am.

Give a couple bucks if you can. Any extra money raised above and beyond the sponsorship cost (and perhaps a few bucks for me to buy extra chalk) will be donated evenly between Youth in Arts and the Marin Open Space District.

So let folks know that street painting can and should be more than just ephemeral decorations, help me get my work on the ground, and donate to two very worthy causes.

Whether you are able to contribute or not come by and see me at the festival on June 12th and 13th!

Some links:
My ‘rejected’ sketch
Youth in Arts
Marin Open Space
Me on Twitter

story:
Who is Marjoni McBride?

I’ve been painting and drawing since I was a young child. Art has always been my passion. The path that life has chosen for me has been a difficult one. Moving to Atlanta, GA from New Jersey at the young age of 19, I didn’t get a chance to continue my college education until I turned 25. My financial struggles began two years ago when I had the honor to donate my kidney to my wonderful grandmother. And ever since then I had to pay out of pocket to pay for tuition. I have used all of my savings and funds to get this far. I’m currently picked up a second job to try to stay afloat, but it will not be enough for me to pay for school.

However, I’m now almost done!!!!! I have 3 classes until I graduate. 

I’m currently studying Biology and Fine Arts. I choose this as a major, because I want to become a Medical Illustrator. I know most of you are like “What is that?” Well, a medical illustrator would provide any medical related drawings, animations, and/or graphics to doctors, publishing, or pharmaceutical companies. Yes, I have to take pre-med courses (good luck to me) LOL. 

How can you help…

I’m asking all of my friends, family, acquaintances, and friends of friends to help me on my educational journey. I know that times are hard but anything that you can give would help me. I’m seeking a total donation of $4,500; which will pay for tuition and books and graduation fees. 

What’s in it for you? 

As a token of my appreciation, I have in line some awesome perks for those who decide to donate. 

$10 - $24

You will receive a thank you post card of one of my paintings. 

$25 -$49

You will receive an 8x10 print of one of my paintings. You will be able to choose which one from the picture gallery. 

$50 - $100

You will receive an 11x14 print of one of my paintings. You will be able to choose which one from the picture gallery.

$101 - $500

You will receive an 18x24 print plus an 11x14 print of a painting of your choice. You will be able to choose which one from the picture gallery.

$501 and above 

You will receive an original painting of your choice. Note this is at first come first served bases. You will be able to choose which one from the picture gallery.

Again I would like to thank everyone for taking the opportunity to visit my page and donate. Every penny counts. Thank you!!!!!

All art work can be viewed in the Photo Gallery

You will receive an 18x24 print plus an 11x14 print of a painting of your choice. You will be able to choose which one from the picture gallery.
$501 and above 
You will receive an original painting of your choice. Note this is at first come first served bases. You will be able to choose which one from the picture gallery.
Again I would like to thank everyone for taking the opportunity to visit my page and donate. Every penny counts. Thank you!!!!!
All art work can be viewed in the Photo Gallery

story:
Our Story

Red Road Underground is the culmination of several years of work by artists Chris Leslie and Mitch Miller in documenting the final days of the Red Road housing scheme in Glasgow. Through photography, film and illustration their work examines the lives of those who lived in the city's most striking modern housing development. Based on in-depth interviews with current and ex-residents, and exclusive access to sites now closed off to the public, their work offers a unique take on the legacy of the flats.


Leslie and Miller have been invited to exhibit at the recently revamped New Glasgow Society gallery in February 2012, to coincide with the demolition of the first two slab blocks in the same month. The show Red Road Underground will show previously unseen material concerned primarily (but not exclusively) with the underground leisure complexes built at Red Road. This included a massive bingo hall and a nautically themed bar called The Brig. Both of these sites have been closed since the 1990's.

In early 2011 they were briefly re-opened to allow inspection by the demolition company. We tagged along and found something not unlike a latter-day Pompeii where time suddenly came to a stop. The exhibition will run for four weeks and will coincide with the launch of a specially designed website, which can be viewed here - http://www.redroadunderground.co.uk/


See Red Road through the eyes of its residents

We have spoken with a number of ex-residents for whom the Mecca and The Brig provided much needed entertainment and escapism. Though photography, film and illustration you can follow their stories in this exclusive and one off exhibition about Red Road and Glasgow.


Dialectograms - You can view Mitch's dialectograms in their full glory on the Red Road Underground site, but below are a few screen grabs. The full Brig Bar Dialectogram will be launched exclusively on this site in the next few weeks.






















































Photographs - show the underground Bingo Hall and Bar for the first time in decades since they were last closed.









The Impact

This exhibition represents and celebrates a unique and timeless piece of history that will form part of the legacy of the Red Road flats and for Glasgow.  No one else has documented Red Road Underground and with these unique places due for demolition in March 2012, no one else ever will. In February therefore, we will mount a free exhibition to share what we found there. 


What We Need & What You Get

To host this exhibition we need to get funds to cover the printing of the work and although the gallery space is being donated for free, we do need to contribute running costs. The New Glasgow Society is a voluntary organisation and there is no point in having this show if we can't keep the venue open! 


All contributors will be fully credited as funders and patrons of the show, and will receive an invite to a special private view of the exhibition and discussion with the artists.


Both artists have spent many weeks giving their time freely to organise this show, and much of the documentary work has been done free of charge. This is not about us being paid, this is simply about being able to exhibit the work in an unique exhibition in an ideal, accessible space.

All contributions, no matter how big or small will be rewarded by exclusive posters, photographs and films from the project - see the list on the right hand column.


Apologies for UK residents that the donations are in dollars - Indiegogo is a US company (and another example of the US ruling the world while it still can...you can link to a up to date currency converter here)


Other Ways You Can Help

Use the share tools on this site to spread the word about funding the show. And help us promote the show once it goes live - even if youre not in the Glasgow, Scotland area of the world you can visit http://www.redroadunderground.co.uk and see the work there. (But seeing the A0 prints of the photographs and illustrations in the flesh will be very special)

story:
Our Story

I'm that quirky artist that you've all met at least once in your life.  I have an odd disposition and dress like noone notices my socks don't match.  As an artist I feel I have the right to be odd, almost like its expected.  I decided to go to school to get educated in the arts, but its kinda....eh. Painting disciplines mainly cover Europe, but I know there's some pretty dope art in other cultures.  Its out there, I've seen it!  I wanna experience it.  I have the fantastic opportunity to study abroad for this summer in 17 different countries and next academic year in Cape Town, South Africa.  The end of journey will culminate into a phoetic poetography book or art, photography, and creative writing.

The Impact

Ok this is serious!  The world will begin to cave in on itself as the crust crumbles and the magma center boils over like a cherry pie gone wrong.  Don't worry, I can save us all by studying art abroad.  The information the Chinese and South Africans along with my American training will give me the necessary paintbrush techniques to journey to the center of the earth and turn off the oven.  You're Welcome.  Then, when I get back I will have established contacts with multiple countries and South Africans, and the weird creatures upon my journey to begin a cultural arts exchange program for middle to high school students for summer camps.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I'm just gonna put it out there.  I need 12 Gs.  The summer programs costs $4500 and the plane ticket costs $1500.  My schooling in South Africa is funded by grants (yayy government!), but the plane tickets for the three mini-me's and my better half aren't.  Their coming to South Africa for the year, because I fear for their nutritional health.  French Fries is not a meal!  That's $7500 for plane tickets alone ( I think.  I do brushstrokes not key strokes).  For your kind and generous support, I am whipping out mini portraits.  These are 3X2 inches of charcoal fun.

Other Ways You Can Help

The more people know about the dangers of world destruction, the more funds I may get to save us all.  Spread the word and be the sidekick...I mean Hero Support!

story:
hello everyone,happy holidays. I am the owner of a custom tattoo and art gallery store in Cambridge Ma. I have been tattooing for about 20 years now,its been my dream for as long as i can remember to open up a shop like this..and here we are,5 years later,the business has been well received in  the area and receives 5 star reviews almost daily,we are known for being friendly,creative,fun and easy going.we provide a unique atmosphere that combines a movie theatre,pool hall,art gallery and custom tattooing,we provide a space for local artists as well as throughout the country,a space for art to be displayed and sold.we have done about 20 shows over the last 5 years and have all been an amazing out pouring of interest,support and love. The reason i am here now,is because the lease is due to resign for another 5 years,the costs in Boston,not only for rent,but,also in terms of costs of living have skyrocketed over the last 2 years or so We want to continue to flourish in this community...to continue to provide a fun safe and clean atmosphere for people to come and get the artwork they want,weather it be to hang in there home or business,or weather it be to wear for a lifetime or whether it be a fun place for people to come hang their art and receive some recognition and possibly even sell some of the work they create. In order for this unique business to stay a staple in the community,we need your help. myself and the artists who work along side me have agreed to send out prints of our work,watercolors,spraypaint,mixed medias and acrylics...all different sizes all amazing work to those of you who can help us with a donation of $200 or more,will receive a few full color prints signed and numbered so you can have a piece of this business with you. the money we receive will go 100% directly to the shop... we need to resign the lease,from there we hope to raise enough that we can have some major upgrades done throughout as well. make the art gallery a little bit more high end,we now have a 1,000 square foot art gallery,we would also like to upgrade our entryway and upgrade all of our furniture for everyones comfort while they are being tattooed. we cant thankyou enough for your support,and we hope to be a part of this community for many years to come.

.

story:
My name is Zsudayka Nzinga. I'm an artist and activist in Washington, DC.  I have been creating arts programming for at risk youth for over 10 years.  I painted a mural in a troubled neighborhood recently and was apporached by many young people who said that what they wished they could be artists and not on the streets hustling.  A lot of existing programs only focus on getting young people off the streets, not at replacing the income they are often using to care for their families.   I want to begin a program which encourages kids to take the natural gifts at selling and apply them to a skill that is legal, empowering and a long term business option.  

I was passionately discussing this program and a group listening in donated a workshop space in Brookland and a gallery space in NW DC.  All I need now, is the supplies.  The catch is, I have to use the space by the end of October.  This kinda stops me from using grants and other options  I need the community to help.  I need to raise $3000 to have this program start.  

I will choose 7 youth between 13-18 and conduct 5 workshops.  Each workshop will highlight a different aspect of painting and they will create a new piece each day.  The kids will each receive a healthy meal at the start and finish of each session.  Lessons will be 5 hours long.  Each session will feature a guest artist from the community who will be provided with a small stipend.  At the end of the workshops, the young people will learn to curate their show and will debut their work, for sale to the community.  The young people will keep all of their sales.  During the event we will collect donations to paint a community mural.

supplies- 

acrylic paint 

gesso

1 pack of brushes per participant 

 $585 

28 sm-med canvasses and 7 large $415  

 guest stipend $500   

meals $700- 70 meals at ten dollars per meal  (students will receive COOKED healthy meals.  Its important to emphasize a healthy lifestyle as well to begin shifting their self value system)

advertising $300 (5000 fliers, press release, 50 posters 12x18)

travel and teaching $500 


    We always talk about the violence in our communities, the drugs, the lack of safety and blame the youth without providing any alternatives that respect their experience.  The average young person who is involved with a gang is experiencing a safety issue or lack of familial support.  The average child selling drugs is supporting a household for various reasons.  This program is designed to provide an empowering alternative while simultaneously reinforcing the valuable tools street life provides.  The ability to sell, the discipline to spend hours creating and distributing your product is a battle every businessman faces.  Lets create youth entrepreneurs who can run businesses in communities dealing with poverty and no opportunities for work.  In Aurora, I was successful at taking at risk youth and having them create and run an arts festival.  I'd like to build that same thriving business in DC.


      I've only been in DC two years.  Making sure I find the right youth and the right community to support the final show is key.  The work needs to sell so the young people see results of their hard work.  I've included a larger marketing amount than usual because for the first event we'll be utilizing fliers and street team to bring in an audience.  I'll also send press releases but they must go out 30 days before the event to be covered.  Thus our short window to raise as much as possible.


        I'm asking 30 people to contribute $100 to the campaign.  I will send a special commemorative poster of my art to any donors.  If you only have $50, never fear, I will send a postcard of my work to show appreciation.  You only have $25, that's GREAT!  I will shoot a thank you video and read your name aloud as a contributor to be shown at the actual event.  You don't have any money?  Well I can always use help pushing the campaign.  Tag friends, email blast, repost repost repost.  If you get 5 friends to donate I'll send you a poster.

story:
Version française ci-dessous

« What we stood upon, is not just the land of our ancestors. It is the very body of our all-father. »

After Rocco, Jérémie Bonamant Teboul and Allan Carrasco, two stars of the miniatures scene, are teaming up again to produce Moloch, the tallest Figone miniature ever! This is your chance to help bring this ambitious project to life.

As aficionados of his work can attest, monsters and orcs are Allan’s specialities.
He first gave our brushes a massive mounted orc. Giants, by their proportions, are monsters which allows him to show his ability to give life to impressive miniatures.

FIGONE is a French miniatures company founded by Jérémie in 2009 and dedicated to producing and selling high quality figures for collectors, sculptors and painters. FIGONE has what it takes to make a finished sculpt commercially available.

With Indiegogo and your help to fund this huge, highly anticipated project, Rocco was born.

Moloch will be the tallest miniature ever produced by FIGONE and the one of the largest ever sculpted by Allan Carrasco.


Moloch will be a large 54mm scale miniature cast in high quality resin, the tallest ever in Figone 170mm!!!!


Here you'll see the final miniature, along with the final concept by artist Bertrand Benoit.



Don’t forget that Allan is an artist and these drawings have served as inspiration rather than a concrete blueprint. He followed them closely but added more details here and there, e.g. a larger claymore, various ornaments, slight changes on the position (back for instance).

As part of this campaign, Romain Van den Bogaert sculpted a new funny bust: Flap.
Straight from Jérémie and Romain's imagination, this bucolic character opens a very wide interpretation panel which should appeal to  artists and collectors.

"It is said that Trollus vulgaris, in order to fertilise their mushrooms, splash living beings on their heads. What's more, if they can not find something, they bludgeon themselves to bleed.
- Woaw...THAT explains a lot of things."




The Indigogo campaign will finish on beginning of november.
Allan Carrasco has started sculpting the miniature, so that we'll be able to start casting minis as soon as the main goal is reached.
The resin miniature will normally be available in december

Regular updates with WIP shots to all contributors …


The creation of a miniature of this scale requires a lot of investment in terms of time and resources. The team members make their living from painting and sculpting so a certain degree of profitability needs to be assured before they can commit to the project.

The funding we hope to gain will cover the sculpting, molding, casting, packaging and release of Moloch, Flap as well as future stretch goals and as a thank you for your support, offer the model at a discount price for contributors.

So if you want to have your own copy of this marvelous miniature or if you just want to help Moloch see the light of day, now is the time to contribute. A range of perks are proposed below to encourage those who would like to help make this project a success.


IMPORTANT NOTICE: We have a few black shirt left of Figopedia's campaign. For this campaign, we have decided to print a white shirt.

If you prefer a black version, please send us an email as soon as you have ordered your perk, we'll tell you if there are left in your size.

PLEASE NOTE THAT SHIPPING WORLDWIDE IS INCLUDED IN FOR ALL THE PERKS!


We have planned a couple of stretch goals if the funding is far above the objective.
A new Queen is planned, as well as news stickers, bigger than Figopedia's (9cm diameter) and various mushrooms to help you enhance your display bases :)





About Jérémie Bonamant Teboul

JBT is one of the best known names on the international miniatures scene. Living in Lyon, France, he has been painting miniatures for over twenty years. After working as a painter, sculptor, and art director for various miniature producers (Ilyad Games, Rackham, Kraken Edition, Artefactory) he has created his own company FIGONE (website). He is also a freelance painter and sculptor, and he has published best-selling books & DVDs on miniature painting.

Over twenty years, he has amassed a plethora of painting awards including:

  • 55 Golden Demons, 3 Slayer Swords (Germany 2004, France 2005, Canada 2006)

  • Several gold medals and Best of Show awards (Le petit Soldat [Italie], Montrouge [France], Montreux Show [Switzerland], Monte San Savino [Italie], Girona [Spain])

  • Crystal Brush 2013 Overall Winner

  • Appointed World Expo judge in 2008 (Spain)

To learn more about JBT please visit his website

About Allan Carrasco

Allan Carrasco is an internationally renowned miniature sculptor based in the south of France. He has worked as a freelance sculptor for Studio McVey, Figone, Dark Age, Enigma, Eden, Kingdom Death, Mierce Miniature, Predastore, Smart Max amongst others.

He has also collected a surfeit of trophies including:

  • Multiple Golden Demon winner

  • French Slayer Sword winner in 2008

  • Many gold medals (Le petit Soldat [Italie], Montrouge [France], Montreux Show, [Switzerland], Monte San Savino [Italie], Girona [Spain])

  • Appointed World Expo judge in 2008 (Spain)

More information on Alan and his work can be found on his website


About Bertrand Benoit

Bertrand met Allan Carrasco and Jérémie in 2003, when all three worked with Thomas David and Jacques-Alexandre Gillois, small Dream Team of Ilyad Games.
In 12 years, the bonds of friendship and art have never broken, and in parallel to his talented artistic life (Games Workshop, Ubisoft, Asmodée ...) Bertrand occasionally takes his pencils or graphical palette for Figone.
---------------------------------

Version Française

« Ce que nous foulons aux pieds, ce n'est pas seulement la terre de nos ancêtres, c'est le corps même de notre père à tous. »


Après Rocco, Jérémie Bonamant Teboul et Allan Carrasco, deux stars de la figurine, s'associent à nouveau pour réaliser Moloch, la plus grande pièce jamais produite par Figone!
Vous avez aujourd'hui l'opportunité d'aider ce projet ambitieux à voir le jour!


Les fans de son travail le savent, les monstres et les orques sont les spécialités d'Allan.
Il a d'abord offert à nos pinceaux un impressionnant orque monté.
Les géants, de part leurs proportions, sont des monstres qui lui permettent de nous montrer sa capacité à donner vie à d'impressionnantes figurines.
FIGONE est une entreprise française fondée en 2009 par Jérémie Bonamant dont la raison d'être est de produire et distribuer des figurines de très haute qualité, aussi bien pour les collectionneurs que pour les peintres ou les sculpteurs.
FIGONE est LA compagnie qui peut rendre un tel projet commercialement possible.

Via Indiegogo et avec votre aide, Figone a produit Rocco.
Aujourd'hui, Figone remet ça avec Moloch, la figurine la plus grande jamais produite par Figone, et l'une des plus grandes jamais sculptées par Allan Carrasco.


Moloch sera une impressionnante figurine de 170mm, la plus grande jamais produite par Figone. Elle sera moulée en résine polyuréthane haute qualité, afin de permettre la plus grande précision et restitution des détails de la sculpture.

Vous découvrirez, tout au long de la campagne, les évolutions de la sculpture et la pièce finie, en même temps que vous découvrez le concept de Bertrand Benoit.


N'oubliez pas qu'Allan est un artiste, et que les dessins sont plus des inspirations, plus que des exercices imposés pour lui.
Il va suivre le dessin d'assez près, mais ajoutera plus de détails, comme une épée plus grande, des ornements divers, voire quelques changements de posture.

Dans le même temps, pour cette campagne, Romain Van den Bogaert a sculpté un buste amusant: Flap.
Sorti tout droit de l'imagination fertile de nos deux trublions Jérémie et Romain, ce personnage bucolique offre un large panel d'interpêtations qui devrait ravir artistes et collectionneurs.

"On raconte que pour fertiliser leurs champignons, les Trollus Vulgaris écrasent des êtres vivants sur leur tête. Voire même, s'il ne trouvent rien, se font saigner à coup de massue.
Ca explique pas mal de trucs..."



Cette campagne s’achèvera début novembre.
Allan Carrasco a commencé à sculpter la figurine, nous serons donc en mesure de commencer à faire des tirages de la figurine dès que l'objectif principal sera atteint, ce qui devrait vous permettre de les avoir sous le sapin!

Nous posterons des visuels au fur et à mesure de l'avancement des travaux!


La réalisation d'une figurine de cette taille nécessite un investissement important, que ce soit en temps comme en ressources financières.

L'équipe derrière ce projet vit de la peinture et de la sculpture, ce qui implique que le projet soit économiquement viable avant de le lancer.

Le seuil de financement que nous avons fixé, et que nous espérons atteindre, couvrira la sculpture, le moulage, les tirages et les envois de Moloch.

Flap, de même que les futurs cadeaux additionnels, seront donc disponibles avec un coût très modique pour les contributeurs avant d'être mis en vente sur Figone plus tard. C'est notre façon de vous remercier de croire en nous et en ce projet.

De fait, si vous voulez recevoir ces merveilleuses miniatures, ou simplement aider Moloch à voir le jour, c'est le moment de contribuer!

Nous vous proposons donc une série de perks ci-dessous, pour vous encourager à nous aider!


IMPORTANT: Il nous reste quelques t-shirts noir de la campagne Figopedia. Pour Moloch, nous avons décidé de faire un t-shirt blanc, mais si vous souhaitez un noir, dans la limite des stocks restants, c'est envisageable. Contactez nous pour connaitre l'état des stocks.


LES FRAIS DE PORTS SONT INCLUS, PARTOUT DANS LE MONDE, DANS LE PRIX DES PERKS!


Nous avons prévu une série de stretch goals dans l'hypothèse où l'objectif serait largement atteint et dépassé!
Pour ceux qui ont déjà suivi les précédentes campagnes, nous proposons une nouvelle Reine, ainsi que de nouveaux autocollants, plus grands! (9cm de diamètre).
 Quelques éléments de décor, comme des champignons pour agrémenter vos dioramas, sont aussi disponibles en premier stretch.





Jérémie Bonamant Teboul

JBT est l'un des noms les plus connus dans le monde de la figurine. Il vit à Lyon, en France, et peint des figurines depuis plus de 20 ans.
Il a travaillé en temps que peintre, sculpteur et directeur artistique pour de nombreuses compagnies (Ilyad Games, Rackham, Kraken Edition, Artefactory) et a créé sa propre compagnie, FIGONE (website).
C'est aussi un peintre et sculpteur freelance,  et il a publié plusieurs livres et DVDs sur la peinture de figurines.
En plus de 20 ans, il a amassé un nombre de récompenses sur les plus grands concours internationaux:

  • 55 Golden Demons, 3 Slayer Swords (Allemagne 2004, France 2005, Canada 2006)

  • Plusieurs médailles d'or et Best of show (Le petit Soldat [Italie], Montrouge [France], Montreux Show [Suisse], Monte San Savino [Italie], Girona [Espagne])

  • Crystal Brush 2013

  • juge à la World Expo 2008 (Espagne)

Pour en savoir pus sur Jérémie, vous pouvez visiter son website

Allan Carrasco

Allan Carrasco est un sculpteur de renommée internationale, vivant dans le sud de la France. Il a travaillé en freelance pour le Studio McVey, Figone, Dark Age, Enigma, Eden, Kingdom Death, Mierce Miniature, Predastore, Smart Max parmis d'autres.

Il a aussi accumulé un nombre impressionnant de trophées tels que:

  • Plusieurs Golden Demon

  • Slayer Sword France 2008

  • Plusieurs médailles d'or (Le petit Soldat [Italie], Montrouge [France], Montreux Show, [Suisse], Monte San Savino [Italie], Girona [Espagne])

  • juge à la World Expo 2008 (Espagne)

Plus d'information sur Allan et son travail:  website


Bertrand Benoit

Bertrand a connu Allan Carrasco et Jérémie en 2003, lorsque tous trois travaillaient avec Thomas David et Jacques-Alexandre Gillois, petite Dream Team de l'entreprise Ilyad Games qui s'est éteinte depuis.
En 12 ans, les liens d'amitiés et artistique ne se sont jamais rompus, et en parallèle à sa vie artistique talentueuse (Games Workshop, Ubisoft, Asmodée...) Bertrand prête ses crayons ou sa palette graphique à Figone de temps en temps.
story_txt:
Version française ci-dessous
« What we stood upon, is not just the land of our ancestors. It is the very body of our all-father. »After Rocco, Jérémie Bonamant Teboul and
Allan Carrasco, two stars of the miniatures scene, are teaming up again to produce Moloch, the tallest Figone miniature ever! This is your chance to help bring this
ambitious project to life.
As aficionados of his work can attest,
monsters and orcs are Allan’s specialities. He first gave our brushes a massive mounted orc. Giants, by their proportions, are monsters which allows him to show his ability to give life to impressive miniatures.FIGONE is a French miniatures company
founded by Jérémie in 2009 and dedicated to producing and selling high quality
figures for collectors, sculptors and painters. FIGONE has
what it takes to make a finished sculpt commercially available.
With Indiegogo and your help to fund
this huge, highly anticipated project, Rocco was born.

Moloch will be the tallest miniature
ever produced by FIGONE and the one of the largest ever sculpted by Allan Carrasco.

Moloch will be a large 54mm
scale miniature cast in high quality resin, the tallest ever in Figone 170mm!!!! Here you'll see the final miniature, along with the final concept by artist
Bertrand Benoit.Don’t forget that Allan is an artist
and these drawings have served as inspiration rather than a concrete blueprint.
He followed them closely but added more details here and there, e.g.
a larger claymore, various ornaments, slight changes on the position (back for instance).As part of this campaign, Romain Van den Bogaert sculpted a new funny bust: Flap.Straight from Jérémie and Romain's imagination, this bucolic character opens a very wide interpretation panel which should appeal to  artists and collectors.

"It is said that Trollus 
vulgaris, in order to fertilise their mushrooms, splash living beings on
 their heads. What's more, if they can not find something, they bludgeon
 themselves to bleed.- Woaw...THAT explains a lot of things."

The Indigogo campaign will
finish on beginning of november.
Allan Carrasco has started sculpting the miniature, so that we'll be able to start casting minis as soon as the main goal is reached.
The resin miniature will normally be available in december

Regular updates with WIP shots to all
contributors …


The creation
of a miniature of this scale requires a lot of investment in terms of time and
resources. The team members make their living from painting and sculpting so a
certain degree of profitability needs to be assured before they can commit to the
project.
The funding we
hope to gain will cover the sculpting, molding, casting, packaging and release
of Moloch, Flap as well as future stretch goals and as a thank you for your support, offer the model at a discount
price for contributors.
So if you want
to have your own copy of this marvelous miniature or if you just want to help
Moloch see the light of day, now is the time to contribute. A range of perks are
proposed below to encourage those who would like to help make this project a
success.






IMPORTANT NOTICE: We have a few black shirt left of Figopedia's campaign. For this campaign, we have decided to print a white shirt. 
If you prefer a black version, please send us an email as soon as you have ordered your perk, we'll tell you if there are left in your size.




PLEASE NOTE THAT SHIPPING WORLDWIDE IS INCLUDED IN FOR ALL THE PERKS!

We have planned a couple of stretch goals if the funding is far above the objective.A new Queen is planned, as well as news stickers, bigger than Figopedia's (9cm diameter) and various mushrooms to help you enhance your display bases :)




About Jérémie Bonamant Teboul

JBT is one of the best known names on the
international miniatures scene. Living in Lyon, France, he has been painting
miniatures for over twenty years. After working as a painter, sculptor, and art
director for various miniature producers (Ilyad Games, Rackham, Kraken Edition,
Artefactory) he has created his own company FIGONE (website). He is also a freelance painter
and sculptor, and he has published best-selling books & DVDs on miniature
painting.Over twenty years, he has
amassed a plethora of painting awards including:

55 Golden Demons, 3 Slayer Swords (Germany 2004, France 2005,
     Canada 2006)
Several gold medals and Best of Show awards (Le petit Soldat
     [Italie], Montrouge [France], Montreux Show [Switzerland], Monte San
     Savino [Italie], Girona [Spain])
Crystal Brush 2013 Overall Winner
Appointed World Expo judge in 2008 (Spain)

To
learn more about JBT please visit his website
About Allan Carrasco

Allan Carrasco is an
internationally renowned miniature sculptor based in the south of France. He
has worked as a freelance sculptor for Studio McVey, Figone, Dark Age, Enigma,
Eden, Kingdom Death, Mierce Miniature, Predastore, Smart Max amongst others. 

He has also collected a surfeit of trophies including:

Multiple Golden Demon winner
French Slayer Sword winner in 2008
Many
     gold medals (Le petit Soldat [Italie], Montrouge [France], Montreux Show, [Switzerland], Monte San Savino [Italie], Girona
     [Spain])
Appointed World Expo judge in 2008 (Spain)



More information on Alan and his work can be found on his website
About Bertrand Benoit



Bertrand met Allan Carrasco and Jérémie in 2003, when all three worked with Thomas David and Jacques-Alexandre Gillois, small Dream Team of Ilyad Games. In 12 years, the bonds of friendship and art have never broken, and in parallel to his talented artistic life (Games Workshop, Ubisoft, Asmodée ...) Bertrand occasionally takes his pencils or graphical palette for Figone.---------------------------------






Version Française





« Ce que nous foulons aux pieds, ce n'est pas seulement la terre de nos ancêtres, c'est le corps même de notre père à tous. »
Après Rocco, Jérémie Bonamant Teboul et
Allan Carrasco, deux stars de la figurine, s'associent à nouveau pour réaliser Moloch, la plus grande pièce jamais produite par Figone!Vous avez aujourd'hui l'opportunité d'aider ce projet ambitieux à voir le jour!
Les fans de son travail le savent, les monstres et les orques sont les spécialités d'Allan.Il a d'abord offert à nos pinceaux un impressionnant orque monté.Les géants, de part leurs proportions, sont des monstres qui lui permettent de nous montrer sa capacité à donner vie à d'impressionnantes figurines.FIGONE est une entreprise française fondée en 2009 par Jérémie Bonamant dont la raison d'être est de produire et distribuer des figurines de très haute qualité, aussi bien pour les collectionneurs que pour les peintres ou les sculpteurs.FIGONE est LA compagnie qui peut rendre un tel projet commercialement possible. Via Indiegogo et avec votre aide, Figone a produit Rocco. Aujourd'hui, Figone remet ça avec Moloch, la figurine la plus grande jamais produite par Figone, et l'une des plus grandes jamais sculptées par Allan Carrasco.


Moloch sera une impressionnante figurine de 170mm, la plus grande jamais produite par Figone. Elle sera moulée en résine polyuréthane haute qualité, afin de permettre la plus grande précision et restitution des détails de la sculpture.




Vous découvrirez, tout au long de la campagne, les évolutions de la sculpture et la pièce finie, en même temps que vous découvrez le concept de Bertrand Benoit.N'oubliez pas qu'Allan est un artiste, et que les dessins sont plus des inspirations, plus que des exercices imposés pour lui.Il va suivre le dessin d'assez près, mais ajoutera plus de détails, comme une épée plus grande, des ornements divers, voire quelques changements de posture.Dans le même temps, pour cette campagne, Romain Van den Bogaert a sculpté un buste amusant: Flap.Sorti tout droit de l'imagination fertile de nos deux trublions Jérémie et Romain, ce personnage bucolique offre un large panel d'interpêtations qui devrait ravir artistes et collectionneurs.
"On raconte que pour fertiliser leurs champignons, les Trollus Vulgaris écrasent des êtres vivants sur leur tête. Voire même, s'il ne trouvent rien, se font saigner à coup de massue.Ca explique pas mal de trucs..."

Cette campagne s’achèvera début novembre.
Allan Carrasco a commencé à sculpter la figurine, nous serons donc en mesure de commencer à faire des tirages de la figurine dès que l'objectif principal sera atteint, ce qui devrait vous permettre de les avoir sous le sapin! Nous posterons des visuels au fur et à mesure de l'avancement des travaux!

La réalisation d'une figurine de cette taille nécessite un investissement important, que ce soit en temps comme en ressources financières.
L'équipe derrière ce projet vit de la peinture et de la sculpture, ce qui implique que le projet soit économiquement viable avant de le lancer.
Le seuil de financement que nous avons fixé, et que nous espérons atteindre, couvrira la sculpture, le moulage, les tirages et les envois de Moloch. 
Flap, de même que les futurs cadeaux additionnels, seront donc disponibles avec un coût très modique pour les contributeurs avant d'être mis en vente sur Figone plus tard. C'est notre façon de vous remercier de croire en nous et en ce projet.
De fait, si vous voulez recevoir ces merveilleuses miniatures, ou simplement aider Moloch à voir le jour, c'est le moment de contribuer!
Nous vous proposons donc une série de perks ci-dessous, pour vous encourager à nous aider!





IMPORTANT: Il nous reste quelques t-shirts noir de la campagne Figopedia. Pour Moloch, nous avons décidé de faire un t-shirt blanc, mais si vous souhaitez un noir, dans la limite des stocks restants, c'est envisageable. Contactez nous pour connaitre l'état des stocks.

Nous avons prévu une série de stretch goals dans l'hypothèse où l'objectif serait largement atteint et dépassé!Pour ceux qui ont déjà suivi les précédentes campagnes, nous proposons une nouvelle Reine, ainsi que de nouveaux autocollants, plus grands! (9cm de diamètre). Quelques éléments de décor, comme des champignons pour agrémenter vos dioramas, sont aussi disponibles en premier stretch.

JBT est l'un des noms les plus connus dans le monde de la figurine. Il vit à Lyon, en France, et peint des figurines depuis plus de 20 ans. Il a travaillé en temps que peintre, sculpteur et directeur artistique pour de nombreuses compagnies (Ilyad Games, Rackham, Kraken Edition,

55 Golden Demons, 3 Slayer Swords (Allemagne 2004, France 2005,

Plusieurs médailles d'or et Best of show (Le petit Soldat
     [Italie], Montrouge [France], Montreux Show [Suisse], Monte San
     Savino [Italie], Girona [Espagne])
Crystal Brush 2013 
juge à la World Expo 2008 (Espagne)

Pour en savoir pus sur Jérémie, vous pouvez visiter son website

Allan Carrasco est un sculpteur de renommée internationale, vivant dans le sud de la France. Il a travaillé en freelance pour le Studio McVey, Figone, Dark Age, Enigma,
Eden, Kingdom Death, Mierce Miniature, Predastore, Smart Max parmis d'autres. 

Il a aussi accumulé un nombre impressionnant de trophées tels que:

Plusieurs Golden Demon
Slayer Sword France 2008
Plusieurs médailles d'or (Le petit Soldat [Italie], Montrouge [France], Montreux Show, [Suisse], Monte San Savino [Italie], Girona
     [Espagne])
juge à la World Expo 2008 (Espagne)



Plus d'information sur Allan et son travail:  website

Allan Carrasco et Jérémie en 2003, lorsque tous trois travaillaient avec

story:
What is La Figlia ART House

This is an art house in the remote hills of Fraine, Italy dedicated to the creation of art. It is a 2 bedroom house with a 900 sqft dance room (wood floors and mirrors), a 200 sqft painting, sculpting etc. room AND a large 900 sqft terrace overlooking the amazing countryside of Fraine, Italy! There is also an amazing beach 25 minutes down hill! Artists will have the entire home to themselves one group at a time to create. I will also be providing artists with 2 sets of the ear me now translation ear buds: two earpieces to be worn by two people who do not speak the same language and uses an app so the duo can converse with ease in real time.
 

What is a residency

A residency program invites artists to live in a specific locale and spend a period of time intensively working on self-directed projects.

 

About the area

The town Fraine, is in the province of Chieti, Abruzzo in the center of Italy. Just hrs from Rome, Florence, Naples etc, yet in a rural remote region with breathtaking views and where you can really experience real Italian culture. There are only 1000 inhabitants in this town. There is also a beautiful beach 25 minutes down hill.

The province, Chieti, is amongst the most ancient of Italian cities. Founded by the greeks, this is a pre-Roman town but eventually was taken over by the Romans. In 1806 Chieti was turned into a fortress by Napoleon's France. In 1860 it became part of the newly created Kingdom of Italy.  Allied forces liberated the city on June 9, 1944, one day after the Germans left the city. 

There are many museums and beautiful churches to visit while in Abruzzo.

 

Why I need your support

This is a dream come true for me, to provide an inspirational space for artists to create work. "LA Figlia" means "the daughter". This house, this work, this long time dream is dedicated to my daughter. To see the growth and work that will come out of the artists experience at La Figlia, will be a continuing inspiration to me and my family. 

I have just started the process of purchasing this amazing house. This is a huge and exciting undertaking for me. I'm reaching out to you because my offer was accepted by the owner of this house and at the same time one of my funders backed out.  I really need all the help I can get to close this deal. 

 Any money you give is going to this great project and just take a look at these perks I'm offering!!

 

Where the money is going

- I need $15,000 to close this deal and give to the realtor. My family and I are covering the rest and we are also covering the repairs needed to make this property Artist ready.

REPAIRS

The installation of the wood floors, mirror and stereo - $3,500

Getting the bathroom updated - $2,500

Painting- $450

 

Opportunity

This is a great opportunity for artists to see history, to see archeological artifacts (so many still being uncovered) and most of all ART unlike any other! Italy is an exciting mecca of ART and CULTURE. It's rich with inspiration.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Friends, if you can't contribute monetarily, please share this campaign. It will mean the world to me.  Thank you for reading, sharing and considering!

You can check out some of the paintings from my PERKS. Here: http://iamdomenech.com

story:
Victoria Holman Art Notecards
  •     My name is Victoria and I have been an artist and musician all my life. My paintings are inspired by the great children's book illustrators of the 19th century like Arthur Rackam, Edmund Dulac and Kay Nielsen and my artworks have charmed both children and adults for many years. And now I would like to publish my work as notecards so that everyone can afford and enjoy my art. If you would like to read more about me and my work please go to www.victoriaholman.com

    Mermaids, Fairies and Geishas, Oh My!

         My Dream

     Publishing my artwork as notecards is something that I have wanted to do for a long time and I have posted photos above of the prototypes for my fairy and mermaid collections so that you can see how they will look. I have had some interest from Whole Foods Markets and Mother's Markets in Southern California to carry my cards. The cost of printing these cards is $4,000  (500 each of various images with envelopes ) 

    Gifts for You

    For your generous donation it would be my pleasure to send you gifts of notecards, prints, gicles or, for those of you who are collectors of original artwork , I am happy to send photos of available paintings. All my works are in watercolor and are painted on 22" X 30" sheets of Arches 300 pound watercolor paper.
             It is also my hope that I will raise over the amount that I've made my goal as I would dearly love to print some of my unpublished works,to purchase a printer/scanner, some good easels, sample gicles, some badly needed frames and a modest brochure for marketing.

              Challenges and Risks

          There are no challenges to my project. I have all digital files of my work and an excellent printing company here on Maui. I have a lot of experience in packing and shipping orders and plenty of integrity where clients are concerned. I am a hard worker with a history of strong sales and I believe that with a little support from generous donors like you that I have an excellent chance of reaching my goals.

story:
Short Summary

Hello My name is Amandla Baraka. 

I was recently accepted into the Creative Minds in Cannes film program; which will be held in Cannes, France from May 13th, 2013-May 26th, 2013. The Creative Minds in Cannes film program is an amazing opportunity for exceptional students to piece together a film with a carefully selected group and have it viewed by, critiqued by, and showcased to film industry professionals. It also provides me with the opportunity to mingle with professionals and network with attendees/participants of the Cannes Film Festival.

The registration fee for the program totals to $2899.00 and round trip travel fees will range anywhere between $900 to $1000. I have until February 14th, 2013 to pay the registration fee IN FULL. I am reaching out because it is my understanding that you have the ability to help me gain the financial assistance that I urgently need, even if it isn't the entire amount. I will appreciate ANY assistance available. If you have more questions I may be reached via cell, email, or both. Phone: 301-525-1991 Email: amandlabaraka@yahoo.com. You may also refer to the official CMIC website http://www.creativemindgroup.com

 When I initially heard of the program, I knew this was an opportunity to exhibit my well-studied scriptwriting abilities. The CMIC recruitment team believed in me and gave me a chance. All I am asking is that you do the same.

THANK YOUS!

• A big THANK YOU to my cousin Andaiye! She was my first contributor!
