The Creative Minds in Cannes film program is an amazing opportunity for exceptional students to piece together a film with a carefully selected group and have it viewed by, critiqued by, and showcased to film industry professionals. It also provides me with the opportunity to mingle with professionals and network with attendees/participants of the Cannes Film Festival.
The registration fee for the program totals to $2899.00 and round trip travel fees will range anywhere between $900 to $1000. I have until February 14th, 2013 to pay the registration fee IN FULL. I am reaching out because it is my understanding that you have the ability to help me gain the financial assistance that I urgently need, even if it isn't the entire amount. I will appreciate ANY assistance available. If you have more questions I may be reached via cell, email, or both. Phone: 301-525-1991 Email: amandlabaraka@yahoo.com. You may also refer to the official CMIC website http://www.creativemindgroup.com
 When I initially heard of the program, I knew this was an opportunity to exhibit my well-studied scriptwriting abilities. The CMIC recruitment team believed in me and gave me a chance. All I am asking is that you do the same.


THANK YOUS!
• A big THANK YOU to my cousin Andaiye! She was my first contributor!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Danielle Draik and after I get home from my day job, I go into my cave (my basement) and I get to work. My artwork has always been unsettling, intentionally or not, and apparently there are some people who really dig it! Responses to my work have been seriously overwhelming and now I get to make a piece that can tour the world!

Funds raised will help me get my ass to Boston safely and make some fine art that you can peep.  

What We Need & What You Get

What I could use some help on:

  • Gas & Tolls
  • Lodging (I'd sleep in my car, but I'm gonna have a 5 foot plank of wood in it ¯\_(ツ)_/¯)
  • Materials! Quality materials for quality art!

What you get:

There are some gifts for you to choose from!

  • Successful Ritual enamel pins

  • Prints! So many prints

  • A small, hand pulled linocut version of Successful Ritual
  • A limited version run of a cast sculpture - From Both Sides

  • Art books/Zines

  • Buttons

AND MUCH MUCH MORE WAOW!

WOO ART YEAH!

If, for some reason, the campaign reaches 1,000$, a gold version of the Successful Ritual enamel pin will be available (this is funding + bare minimum to get these run). All who chose the enamel pin option will get the choice between their color. Please note your choice of gold will delay estimated enamel pin shipping times.

 

The Impact

Real talk: right now, I can't afford to have my work travel far. Crating and shipping artwork costs a lot, as do application fees and hours of legwork. The "starving artist" trope does come from some truth. With BIG INK, I'll be able to reach places I cannot financially right now. And donators will be the first to know when and where you can see my work!

Not only will I be able to "be on tour", I will be applying for grad school in the very near future. This opportunity, and your desire to make my dreams feasible, shows to admissions that not only can I make a body of work - people want it out there!

 

Risks & Challenges

This is technically my largest woodcut and printmaking venture to date, but I am no stranger to big work! I just got finished doing a mixed-media mural standing at 10x16 feet. Not only that, I'll be finishing up an 8 foot figure I've been working on for a while now. I'm really excited for this particular venture that I can fit in my studio!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’re not in a position to give money or time but like the cause, please feel free to share it with your friends! You can share the campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word!

story:
GLeo - Invited Artist

"You have the virtue, I mean you really are privileged to make a living doing what you love. This is a privileged life is giving you, no one else. It is life giving you that privilege because even though you make a living from painting you meet others who have a thousand jobs AND also paint. Painting is your job...you get up in the morning, drink a cup of coffee and what do you have to do? Paint. If life is giving you this privilege, then what is the best way to honor and be thankful for life for such a gift? Doing it better every time." - GLeo, video



The street artist GLeo, born and raised in Cali - Colombia, is one of the most thrilling figures of the new Latin American urban art scene. Contemplating one of her huge painted walls is an experience comparable to reading a fantastic book. You will get to meet with bright and colorful creatures, wearing freaky masks that will bring you back in the time of Colombia's original cultures. Right after this, you will have a chance to plunge into every one of the magic details GLeo paints, only with rollers and brushes, that make her imaginary worlds so complete and enchanting. And when the book closes, the return to earth can be a little bit dreary.

Learn more:
https://www.facebook.com/Gleoarte
http://www.instagram.com/gleo_co
 

The Grain Elevator Mural

Over the next several weeks artist GLeo and team will paint this! Making it the LARGEST MURAL in the WORLD!
 

About Horizontes

HORIZONTES is an artist-driven, community engagement art project that aims to connect two underrepresented neighborhoods in north Wichita, the predominantly Latino NorthEnd and historically African American Northeast neighborhoods, which are both physically and psychologically separated by interstate highway I-135 and large grain elevators along the industrial corridor.
 

Help us meet our HORIZON!

Your donation is helping pay direct costs of equipment rental, which runs $7,000 a month for three boom lifts. Plus, we are out in the elements painting and working hard each day, and for that we needed a storage container to provide a space to organize our materials and for our team to take a break and warm up. The rental runs at $1,000. Our paint budget has increased due to unforeseen issues with the surface and size of the grain elevator. For this, we need an additional $6,000 to cover the cost of paint.

  • $7,000 x 3 : Equipment Rental
  • $6,000 : Paint and materials
  • $1,000 : On-site storage

We appreciate your efforts in helping us raise $15,000. We seek to match this contribution from private donations and sponsorships for a total of $28,000.
 

What you get from helping us!

We appreciate the support, and for that, we want to give back! We are offering some cool perks and a shout-out to each of you that help!

Giving levels

$1-$49 : Partners website listing + social media shout-out

$50: Horizontes postcard (TBA) and sticker pack + ALL THE ABOVE



$100 : GLeo sticker pack + ALL THE ABOVE



$500 : Grain Elevator Mural design screen print (TBA) + Horizontes Sticker and Postcard Packs

$1000 : GLeo select fine art print (TBA) + Horizontes Sticker and Postcard Packs

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can afford to donate. That's okay! What you CAN do is help us spread the word. Simply sharing the link to your friends and family on ANY social media can help us reach our goal.
 

Questions? Concerns?

We are always here to answer your questions and to address your concerns.
 

Learn more about Horizontes!

www.horizontes-project.com
www.instagram.com/horizontes.project
www.facebook.com/horizontes.project

THANK YOU

story:
Who, Why, and When

I'm a sculptor blazing a trail in a the highly unsual media of wool and felt, and now I'm branching out into interactive public art. I've been active in the California Bay Area art community for 16 years, and I've exhibited my work all over the world.

People often yearn to touch my visibly soft and mysterious felted wool sculpture, and when I invite them to do so it causes friends and strangers alike to interact with each other in fleeting moments of shared wonder. I want to make that happen more, on a larger scale.  For over two years I've been working on a gallery exhibition of uniquely touchable large-scale sculpture. By enlisting the help of community volunteers in the hands-on artmaking, 'InTouch' is already becoming a successful experiment in getting audiences to connect with the art and each other. 

In six months 'InTouch' will debut as a free public art exhibition at Santa Clara University's de Saisset Museum, where it will show for 20 weeks and reach upwards of 8,000 visitors. As I head into the home stretch I'm looking for more partners to help me finish funding the project. I've already raised $17K of this $40K project; I'm turning to Indiegogo to help finish it.

I'm so excited to present 'InTouch'-- I can hardly wait to observe how visitors react and interact with the sculpture I’ve been planning and making for over two years. For me, the audience response will be a big part of the artwork.

What I Need & What You Get

Between materials, labor, and workspace, spread out over two years 'InTouch' is a $40K self-funded venture. I’ve already raised $17K through direct donations from individuals, some small grants, and sales of related work. With the addition of significant in-kind donations from the venue, the remaining costs add up to $15K. I’m looking to my wider network to find kindred spirits who want to be a part of making this happen and raise the remaining $15K to bring this project to completion. Funds will be used to construct a steel framework to suspend the 'Hanging Pod' sculptures (since the ceiling of the museum turns out not to be an option), to pay studio assistants, and rent for my studio workspace. See the FAQs for more info.

The perks I'm offering highlight another unique facet of my work: reproductions of 'wool drawings' I create by pushing wool through paper. Additionally I'm offering catalogs and some private events, workshops, and tours to invite you in behind the scenes.

Risks & Challenges

This project has been an experiment from the very beginning: what that means is that nothing quite like it ever existed, and I've been making it all up as I go. 

Happily that fundamental challenge is one I've been in the habit of facing and overcoming throughout my 16-year career as a sculptor. Artists have to learn to be comfortable with confidently following their creative impulses without always knowing what the results will be. We pick up skills, resources, experience, and helpers along the way. We educate ourselves and learn what questions to ask. And we pay close attention to the successes and 'failures'-- which generally are nonfatal learning experiences that we carry forward into the next iteration.

I’m applying lessons from all sorts of past experiences with materials, processes, and people to make this new, larger, touchable, public work-- and it’s coming along brilliantly.

We artists also get a lot of flack for being too focused on the creative side to the detriment of business skills-- but I'm here to tell you that to work as a solvent artist over time takes all the same skills as being a CEO with way less of the acknowledgement. 

There’s a section I love in Andrew Simonet’s book Making It that addresses the myth that Artists Are Bad With Money: 

  • “It started because artists, unlike much of the world, are not primarily motivated or controlled by money. Artists are actually amazing with money, but we usually don’t have enough of it.  In the for-profit world, someone gives you a project and 100% of the budget necessary to complete it. If you deliver the project on time you are genius, a brilliant manager, and you have a job for life.  In the arts, you have a project and somewhere between 0% and 50% of the budget needed, and you still deliver the project on time. That makes you a double genius. Making art with limited resources requires incredible financial skill.”

I’m not only the lead artist and creative developer on this project, I’m also the project manager, marketer, public relations manager, personnel manager, and fundraiser. And I have a track record of success from other projects in all of those realms. This is a bigger project than I’ve ever attempted before, but it follows on years of building up to this scale. And the myriad personal connections I’ve made throughout the process of bringing 'InTouch' to life are helping in each realm. I have a lot of volunteers and supporters on my side. So the only risk at this point is in me not reaching out to everyone who might care about this project to ensure it gets fully funded. 

That's not a risk I'm going to take.

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not be able to contribute to this campaign financially right now, but ther are other ways you can help:

  • Spread the  word to let other like-minded people know about this campaign.
  • Volunteer at one of my 'Felting Parties' to help finish the surfaces of the sculptures.

That's not a risk I'm going to take.

Other Ways You Can Help
You may not be able to contribute to this campaign financially right now, but ther are other ways you can help:

Spread the  word to let other like-minded people know about this campaign.
Volunteer at one of my 'Felting Parties' to help finish the surfaces of the sculptures.

story:
THE STORY

Every year, Hamiltonian organizes an experimental group exhibition called Fellows Converge in which the artists participating in the Hamiltonian Fellowship program contemplate and create new work in collaboration based on the premise of a selected guest curator.

Contrary to the fellows' annual solo exhibitions at Hamiltonian Gallery, Fellows Converge  seeks to create a highly collaborative environment to encourage the fellows to reevaluate their standard studio practices and engage in critical self-examination of their work, materials and processes.

This year, Elsewhere, a living museum and award-winning artist residency program in Greensboro, NC, has invited our fellows to participate in a two-day artistic retreat in preparation for Fellows Converge this year. There, the fellows will engage with Elsewhere's unique collection of objects, discuss their struggles around materials and ideas and participate in a series of artistic and collaborative exercises that will encourage each artist to grow their practice and take new artistic leaps through experimentation and collaboration.

 To distill from this multi-layered and meaningful experience, each fellow will create an original work of art, culminating in the annual group exhibition at Hamiltonian Gallery from November 7th to December 19th, 2015.

   

OUR ASK

Two full days of guided workshops, community meals and accommodation at Elsewhere costs $100 per artist.

While we already have our travel expenses covered, we are looking to raise $1,000 from our community of Hamiltonian Friends and Family to help make this retreat a reality for all ten Hamiltonian Fellows.

YOUR IMPACT

Your support will make this artistic retreat possible but, above all, provide each fellow with an unique opportunity to:

  • collaborate and connect
  • have space and time for reflection, research and production
  • experiment with new materials
  • immerse in another mode of working
  • explore his/her practice in community
  • be inspired by new surroundings and people


Thank you for helping us to provide our fellows with this once in a lifetime experience!  Every donation - small and large -  will go a long way and is greatly appreciated!

Thank you!


Hamiltonian Artists is a 501(c)3 organization dedicated to advancing the professional development of emerging visual artists. We offer a competitive, two-year fellowship program and free professional development lectures and workshops for artists. Our programs are made possible through the generous support of the National Endowment for the Arts, The Share Fund, Hamiltonian Capital members and individual donations.

Hamiltonian Gallery is a dynamic space in the heart of the growing Washington, DC contemporary arts district. The gallery focuses on innovative works by emerging and mid-career artists. Gallery hours are Tuesday - Saturday, 12 pm - 6 pm.

story:
* * INTRO // HEART * * 

I've been making art in one form or another for the entirety of my life; it's my blood. At this time, and with the help of a successful campaign, I want to become much more accessible as an artist in the world. I am applying to perform at a festival in the UK in 2016, for example. It also feels really important for me to connect with established creative communities here in Costa Rica :: what up San José, Samara, and Nosara?! Additionally, I'm working with a team of folks to bring a performing arts festival to my current neighborhood here in Costa Rica. 

... "I think an important part of your *fundraising story* is how your work plays a role in the legacy of women performance artists, and you are carrying that forward by documenting your work and bringing it to a wider audience." ~ Marissa

While I will always work to put my personal body of work out into the world, I want to clarify that collaboration is a huge part of my process. Working with community members, friends, and fellow artists is my jam! You will note that this campaign is about supporting the launch of my small business, the making of a performance art film, and the birth of my first solo art show, which is all quite personal, but, this campaign has some underlying perks that I wish to point out. My communities have the opportunity to attend art events that are otherwise not a part of "the scene" here. In time, I'd also like to offer art workshops to children.

Art is necessity for those of us born to make it, but it's also an incredible offering of beauty and healing for those who choose to view it. As Hannah Mermaid says, "We live in a time where radical creativity is needed more than ever." And as Queen Erykah Badu says, "Thank y'all for letting us come up here to share our art, because this is our heart. This is my heart that I'm sharing with you. This is therapy for me right here." ... It's about all of us, loves ~ Artist to Audience. Audience to Artist. Person to Person, empowering and inspiring. Can you feel me? ... Now read on for details about our campaign!

* * The Campaign ~ "WE REALLY WANT THIS!"

My campaign has 3 tiers. The first tier is in support of my small business officially launching. Income from this venture not only supports my cost of living, but my on-going creative projects.

The second tier proposes that my dear friend from Austin, TX, come down to Costa Rica to make a short performance art film with me. This film will represent one movement of an on-going performance art project that I am in the midst of. This project is called, "new/mind/ritualz." You can read about it here. Learn about my collaborator here.

The third tier proposes that our film debuts as part of my first solo art show. At my show, framed performance art stills, videos, and installations will be on display. I'd additionally give a live performance.

While I am initially excited to build this 3-tiered project from the ground up, I also look to the future. I believe that this model (filming a project and debuting it within a community) is an easily transferable model. I can travel to African or Iceland or Costa Rica's Caribbean to film and collaborate, and give back art workshops to children, invite community/tribe members to collaborate, and when all is said and done, give back an art show.

This campaign coming true, for me, would be the stepping stone into a lovely **new phase of life.** I intend to flourish as a working artist, and you can help me jump-start this excursion by supporting us.

Below are some references for you. I discuss business goals, share a supply list, and our budget.

BLOG ARTICLE: "business notes 4 INDIEGOGO" - HERE.

BLOG ARTICLE: "KICKSTARTER SUPPLIES + NUMBERS" - HERE

* * Risks and challenges * *

My perspective is incredibly hopeful + positive. I trust in my ability and in the ability of my collaborator to work well together, which we've been doing with ease for years. However, unanticipated challenges (life happens!) would be addressed with clear communication, flexibility, and the intent to persevere.

Some possible challenges might include working with and around the weather. It is rainy season here in Costa Rica, which means we'd have a potential afternoon shower to contend with. Also, Jason is traveling away from home, so we have to very wisely use the week+ we have together to meet all of our creative goals. It will be necessary to do a lot of planning, scripting, and chatting before his trip. Lastly, I acknowledge that building my small business from the ground up will be hard work; I'm ready! There will likely be a bit of a learning curve when it comes to using Etsy, filing paperwork, or doing whatever tasks need to be done to legitimize my business. I am blessed to have friends and mentors who will see me through these processes, though.

Something to consider, dear audience, is that I've worked independently for years on creative projects. I even designed by own major in Performance Art ~ I live for this stuff! Arte es mi sangre! I have a good track record and high rate of productivity, because I am innately motivated to do this work. Gracias!!

At this time, and with the help of a successful campaign, I want to become much more accessible as an artist in the world. I am applying to perform at a festival in the UK in 2016, for example. It also feels really important for me to connect with established creative communities here in Costa Rica :: what up San José, Samara, and Nosara?! Additionally, I'm working with a team of folks to bring a performing arts festival to my current neighborhood here in Costa Rica. ... "I think an important part of your *fundraising story* is how your work 
plays a role in the legacy of women performance artists, and you are 
carrying that forward by documenting your work and bringing it to a 
wider audience." ~ MarissaWhile I will always work to put my personal body of work out into the world, I want to clarify that collaboration is a huge part of my process. Working with community members, friends, and fellow artists is my jam! You will note that this campaign is about supporting the launch of my small business, the making of a performance art film, and the birth of my first solo art show, which is all quite personal, but, this campaign has some underlying perks that I wish to point out. My communities have the opportunity to attend art events that are otherwise not a part of "the scene" here. In time, I'd also like to offer art workshops to children.Art is necessity for those of us born to make it, but it's also an incredible offering of beauty and healing for those who choose to view it. As Hannah Mermaid says, "We live in a time where radical creativity is needed more than ever." And as Queen Erykah Badu says, "Thank y'all for letting us come up here to share our art,
because this is our heart. This is my heart that I'm sharing with
you. This is therapy for me right here."  ... It's about all of us, loves ~ Artist to Audience. Audience to Artist. Person to Person, empowering and inspiring. Can you feel me? ... Now read on for details about our campaign!* * The Campaign ~ "WE REALLY WANT THIS!"My campaign has 3 tiers. The first tier is in support
of my small business officially launching. Income from this venture
not only supports my cost of living, but my on-going creative
projects.The second tier proposes that my dear friend from Austin, TX, come
down to Costa Rica to make a short performance art film with me. This
film will represent one movement of an on-going performance art
project that I am in the midst of. This project is called,
"new/mind/ritualz." You can read about it here.
Learn about my collaborator here.
The third tier proposes that our film debuts as part of my first
solo art show. At my show, framed performance art stills, videos, and
installations will be on display. I'd additionally give a live
performance.

this model (filming a project and debuting it within a community) is

story:
Words Matter 2.0 is a collaboration bringing together writers, artists and performers in the Memphis area. 

Half a dozen groups in WM 2.0 bring a vibrant mix of artistic disciplines to their projects. They all start with words: a literary work from the writer in each group. From there, the others — visual artists, musicians, dancers, actors and filmmakers —  find collective expression from the language.

It culminates in an event Sept. 6, 2014 at the Jay Etkin Gallery with readings, performances, screenings and displays.

There are, otherwise, no creative rules. The success of this project will be in terms of the artists creating their best work. The collaborative aspect is a tool that can allow the artists to find inspiration from others and build on it as much as they desire. 

Last year's successful debut of Words Matter had 20 artists in four groups showing and exhibiting their works in an evening of performances, talks, film, music and dance.

Proceeds from ticket sales to the Sept. 6 event will benefit Literacy Mid-South, whose literacy programs are invaluable in strengthening this community. (http://www.literacymidsouth.org).

The event also serves to spotlight the organization's Mid-South Book Festival on Sept. 27 at the Memphis Botanic Garden. (http://www.midsouthbookfest.org)

We're using IndieGoGo to get funds to help us with the costs of putting on the event. Your contribution is crucial to helping make this happen, a collaboration of Memphis artists doing what they love to do -- and providing a terrific representation of this town's creative talent.

The campaign's deadline is the day of the show: Sept. 6. We can't do it without the encouragement of Memphis arts lovers, and with some money to make it possible. 

Perks include a special edition of the literary works and other artworks.

story:
Hello everyone, my name is Kevin Imbali chimasia. Am a self-taught fine artist in Nairobi, Kenya. You can view some of my art here http://kevin-chimasia.fineartamerica.com/ and here http://youtu.be/K5aBxo1Q0SY

I started this campaign seeking to raise $800 which should go into buying art supplies, renting a studio space and building my own website.

The supplies will go a long way into ensuring that am able to work consistently and make more that will help expand my portfolio. An ample studio space will be very important because then I will have a place where I can sit down and paint any time, all the time.

And for the website, it will be a channel for creating a market for my art. As much as I will make good use of all the other websites that sell art online, my own website will be much detailed in terms of what I have done and also be able to list upcoming events.

I will also link it to the many social websites to make sure that I put my art out to a larger audiences which in turn will create sales of both the original paintings and prints.

The idea is to be able to make more african-themed paintings consistently and to come up with a way of generating sales. That is the only sure way of ensuring that my art business grows into a sustainable venture as detailed in this video http://youtu.be/XHnd4sKq1G8

The actualization of all my creative ideas is hinged on the success of this campaign. Be a part of my ambition and efforts by contributing whatever amount that you can. We only have 20 days to hit the target, it is possible. Thanks a lot in advance for your support. Most kind regards from Kenya.

story:
My name is Noah Geiger and I'm a sculpture major at the Kansas City Art Institute. I grew up in Rapid City, South Dakota, and Art has been my life. My father is a working artist and graphic designer, his father is still a working architect, and I plan on joining these ranks after I graduate.

This is a link to a documentation of some of my work from my time at KCAI: noahgeigerart.tumblr.com and you can also follow me on Instagram: @ngeiger.
This campaign is to help me raise money for a flight to Germany this summer so that I can visit my girlfriend. She is German and we met when she spent a year abroad in my home town. We've been together since. She and I only get to see each other twice a year, during summer and winter break, and being that I'm a full time student attending an expensive school, I don't normally have much extra to spare financially.
This trip won't be strictly a recreational trip however, every trip I've taken to see her has drastically informed my practice and my art education both historically and visually. She and I attended galleries and museums alike, seeing artists from the Masters, German expressionists, modern and contemporary exhibitions, and so much more. She actually already has plans for me to see exhibitions with Otto Piene, Andy Warhol, Max Beckmann, Marc Chagall, Edgar Degas, Alberto Giacometti, Wassily Kandinsky, Jackson Pollock, Pablo Picasso, Mark Rothko, and Egon Schiele. 
This trip will be a tremendous way for me to grow as an artist as well as spend the summer with my wonderful girlfriend. I hope to share my work with you all in the future, and thank you for your interest.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I need $1000 to help me purchase an international flight. I have some money saved to help my travels, but I being that I'm a full time student I don't have much financial flexibility. 
  • If you support my trip, I'll send you a signed single-run photographic print of my sculptural work. The prints will also come in sets of three and six depending on the perk level that you choose.
  • If I don't reach my goal, the funds from this project will still aid me in traveling to Germany, but as of the start of this campaign, I'll be honest in saying that I'm not sure how I'll be able to get there without your help.

Other Ways You Can Help

Thanks for taking the time to look through my campaign! If you cannot contribute but are still interested in helping me, I would love it if you would share this campaign with your friends and family. Indiegogo makes that pretty easy with their share tools. Thanks again!

This is a link to a documentation of some of my work from my time at KCAI: noahgeigerart.tumblr.com and you can also follow me on Instagram: @ngeiger.

story:
Die :.PixelHELPER International SARL hat es sich zur Aufgabe gemacht, gegen Ungerechtigkeiten vorzugehen

Bei einer Summe von 2.000€ werden wir eine Lichtkunstkarikatur auf ein Gebäude projizieren und die entstandenen Fotos und Videos der Aktion medienwirksam verteilen. Wir können alternativ auch eine Aktivismus Drohne mit 8 Lautsprechern für weitreichende Aufmerksamkeit einsetzen. Je nach Inhalt der Aktion haben wir viele alternative Möglichkeiten für eine Umsetzung.

Eines unserer großen Themen ist der Verbraucherschutz. 

Um für den Verbraucherschutz zu demonstrieren, hat Licht- und Aktionskünstler Oliver Bienkowski bereits mehrfach mit provokativen Kunstaktionen auf diesen Missstand aufmerksam gemacht. Zahlreiche Medien berichteten darüber. 

Um auch in Zukunft dafür zu kämpfen und Licht- und Kunstaktionen durchzuführen, starten wir dieses Crowdfunding. 

Wir bitten um eure Unterstützung, damit wir Ungerechtigkeiten nicht länger hinnehmen müssen, sondern gemeinsam dagegen vorgehen und protestieren können! 

Durch das kaufen der einzelnen Perks, könnt ihr nicht nur uns helfen, unsere Aktionen zu realisieren, ihr seid dadurch auch selbst Teil der Aktionen.

Jede unserer Aktionen wird auf Video fest gehalten, für deine Unterstützung wirst du namentlich im Abspann unserer Videos genannt.

Hilf' uns jetzt dabei, etwas zu bewegen und gegen die Ungerechtigkeiten in dieser Welt vorzugehen! 

+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Spendenkonto:IBAN: DE70 8105 3272 0641 0339 40

Bank: Sparkasse Magdeburg

Inhaber: PixelHELPER International SARL

story:
Hey everyone, welcome to The Horror of Maple Lane campaign

 We are the Canon Bros. Tydal and Buck. A team of one illustrator, two writers and absolute Halloween enthusiasts. We are raising money to fund the creation and publication of a uniquely entertaining Halloween trilogy. In turn we are presenting to you one of our illustrated poems honoring All Hallows.

The Horror of Maple Lane is a free E-Book for all to read and is one of the three stories that we are planning to publish and print. It is also an example of the quality of the work that we do and an indication of what is to come. But in order to launch this project successfully we need some support from anyone and everyone who loves Halloween. Help us celebrate the creepiest night of the year with a book that will be enjoyed ever after.

To achieve our goal we need some financial support. We are looking to raise $12,000 to cover our production costs, perk merchandise and minimal living expenses. Working full time as parents and employees reduces the time we can dedicate for this book, so we are asking for help to empower ourselves and make this a full time focus. We really believe we can create a Halloween classic that can continue to entertain readers for a very long time.

So if you’re like us, and you grew up obsessed with everything Halloween, check out our PERKS and become part of this holiday in a way you never thought possible.

story:
You and me, sister.

We are a collective of women, most of whom are graduates of The Old Globe’s MFA acting program, and we're bringing the New York premiere of BREWED by Scott Barsotti to FringeNYC.

About a year ago, we started looking for plays that would give us the opportunity to work together, plays that were written for multiple women, plays that pass the Bechdel test, and it turns out that’s pretty hard to find.

We did find it, however, in BREWED. We started off reading it in a living room. Then we took it a step further, rented a space, and rehearsed it without a director - just the seven of us figuring out how to tell this wonderfully eerie and complex and unique story about a family of six sisters. Six sisters who must never stop stirring a pot. (And the outsider who finds her way into their world.) We put up a reading of the play, and the audience response confirmed what we already knew: this story is special.  It’s visceral yet fluid; it’s violent yet full of love. And that felt very exciting to us. Not only is BREWED a play written for seven women, women who are distinct, women who fight and claw and pick and talk over each other and get by, but there’s something in it for everyone. It’s a thriller, it’s a classic family drama with a twist, and it is darkly funny.  

We are so thrilled to have a slot at FringeNYC, we are thrilled to be working with our director Jessi D. Hill, and we are thrilled to continue to delve into this play and present it as a full production. We’ve sat with this story for a long time, and we couldn’t be more excited to share it.

And now...we need your help!

Our goal is to raise $8,000 to help cover the costs of this production, and in order to reach that goal, we need your help! The money we raise will be used to cover preparation costs like rehearsal space, promotional materials, and insurance fees, and performance costs like costumes, set pieces and props, and programs. It also allows us to compensate our incredibly talented playwright, design team and director for their time and extraordinary work.

Help us get the word out!

If you like what you see here, follow us, like us, share us! Time Out New York already has!

Twitter / Instagram: @BrewedNYC

Facebook: www.facebook.com/brewednyc

Website: www.brewednyc.com/


Cast and Creative

Scott T. Barsotti (Playwright) - BREWED has been produced in Chicago, New Orleans, Boston, Pittsburgh (and now New York!). Scott's other plays include Scott’s plays include The Revenants, Kill Me, Entry (or, you think you know me), Brewed, Jet Black Chevrolet, Jagoff, Facing Angela, and adaptations of Robert Louis Stevenson’s The Body Snatcher and H.P. Lovecraft’s The Shadow Over Innsmouth.

Jessi D. Hill (Director) - Recent and upcoming play development projects include work at New York Theatre Workshop, The Public Theater/Joe’s Pub, The Playwrights’ Center, Primary Stages, Labyrinth, The Women’s Project, 59E59, The New Group, Ensemble Studio Theatre, Culture Project, The Acting Company, The Barrow Group, PS122, Baruch Performing Arts Center, New Dramatists, The Lark, The Playwrights Realm, New Georges, Theatre Row, The Wild Project, Naked Angels, the claque, Jewish Plays Project and others.

The Cast: Vivia Font, Rachael Jenison, Danielle O'Farrell, Alexis McGuinness, Deb Radloff, Stephanie Roetzel, and Aubrey Saverino

Our individual work has been seen across the country. Some credits include work at Classic Stage Company, Chicago Shakespeare Theatre, Cincinnati Playhouse, Denver Center, Epic Theatre Ensemble, Geva, The Goodman, La Mama, The Ohio Theatre, The Old Globe, Oregon Shakespeare Festival, Rattlestick, San Diego Rep, St. Louis Rep, Syracuse Stage, and Yale Rep.

Hill (Director) - Recent and upcoming play development projects include work at New York Theatre Workshop, The Public Theater/Joe’s Pub, The Playwrights’ Center, Primary Stages, Labyrinth, The Women’s Project, 59E59, The New Group, Ensemble Studio Theatre, Culture Project, The Acting Company, The Barrow Group, PS122, Baruch Performing Arts Center, New Dramatists, The Lark, The Playwrights Realm, New Georges, Theatre Row, The Wild Project, Naked Angels, the claque, Jewish Plays Project and others.The Cast: Vivia Font, Rachael Jenison, Danielle O'Farrell, Alexis McGuinness, Deb Radloff, Stephanie Roetzel, and Aubrey Saverino Our individual work has been seen across the country. Some credits include work at Classic Stage Company, Chicago Shakespeare Theatre, Cincinnati Playhouse, Denver Center, Epic Theatre Ensemble, Geva, The Goodman, La Mama, The Ohio Theatre, The Old Globe, Oregon Shakespeare Festival, Rattlestick, San Diego Rep, St. Louis Rep, Syracuse Stage, and Yale Rep.

story:
"Michael Kontraros Collectibles" is happy to introduce a new project called “The Bust Collection”.

During sculpting lessons and with the expert guidance of Michael Kontraros, four students created their own 200mm busts. Anthony Contorinis, Marios Vrachiolidis, Spyros Paizakis and Nikos Rovakis, did their best to bring the learning process to life.   

These busts were expertly painted by Masters like Ben Komets and Francesco Farabi and experienced painters like Alex Aggelakis and Kostas Synodinos.

This developed into an important project as apart from sculpting students and professional painters they are all very good friends.

Your contribution is very important in order for the whole idea to be utilized and for the figure to be molded, copied, packaged and released.

 

 

KNOCKOUT

Sculpted by Anthony Contorinis

Painted by Francesco Farabi

Sculpting Supervision Michael Kontraros

Two pieces of HD resin casting unpainted kit,  in a metal box.

 

NOSFERATU

Sculpted by Marios Vrachiolidis

Painted by Ben Komets

Sculpting Supervision Michael Kontraros

One piece of HD resin casting unpainted kit,  in a metal box.

 

Major Pain

Sculpted by Spyros Paizakis

Painted by Alex Aggelakis

Sculpting Supervision Michael Kontraros

Two pieces of HD resin casting unpainted kit,  in a metal box.

 

Brock the Orc

Sculpted by Nikos Rovakis

Painted by Kostas Synodinos

Sculpting Supervision Michael Kontraros

One piece of HD resin casting unpainted kit,  in a metal box.

 

Goblin in Love

Sculpted by Michael Kontraros

Painted by Denis Vanhingeland

Two pieces of HD resin casting unpainted kit,  in a metal box.

story:
Despre HAMLET ȘI NOI

 

HAMLET ȘI NOI este un spectacol - laborator condus de actrița Antoaneta Cojocaru, un proiect artistic inovator și o mișcare culturală în mediul teatral independent din București. 

HAMLET ȘI NOI este o citire contemporană care expune evoluția personajelor lui Shakespeare, oglindă pentru societatea de astăzi. Prin natura sa unică, spectacolul vine cu un suflu nou, creat cu o echipă de 20 de actori tineri, care odată cu personajele își creează propriile păreri despre lume și realitatea pe care o trăiesc în România zilei de azi. 

Spectacolul inspiră prin diversitatea formelor artistice pe care le pune în scenă (teatru, dans, muzică, proiecții), performanța actorilor și viziunea regizorală a Antoanetei Cojocaru. 

HAMLET ȘI NOI este un spectacol itinerant - își mută scena la fiecare reprezentație în clădiri de patrimoniu și muzee din București și din țară. Prin acest demers dorim sa atragem atenția asupra specificului aparte al caselor cu istorie, parte din identitatea României, de a ne petrece o clipă în aerul lor boem, dar și pentru a trage un semnal de alarmă asupra degradării patrimoniului cultural urban. 

Ediția a doua HAMLET ȘI NOI în clădiri de patrimoniu este co-finațată de Administrația Fondului Cultural Național. Proiectul nu reprezintă în mod necesar poziția Administrației Fondului Cultural Național. AFCN nu este responsabilă de conținutul proiectului sau de modul în care rezultatele proiectului pot fi folosite. Acestea sunt în întregime responsabilitatea beneficiarului finanțării.  

Povestea HAMLET ȘI NOI

Cursul de teatru cu Antoaneta Cojocaru

Povestea Hamlet și noi a început în septembrie 2016, însă oamenii care o construiesc au început să se adune în 2014. Eram 10 oameni la început, ”studenții mei” ne spunea Antoaneta, eram prima grupă pentru care ținea un curs de actorie. Veneam de la facultăți și job-uri care nu aveau nici o legătură cu arta, iar cursul de teatru  a devenit un spațiu unde ne provocam limitele și unde ne puteam exprima autentic și liber.  3 ani a durat cursul, timp în care am descoperit frumusețea teatrului și puterea eliberatoare a artei. 

 

Masterclass Hamlet 
În 2016, septembrie, am simțit că e firesc să mergem mai departe. Așa că am dat de știre în lume că suntem în căutare de studenți UNATC și absolvenți, alături de care să participăm la un Master Class pe actorie, tot cu Antoaneta. În următoarele luni ne-am jucat mult, ne-am cunoscut, am învățat tehnici de actorie și de arta actorului. Master Class-ul s-a transformat, iar noi am început să construim spectacolul “Hamlet”.  La Noaptea Albă a Muzeelor, am avut prima reprezentație, cu Primul Act din Hamlet. Am jucat în acea seară de 3 ori  deși erau programate doar 2, oamenii stăteau la coadă să intre la HAMLET. Atunci am știut că oamenii au nevoie de artă.

 

Am construit timp de  6 luni celelalte patru acte din HAMLET. Pe perioada repetițiilor căutam și finanțări și parteneriate care să ne ajute să scoatem spectacolul. Investisem foarte mult în proiect însă fără un sprijin din exterior nu am fi reușit să aducem spectacol în fața publicului. 

Am reușit să-i găsim pe acei oameni, organizații și companii care s-au alăturat demersului nostru - suntem mândri să spunem că proiectul HAMLET ȘI NOI a fost realizat de artiști însă susținut de oameni care iubesc arta, iar aportul a fost egal. 

 

HAMLET ȘI NOI - prima ediție

Primul spectacol HAMLET ȘI NOI a fost la Muzeul de Istorie a României, un loc în care nici nu visasem că vom juca. Au urmat alte spectacole în case de patrimoniu și muzee din București: Muzeul Municipiului București - Palatul Suțu, Vila Oromolu, Muzeul Național de Artă al României, Casa Universitarilor, Palatul Cercului Militar Național, Centrul Cultural Nicolae Bălcescu. Au participat peste 2000 de spectatori: unii care au venit chiar și de 5 ori sa vadă spectacolul, alții care au stat și în picioare și pe jos, unii care după ce au văzut spectacolul au intrat în echipa proiectului ca voluntari. 

 

HAMLET ȘI NOI - a doua ediție
Anul acesta, cu ajutorul AFCN, am reușit să avem și o a doua ediție a proiectului HAMLET ȘI NOI care a cuprins pe lângă 3 spectacole în clădiri de patrimoniu și muzee din București și alte 2 spectacole în țară - la Palatul ASTRA din Sibiu și Centrul Cultural Reduta din Brașov. Pe lângă clădirile de patrimoniu și muzeele în care vom juca HAMLET ȘI NOI în această ediție, vom promova și alte 30 de case de patrimoniu din România care merită vizitate și unde ne propunem în viitor să jucăm spectacolul HAMLET ȘI NOI. Dezvoltăm astfel o hartă culturală a proiectului cu peste 30 de case și muzee reprezentante ale patrimoniului cultural autohton.

 

Investiția ta presupune

De la începutul proiectului, în 2017, până în prezent, proiectul HAMLET ȘI NOI a obținut susținere financiară de la Ministerul Culturii (11 000 $),  de la AFCN (17 050 $)  și 6000 $ de la Mobexpert (pentru decor). De asemenea, echipa din spatele proiectului a investit peste 12 000 $ în producție și susținerea mai departe a spectacolului. 

Pentru ce-a de a doua ediție a proiectului mai avem nevoie să strângem 2900 $ pentru a susține ultimul spectacol HAMLET ȘI NOI care se va desfășura la ARCUB Gabroveni în 18 iulie 2019.

Cum se vor distribui fondurile:

Un alt important scop pentru care ne-am decis să începem această companie de crowdfunding este pentru a încuraja comunitatea iubitorilor de artă să susțină proiecte artistice independente care nu pot concura altfel cu un buget de teatru de stat.

Dorința noastră de viitor este să ajungem să jucam spectacolul HAMLET ȘI NOI în fiecare lună într-o clădire de patrimoniu din București și din alte orașe din țară, să dezvoltăm o hartă culturală cu aceste spații pe care să le promovăm ca alternative pentru săli de spectacole.

 

Ce îți oferim 

  • Bilete la spectacolul HAMLET ȘI NOI din 18 iulie 2019, ora 18:30, la ARCUB Gabroveni: pachet Ofelia (1 loc), pachet Gertrude ( 1 loc - front seat), pachet Claudius (1 loc - front seat), pachet Hamlet (2 locuri VIP - în primul rând);
  • Afișe HAMLET ȘI NOI semnate de actorii din spectacol, un gest simbolic prin care vrem să îți mulțumim pentru susținerea proiectului nostru; 
  •  Poze time-lapse de la una dintre repetițiile spectacolului. Într-un minut și jumătate o să vezi cum decurge o repetiție înainte de un spectacol HAMLET ȘI NOI;
  • Intrare la petrecerea de încheiere a stagiunii care va avea loc dupa spectacolul din 18 Iulie 2019,  la ARCUB Gabroveni.  Împreună cu actorii din spectacol, echipa tehnică, voluntarii și susținătorii proiectului ne vom bucura de finalul acestei ediții a proiectului la un vin, muzică bună și povești faine;
  • Acces la repetiția dinaintea spectacolului, în 17 iulie 2019.  Vei avea ocazia să vezi ce se întâmplă în spatele culiselor unui spectacol și cum ne pregătim pentru HAMLET ȘI NOI
  • Mulțumiri pe rețelele de socializare și în filmul de promovare al campaniei. Vom face o postare pe pagina Laboratorul de Artă cu numele tuturor celor care au sprijinit proiectul, de asemenea, vom menționa numele tău la finalul filmului de prezentare a campaniei. 

 

Și tu poți deveni un (ne)POT al spectacolului

* sau alte moduri în care ne poți ajuta

  • ne Poți promova proiectul pe rețelele sociale, vrem ca mesajul nostru să ajungă la cât mai multe persoane;
  • ne Poți face legătura cu alte clădiri de patrimoniu unde ai vrea ca HAMLET ȘI NOI să fie jucat;
  • ne Poți ajuta prin intrarea în echipa noastră de voluntari harnici, care se ocupă cu promovarea si logistica spectacolului;
  • ne Poți face legătura cu persoane influente aproape de arta (din companii, artiști, influenceri) ce vor sa afle despre HAMLET ȘI NOI.

 

 

Echipa

Spectacolul HAMLET ȘI NOI este formată dintr-o trupă tânără și atipică de actori: actori cu experiență - profesioniști din teatre cu renume din București, studenți la UNATC și profesioniști din alte domenii de activitate care au urmat timp de 3 ani cursul de teatru cu Antoaneta Cojocaru.

De adaptarea la spațiu (lumini, sunet, proiecții) se ocupă echipa noastră tehnică, care la fiecare spectacol se înarmează cu multă răbdare, creativitate și cafea să rezolve toate situațiile problematice ce vin odată cu schimbarea locației de joc.

Suntem norocoși să avem alături noi o armata de furnicute aprige si harnice care fac lucrurile să se întâmple - voluntarii spectacolului.

Distribuția în ordine alfabetică: Teodora Antal, Maria Bucur, Ciprian Chiricheș, Ovidiu Condurache, Horia Fedorca, Teodora Filip, Marina Fluerașu, Tatiana Gingărașu, Alexandra Giurcă, Alexandru Ionescu, Cristiana Ioniță, Ioana Lupu, Alin Potop, Răzvan Răduță, Cosmin Rudeanu, Laura Teodor, Maria Vârlan 
Antoaneta Cojocaru  și​ Adrian Ciobanu.

Proiecții video: Sineira Studio
Asistent scenografie: Ileana Zirra
Regizor tehnic: Oana Rainer
Sunet și proiecții: Laura Săvuțiu
Lumini: Gabi Bucurenciu
Traducere: Leon D. Levițchi și Dan Duțescu

MHP Creations Grand Opening

 

    

Hello Hello. As many of you know I provided downtown Plymouth with safe and sterile body piercing for almost twenty years. Due to work related conflicts I was forced to step down from a position I truly loved. For the past year or so I have been looking for a new endeavor to dedicate myself to but I couldn’t deny that I missed what I have always done. My passion is in this field, and it would mean the world to me to continue to provide people with a positive body piercing experience. 

This is where I ask for your help. I am reaching out to my tens and thousands of happy customers to help make this dream a reality. I have secured a building and will need to create a new shop from the ground up. This will require building walls, running electrical and plumbing, filling the shop with high quality jewelry as well as re licensing and branding myself so I can once again be ‘Americas hometown piercer.’ It is my hope to have this up and running as soon as possible. I know that this will take months of hard work, and I am more than ready to take on this new chapter.

Even if you choose not to donate, I thank you for taking the time to read this. I have had so many great years in this field and I look forward to many, many more.  Let's get weird.-Matt

story:
Campaign Summary

Hi y'all! I am heading to the Vermont Studio Center in Johnson, VT for a one month Artist Residency. I was selected from a wide range of applicants all across the globe that will come together for the purpose of creating and learning with others that are dedicated to their craft. 

The total cost of this residency is $3,900 and I received on a merit and work study scholarship $1,100, so I am asking you, philanthropists and friends, to assist me in achieving my goal in matching my scholarship in funding or get me all the way to $2,800 which would not only help me pay for the fees and tuition but for flights and materials needed to make this residency happen!

During this residency I will be creating a brand new body of work, consisting mainly of paintings and drawings. This residency isn't just something to put on my CV, it means that I will be able to focus all my time and energy into just my artwork, a challenging task I have not had the chance at tackling since I completed my BFA in Painting in 2015. I am beyond happy to share this with you and I hope you can support this journey by selecting one of the perks I have to offer for your gift of giving for this exciting project! As I have a deadline to put down my tuition and buy flights, sharing or donating is very appreciated even if you can't donate or purchase a perk!! Thank you!

Be sure to check out my website for more available works to purchase! jeffreyheiman.tumblr.com or at my instagram page https://www.instagram.com/jeffreyheimanart/

Risks & Challenges

There are some setbacks if I don't reach my projected goal. However, my pricing for the perks is at a VALUE rate and if only THREE donors join the Collector's Circle then I will have already gone above and beyond my expectations!! In addition, there are even options for rewards that wouldn't cost more than taking me out to lunch, and you even get a couple postcards! I believe we can do this but I need friends, family, and even admirers of my work to get involved and donate! I won't let you down.

story:
Dear Family, Friends and Gentle Contributors

My name is Giovanni Palminteri, and I am an Italian operatic Baritone. I have studied singing in Italy specialising myself in Opera and Chamber Music. Currently I am a pupil of the famous Baritone and Vocal Coach Lucio Gallo.
       I am happy to announce that I have been accepted into the Berlin Opera Academy. The Berlin Opera Academy is a 4-week summer intensive, held in Berlin, Germany, that offers young singers the opportunities to sing a role in an opera, learn German, and gain exposure to the European classical voice circuit by singing for German agents. I’m thrilled to share that BOA has offered me the role of Gianni Schicchi in the beautiful Opera Gianni Schicchi by Giacomo Puccini. It would be an honor for me to accept the role and participate in this prestigious program. However, I cannot do it without your generous help. Berlin Opera Academy's esteemed program tuition totals to €4950 not including the cost of air travel and the various expenses for living in Berlin. This program would extend me the advantage of a career by providing the chance for me to sing a full principal role and make professional connections in the European classical voice circuit.

I won a scholarship but unfortunately it is not enough. To participate in this wonderful experience and career opportunity I need an additional 4000 € for school fees + airfare and miscellaneous expenses to live in Berlin.

Have a look at the website - www.berlinoperaacademy.com

I will send you all my artistic updates and who know, if karma will want, to have the opportunity to sing for all of you in a famous theater.

I would appreciate any help you can lend including sincere words of encouragement.

Thank-you for your support

story:
Who's Devo? 

I'm a girl from the North East end of Glasgow born & bred in Royston. 

I've always been an artistic soul but it wasn't until my 30's I decided I should pursue it more. Confidence was a big issue, as it can be with most artists, but after dipping my toe in I can't help myself. It's my all time dream job. 

This fundraising campaign is to help me produce a new art show. My first was an unbelievable success and was genuinely the best night of my life. I'm still overwhemled at how many people turned up and  celebrated this amazing achievement with me. I'm forever thankful for that. 

I'd love to be able to do another art show but with a whole new focus on my artwork. I'm steering away from Movies/TV as my influence & looking to paint more original Devo creations! Basically things that have been flying about my head for years but I've just never had the opportunity to put down onto canvas! So be prepared for explosions of colour, design & me attempting to push my boundaries :)  

To successfully (fingers crossed!) carry this off I need some help. Canvas, paint, pens, the event itself - none of it comes cheap.

Wish List

Here's a breakdown & where your money will go!

  • Around 30 canvasses - I like to paint big as you know!
  • At least one top secret non canvas creation
  • Paints, acrylic pens, spray paint and other materials 
  • Prints & mounts
  • The cost of the event itself, including the venue, set up & hospitality costs 
  • Flyers & other promotional materials to help raise awareness of me as an artist and the event itself 

Why donate? 

If anything your helping to fund are rather good night. More than that you are helping someone realise their dreams. Supporting a local artist do the best they can. My last art show was self funded & cost me just over £500. The night was an outstanding success but sadly I just don't have the revenue to do it on my own this time. 

There are also options for perks where the warm and fuzzy feeling you'll get when you donate is topped off by free stuff!

Skint? That's cool

I totally get it, so don't fret. Help me share the absolute sh*t out of it. Tell your friends, family, anyone who'll listen.

Do you know a photographer looking to add an event like this to their portfolio? Get them to contact me @ askdevoart@gmail.com (couple of free drinks & a print can be thiers!) 

Help with setting up the venue is also very much welcome!

Flyers & other promotional materials to help raise awareness of me as an artist and the event itself 

Why donate? 
 If anything your helping to fund are rather good night. More than that you are helping someone realise their dreams. Supporting a local artist do the best they can. My last art show was self funded & cost me just over £500. The night was an outstanding success but sadly I just don't have the revenue to do it on my own this time. 
There are also options for perks where the warm and fuzzy feeling you'll get when you donate is topped off by free stuff!
Skint? That's cool I totally get it, so don't fret. Help me share the absolute sh*t out of it. Tell your friends, family, anyone who'll listen.
Do you know a photographer looking to add an event like this to their portfolio? Get them to contact me @ askdevoart@gmail.com (couple of free drinks & a print can be thiers!) 
Help with setting up the venue is also very much welcome!

story:
ArtOfficiallyDope.com Present:

The Official Open Of Jason Fleurant & Daniel Fortune

Message from Jason & Daniel


     Thanks to everyone that have supported us. Our goal is to do put together an art show by Sept 10, (Jason's Birthday). This will be an amazing event with Jason Fleurant as the featured artist. along with a few other artist  including Daniel Fortune. Although we have been working diligently to provide quality pieces we need your help. Between supplies and rental fee of the venue , reaching our goal of having the art show by Jason's Birthday seems difficult right now, but we are confident that with help of friends and fans we can make it happen. Any amount you find it in your heart to give will be put towards reaching this goal.


You can find examples of both artist's work here


Jason - https://www.facebook.com/pages/JaFleu-FleurantARTS/174888089231819?sk=photos


Daniel- https://www.facebook.com/Stylepump#!/Stylepump?...


Things we plan on applying the money raised towards.


1. Supplies  such as Paint and Canvases . 


2. Securing a Suite at the Palm Beach Convention Center


*please view some of the perks we have set up to show our appreciation for your help


We respect and appreciate all contributions. Rest assured You are not buying us Dinner. The show will happen, However funding for this project will determine the date of this event


- Sincerely

  Jason & Daniel

  ArtOfficiallyDope.com

story:
Our Story



You can't talk about East Jesus without first talking about Charles Stephen Russell. Here was a man who had it all: education, insight, wisdom, charisma, potential, and he took it out to the desert with him to pursue a dream. a desire to get away, to experience freedom, to live on his own terms, to pursue his art and music away from conformity and critics, to be free.




In the short time he was here he accomplished that and more. He cleaned up a literal garbage dump and turned it into a sculpture garden and zen center. He encouraged other like-minded individuals to visit and take their hand at building East Jesus, to entertain their dreams and visions as works of art, whether sculpture, music, photography, storytelling, or more esoteric genres like fire, nudity, and shotguns. He allowed artists a place to show their work within Nature's own splendor, back-lit by vivid sunsets. He and his friends built a home that still welcomes new visitors with a hug.




This was and is a haven for other artists to get away, to get lost, and to create beauty out of garbage and nothingness. Wedged between the Chocolate Mountain Gunnery Range and the Salton Sea in southern California's exotic Imperial Valley, East Jesus is an experimental, comprehensive habitat of artwork comprising architecture, common-sense environmentalism, desert survival and sculpture/assemblage art using predominantly recycled, re-purposed or discarded materials, turning the unwanted and ugly into the purposefully beautiful.

The Impact



This habitable experiment for artistic freedom is built around the use of natural resources. One of those resources is the sun and the power it supplies. We can recycle and reuse only so much of humanity's garbage but the loss of converting this one resource into energy will pull out a major cornerstone in our efforts.

What We Need & What You Get



Charlie designed and pieced together a 24 cell, 48 volt energy system located in the middle of an inhospitable desert, a $100,000 energy system in need of a $3000 cog tooth (plus installations fees, and other related expenses). With the container unit, solar panels, wiring, mechanics, electronic controls, batteries, etc. Charlie made a substantial leap at providing for a necessity: electricity.

We currently have 23 massive batteries for holding power in a system designed for 24. That one missing tooth is causing our gear ratio to slip and will spell doom for the future of East Jesus and Charlie's dream.

So what do you get for your donation? An opportunity to share in East Jesus's future!

Snowbird: $5

Contributors get sent a link to a video of everyone at East Jesus giving a group "BIG thank you from the desert!" for their donation.

Honorary Slabber: $10



This perk includes the thank you above plus a Church of the Chocolate Martini bumper sticker.

Honorable Slabber: $20



Everything mentioned above plus the adoption of one of the infamous duck decoys in Sculpture Garden.

East Disciple: $50



The East Disciple perks include:

  • Your name included on art work affixed to the Tower of Barbarella.
  • A Church of the Chocolate Martini bumper sticker.
  • An East Jesus T-shirt!

East Apostle: $100



Contributors get everything above plus:

A weekend retreat at East Jesus for two! This rare opportunity includes accommodations in our less than luxurious suites, meals, entertainment, use of the Clothing Optional Gun Range, a personal tour of the Art Garden and behind the estate scenes, information and directions to surrounding area attractions. This opportunity is fully transferable to friends and family, and makes for a extremely unique gift!

* Certain date restrictions apply. See below for details.

East Jesuit: $250



A weekend retreat at East Jesus for two during either our New Year's Eve Weekend (December 28th-1st, 2012) OR our Birthday Bash Weekend (March 23rd-25th, 2012)! This package includes everything $100 donators get, plus a champagne toast and a group trip to the Slab City hot springs, as well as getting to bear witness to one of our two wildest parties of the year!

This opportunity is fully transferable to people you think are cool, so don't be afraid to give it to a friend!

Cinnabar Circle: $500



A weekend at East Jesus for a group (10-12 people)! This package gives you everything $5-$20 donators get, plus an amazing weekend that includes all the perks and tours $100 donators receive, but now for you and your friends!

* Certain date restrictions apply. See below for details.

Charlie's Angels: $1000



A weekend at East Jesus for a group (10-12 people) during either our New Year's Eve Weekend (December 28th-1st, 2012) OR our Birthday Bash Weekend (March 23rd-25th, 2012)! This package gives you everything $5-$20 donators get, plus an amazing weekend that includes all the perks and tours $100 donators receive, but now for you and a group of your friends! This includes a champagne toast and a group trip to the Slab City hot springs. This is your opportunity to be in a party so intense you'll want to get a tattoo to remember it!



* Date restrictions (Applies to $100 & $500 donators only):

Exclusion dates include New Year's Eve Weekend (December 28th-1st, 2012), Birthday Bash Weekend (March 23rd-25th, 2012), and is not recommended during the hotter months of the year due to the extremely high temperatures of the desert during this season. Please plan your reservation accordingly, and let us know if you have any questions!

Other Ways You Can Help

Flat broke or don't have the means to donate directly to our campaign? Don't despair! You can help us reach our campaign goal by telling your friends about us, showing others our website (http://eastjesus.org), and using the sharing tools on this page to let others know about this project on various social media networks! Helping us spread the word will help others discover more about what we're doing with the East Jesus artist space, and encourage others to donate towards keeping us going!

story:
Who I am and what I hope to achieve.

     Everyone has a dream. It's embedded within us and is a burning passion that we cannot ignore. Being a full-time actress is mine. My name is Megan Hensley and I am from Des Moines, Iowa. I was born and raised here by my lovely mama, gram grams and father. I have been acting since I was in middle school and professionally acting for over 6 years. I have studied at many different places and I have been a part of many different projects. (Feel free to view my resume on my site.) www.meganhensley.com  I have agents in 4 different states. I am very passionate about acting and there is nothing else that I would rather be doing. It completes me in many ways. I cannot be a full-time actress where I am located, therefore, I am looking to relocate to L.A. to follow my path. I am not asking for money, I am willing to work hard for it

    This campaign is very important to me because it will help me get where I need to be to be at the level that I want to be at. I have been working a regular job and doing different projects but most of my money goes to traveling to auditions and shoots. I have 5000$ saved up and I know how expensive L.A. can be. Also, I can help the people that help me.

   If you donate to my fund, I will be able to tackle my dreams full throttle.  Every dollar helps.  If you cannot afford to help me, you could post a link to my page=)

 The money will go toward workshops, gas, headshots, rent, business cards etc. I am a great budgeter and I spend my money wisely=) 

  I have a list of wonderful perks to choose from! You can also personalize any of them that you want to! For instance, if you want me to paint your walls instead of mow your lawn...or you want a coconut cream pie instead of a dozen cookies...just let me know! If you live out of state, give me a task that I can do from where I am=)

Everything helps!

  Every little bit helps! Whether you are paying me to knit you a scarf, watch your children or even if you copy and paste my link, you are helping me out tons! 

  I will stick to my word. You give me a date that works for you and we will figure something out! I make goodies for friends all of the time, I have helped my mom with her daycare my entire life and I am a hard worker.

   I know that nothing in this world is free. You have to earn what you want. Everything takes work. I know that being an actress isn't easy. I drive 2-5 hours for auditions several times a week. I am not always guaranteed the work...but I go for it anyway. I am willing to work to have the opportunity to work=)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  Tell all of your friends about this...post it to your Facebook, Twitter or send an email out. I can also be featured on the page if this gets shared enough! Even glancing at my page and checking up on it gets my views up! Leave comments, ask questions, tag me...anything helps!

story:
RAINBOW CROSSWALK

On April 19th I wrote to the West Hollywood City Council about an idea to paint the crosswalks in West Hollywood rainbow coloured during the June 2012 Gay Pride. 

The idea was simple; I see those white crosswalk as an empty canvas and saw an opportunity; paint them and make a statement! 

Today on May the 29th I got a letter back confirming the Mayor Mr. Jeffrey Prang and Council member Mr. John Duran loved the idea but it had to put it fourth in a council meeting on Monday June 4th at6.30 PM at West Hollywood Library located at 625 N. San Vicente Boulevard (at Melrose). They need to vote on this project and for that we need your support and help

CALL TO ACTION

You can help in three ways:

1. Sign a petition by subscribing my website at: http://www.martinduvander.com

2. Donate to the cause here; http://www.indiegogo.com/Martin-Duvander

3. Show up at the Council meeting and speak up! Monday June 4th at 6.30 PM at West Hollywood Library located at 625 N. San Vicente Boulevard (at Melrose).

Have a great day, and as always; Stay Sexy!

 
Artist Bio

Martin Duvander uncovers a uniquely international vision. Growing up in Denmark, Zimbabwe and Greenland before living in Spain, England and Greece, working both in finance, advertising and software development, he is influenced by a flux of multicultural stimuli. Through his art he puts the world on canvas, carefully selecting and layering unusual materials and cut-outs from fashion magazines melding them with poetic and political statements infused with a hint of social satire. Duvander captures a street art feel combined with classical abstractism together with personal imprints in the form of poetry on canvas.

Since 2003, his work has been internationally exhibited at galleries and private foundations. Duvander lives and works in Venice, California. 

Martin Duvander was recently chosen to showcase his art at the 2010 Golden Globe and the 2010 The Grammy's in Los Angeles, California.

 

LEGAL DISCLAIMER:

 

If you choose to donate you understand and acknowledge that there are various contingencies that need to occur before I will be able to move forward with producing marketing materials, DVDs, posters, merchandise, etc. - including, but not limited, the West Hollywood City Council will need to vote to approve the ideafor use at the parade in West Hollywood, California scheduled to be held in June 2012.

 

The approval vote will be held on Monday, June 4th 2012. I will need to spend funds in order to prepare the council presentation and these funds may not be returnable to you should the West Hollywood City Council vote no on the proposal. You understand and agree to assume the risk that the West Hollywood City Council will vote no on the proposal and that some and/or all of your donation will not be returnable to you.

 

As such, by donating to this project you hereby agree to forever release and hold me and all of my affiliates, companies, subsidiaries, partners, employees, independent contractors, attorneys and any other person or entity related to this project harmless from any and all claims you may have throughout the Universe, whether now or hereafter known, related to your donation
