story:
About “Once Upon Alaska”

Celebrate Alaska, “A land so grand and wide and far…”

Mark Kelley and Nick Jans are at it again, and this time for the kid in all of us!  With beautiful photography and rhyming verse that makes you smile, Mark and Nick express their deep passion for Alaska in a kid’s photo book that deserves a place on your coffee table. 

Mark Kelley’s books communicate a message of stewardship for Alaska’s wild lands.  With this new book Mark hopes to inspire readers young and old to value and protect Alaska’s natural world for generations to come. 

Campaign Goals

With this campaign we are spreading the word far and wide that Mark Kelley is publishing his first children's book. "Once Upon Alaska" is a gem, with real, beautiful photography and of such high quality, every child will approve!

Our financial goal is to cover the production costs of the project, totaling $7,476. Mark’s complete budget for this project is as follows:

Production $7,476 + Printing/Shipping $22,760 = $30,236

Funds raised above and beyond our goal will be applied to printing/shipping costs. 

Mark's Gift to You

Contributions are categorized by the animal images that appear in "Once Upon Alaska"
Be the first to receive “Once Upon Alaska”!  All contributions will receive at least one signed pre-release copy of the book before it hits store shelves.

Contributions at the $40 level and above (Sea Otter through Humpback Whale) will also receive an invite to the exclusive and private pre-release party!

Higher contributions (Moose through Humpback Whale) will also receive a limited edition print of a spread from “Once Upon Alaska”.  Only five prints per size will be printed. 

Contribute as a Humpback Whale and spend the day with the photographer! Set July 2, 2015 aside for a full day, exclusive photography workshop with Mark Kelley in Juneau, Alaska.  See details under Perks.

Your book(s) will be mailed March 31, regardless of whether we reach our financial goal or not.  If your perk includes a limited edition print you may choose your favorite spread once you receive your copy of the book.  Contact us with your spread of choice.  The sooner the better as each spread is limited to five limited edition prints, never to be produced again!

Other ways you can support - Would you please help us get the word out?  Maybe you have a friend who would love a copy of "Once Upon Alaska".  Please share this link far and wide... igg.me/at/markkelleyphotography

About Mark

Photographer
Mark Kelley is an award-winning Alaskan photographer. He has worked on assignment for National Geographic Adventure Magazine, Outside, Alaska Magazine, the New York Times, Washington Post, Boy’s Life, and USA Today. His images have appeared in National Wildlife, Sunset, National Geographic Adventure, National Geographic Traveler, National Geographic World, Alaska Magazine, Outside, Alaska Airlines, Time For Kids, Sierra, Runner’s World, Travel & Leisure, Boy’s Life, USA, and the Washington Post, among others. As a freelance photographer Mark has produced images for the covers of more than two hundred publications, including magazines, books, brochures, calendars, and annual reports.

Mark’s image “Rainbowed” placed first in the 2013 Nature’s Best Windland Smith Rice Photography Awards, Outdoor Adventure Category, and will be featured in a Smithsonian exhibit in the fall of 2014.  Three of Mark's photo books have received a Benjamin Franklin award.  Mark’s work in journalism has been recognized by the Alaska Press Club, the National Press Photographers Association, and the Society of Professional Journalists.

Publisher
Mark Kelley published his first book in 1982. His images illustrate twelve books with over a quarter million copies sold.  He owns a thriving publishing business and in addition to books produces two annual calendars, with over 200,000 calendars sold to date, as well as individually signed prints, note cards, postcards, and bookmarks. 

Community Supporter
Mark Kelley products help support local causes in a variety of ways.  Since their inception in 1989 Mark Kelley calendars sales have helped generate over $20,000 in total annual donations to Discovery Southeast and the Juneau Raptor Center.  Mark is a former soccer coach, and during the Christmas holiday Mark Kelley’s calendar sales support fundraising efforts by local soccer teams, raising more than $10,000 each year.  A percentage of sales from Mark’s book “Alaska’s Watchable Whales” supports the work of whale researcher Jan Straley, and the Sitka Sound Science Center.

Mark is a regular speaker at community events and with his slideshows shares the beauty of Southeast Alaska with locals and visitors alike.  Mark Kelley supports the local public schools with product donations.

In 2006 Mark Kelley self-funded the exhibit “Alaska’s Watchable Whales: Humpback and Killer Whales” featured in the Governors Gallery at the Alaska State Museum.

Awards

2013
-First Place, 2013 Nature’s Best Windland Smith Rice Photography Awards, Outdoor Adventure Category
-2013 Award of Excellence, Communications Arts
-Tier I winner, 2013 North American Nature Photography Association-NANPA Showcase

2011
- Tier II winner, 2011 North American Nature Photography Association-NANPA Showcase

2010
-Finalist, 2010 Alaska Airlines Photo Contest
-Honorable Mention, 2010 National Wildlife Photo Contest
- two images selected, 2010 Alaska State Museum's Juried Photo Exhibit "Alaska Positive"

2009
-Winner, Daniel Housberg Wilderness Image Award for Excellence in Still Photography-Alaska Conservation Foundation
-Honorable Mention, Golden Asturcon Award of photography, Memorial Maria Luisa International Mountain and Nature Photo Contest

2008
- One image selected, 2008 Alaska State Museum's Juried Photo Exhibit "Alaska Positive"
-Winner, Regional Category, Benjamin Franklin Award for "Alaska: A Photographic Excursion
-Finalist, Travel Category, Benjamin Franklin Award for "Alaska: A Photographic Excursion":

2006
- Two images selected, 2006 Alaska State Museum's Juried Photo Exhibit "Alaska Positive"
-Winner, Gift Books/Small Format, Benjamin Franklin Award for "Alaska's Tracy Arm and Sawyer Glaciers"

2001
-Winner, Travel Essay, Benjamin Franklin Award for "Glacier Bay National Park: Alaska"

Personal
“As a kid in Buffalo, New York, I always wondered what it would be like to encounter a whale,” says Mark, “I moved north and in 1978 graduated from the University of Alaska with a journalism degree.” Mark worked as a photojournalist for the Juneau Empire, Juneau’s only daily newspaper, for over thirteen years before leaving to pursue a full-time career in freelance photography and publishing in 1993.

Mark has lived in Alaska for more than 39 years.  He resides in Juneau where he and his wife, Jan, raised their two sons, Gabe and Owen.


Thank you for sharing "Once Upon Alaska" with your family and friends.  We hope this new book deserves a place on everyone's coffee table. 

Thank you for visiting this campaign!
story_txt:
About “Once Upon
Alaska”Celebrate Alaska, “A
land so grand and wide and far…”
Mark Kelley and Nick Jans are at it again, and this time for
the kid in all of us!  With beautiful
photography and rhyming verse that makes you smile, Mark and Nick express their
deep passion for Alaska in a kid’s photo book that deserves a place on your coffee
table.  
Mark Kelley’s books communicate a message of stewardship for
Alaska’s wild lands.  With this new book
Mark hopes to inspire readers young and old to value and protect Alaska’s natural
world for generations to come.  
Campaign GoalsWith this campaign we are spreading the word far and wide that Mark Kelley is publishing his first children's book. "Once Upon Alaska" is a gem, with real, beautiful photography and of such high quality, every child will approve!Our financial goal is to cover the
production costs of the project, totaling $7,476. Mark’s complete budget for this project is as follows:Production $7,476 + Printing/Shipping $22,760 = $30,236Funds raised above and beyond our goal will be applied to printing/shipping costs.  Mark's Gift to YouContributions are categorized by the animal images that appear in "Once Upon Alaska" Be the first to receive “Once Upon Alaska”!  All contributions will receive at least one
signed pre-release copy of the book before it hits store shelves.Contributions at the $40 level and above (Sea Otter through
Humpback Whale) will also receive an invite to the exclusive and private
pre-release party!

Higher contributions (Moose through Humpback Whale) will also receive
a limited edition print of a spread from “Once Upon Alaska”.  Only
five prints per size will be printed.  

Contribute as a Humpback Whale and spend the day
with the photographer! Set July 2, 2015
aside for a full day, exclusive photography workshop with Mark Kelley in Juneau,
Alaska.  See details under Perks.Your book(s) will be mailed March 31, regardless of whether we reach our financial goal or not.  If your perk includes a limited edition print you may choose your favorite spread once you receive your copy of the book.  Contact us with your spread of choice.  The sooner the better as each spread is limited to five limited edition prints, never to be produced again!Other ways you
can support - Would you please help us get the word out?  Maybe you have a friend who would love a copy of "Once Upon Alaska".  Please share this link far and wide... igg.me/at/markkelleyphotographyAbout MarkPhotographerMark Kelley is an award-winning Alaskan photographer. He has
worked on assignment for National Geographic Adventure
Magazine, Outside, Alaska Magazine, the New York Times, Washington Post, Boy’s
Life, and USA Today. His images have appeared in National Wildlife, Sunset, National
Geographic Adventure, National Geographic Traveler, National Geographic World,
Alaska Magazine, Outside, Alaska Airlines, Time For Kids, Sierra, Runner’s
World, Travel & Leisure, Boy’s Life, USA, and the Washington Post, among others. As a freelance photographer Mark
has produced images for the covers of more than two hundred publications,
including magazines, books, brochures, calendars, and annual reports.
Mark’s image “Rainbowed” placed first in the 2013 Nature’s
Best Windland Smith Rice Photography Awards, Outdoor Adventure Category, and
will be featured in a Smithsonian exhibit in the fall of 2014.  Three of Mark's photo books have received a Benjamin Franklin award.  Mark’s work in journalism has been recognized
by the Alaska Press Club, the National
Press Photographers Association, and the Society of Professional Journalists.PublisherMark Kelley published his first book in 1982. His images
illustrate twelve books with over a quarter million copies sold.  He owns a thriving publishing business and in
addition to books produces two annual calendars, with over 200,000 calendars
sold to date, as well as individually signed prints, note cards, postcards, and
bookmarks.  

Community
SupporterMark
Kelley products help support local causes in a variety of ways.  Since their inception in 1989 Mark Kelley
calendars sales have helped generate over $20,000 in total annual donations to
Discovery Southeast and the Juneau Raptor Center.  Mark is a former soccer coach, and during the
Christmas holiday Mark Kelley’s calendar sales support fundraising efforts by local
soccer teams, raising more than $10,000 each year.  A percentage of sales from Mark’s book “Alaska’s
Watchable Whales” supports the work of whale researcher Jan Straley, and the
Sitka Sound Science Center.
Mark is a
regular speaker at community events and with his slideshows shares the beauty
of Southeast Alaska with locals and visitors alike.  Mark Kelley supports the local public schools
with product donations.
In 2006
Mark Kelley self-funded the exhibit “Alaska’s Watchable Whales: Humpback and
Killer Whales” featured in the Governors Gallery at the Alaska State Museum.Awards
2013
-First Place, 2013 Nature’s Best Windland Smith Rice Photography Awards,
Outdoor Adventure Category
-2013 Award of Excellence, Communications Arts

Showcase

story:
About The Body Project

The Body Project mission is to create awareness about body acceptance and self-love in a society where beauty standards and body-type bashing are so prevalent.

Katy Wimer of katy daixon photography is working to create a gallery and book and magazines of photographs and personal stories from about 80 women (spanning from all over southern Wisconsin to Chicago, and even a few from out of state: Florida and California) of all shapes, sizes, personalities, etc. that makes a statement on the phrase "body positive." The gallery will be displayed throughout the month of November and the books/magazines will launch November 15th at the Opening Reception of the gallery.



What We Need

We need roughly $5,000 in order to:

1. Cover costs of the prints/materials for a gallery show of 85 photographs

2. Host an opening reception w/ catered hors d'oeuvres at the Cultural Arts Center in Whitewater, WI

3. Maintain The Body Project blog: www.lovebodyproject.wordpress.com

4. Create and purchase up to 50 books and 50 magazines of the project

*Please note, we're bummed that we're unable to provide perks for this campaign as all of the donations are needed to go directly toward the cost of materials so we can make this powerful project more public than it has been for the past year. We appreciate any contribution you can offer and will thank you with a million hugs. <3



The Impact

Your contribution will greatly impact our community, not only on a small scale, but a larger one as well, with regard to body acceptance and self-love. The gallery and books/magazines are a perfect conclusion to a year long project and are needed to display a job well done. Everyone involved in this project is eager to see it in its entirety and share it with their friends and family.

Your contribution will also help make a stronger gallery as we'll be able to purchase nicer materials to print, frame, and hang the photographs and give us the ability to pre-purchase books and magazines to have for sale so others get to have the entire project in their hands, too.



Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, that's okay! Please share the campaign with those you think would be interested, spread the word around about The Body Project and it's mission, the gallery, and the publications. You can also simply cheer us on with positive reinforcement.Indiegogo has share tools, so spread it like wild fire! Thank you for any help/support you can offer. It means so much to us!

story:
Paint Our Town

Paint Our Town is a campaign to raise funds to install artwork outdoors in the small Town of Gibsons, British Columbia (near Vancouver).  It's an initiative of the Outdoor Art Gallery.  It will be a year-round exhibition of original artwork on building walls and also attached to free standing wooden structures on public lands! Sculpture will also be included as the Gallery expands.

The Town of Gibsons has granted us approval to use public property for the installation of the Gallery's up to 40  pieces of local weatherproof artwork, including 30 two dimensional originals and 10 sculptures.

All artwork will be for sale, and at the end of the year long exhibition, anything not sold will be auctioned off thus enabling us to install a  fresh batch of artwork. With your help,  the Outdoor Art Gallery will become the only social enterprise Gallery in the World, operating entirely outdoors.  No bricks, no mortar, just FRESH ART in the FRESH AIR

It will be a unique venue for artists to showcase their work, will beautify the Town and will attract much needed tourism thus benefiting local merchants. 

                                                       A view of Gibsons harbour

Following the Gallery's first successful year of operation in Gibsons, the Outdoor Art Gallery will continue to open similar Paint Our Town exhibits in various small Towns throughout British Columbia and North America with artwork specific to that particular community. We believe that an outdoor art gallery will have the biggest impact in smaller towns where the citizens can actively support the artists.

As seen in the image below, the first 4' x 8' piece by Elizabeth Ann Evans was recently unveiled and will be installed  in the Town.

"Trilogy in Time" characterizes sea, land & sky with an eagle, whale & deer. The dim shadow of a bear emphasizes to us that if habitats disappear, so too will the animals whose survival depends upon them.

"The Outdoor Art Gallery is a movement to install artwork outside the walls of a gallery and into the community where it can be appreciated by more people.  Fresh Art in the Fresh Air."

We Value Our Supporters!

We want to make sure all of our supporters understand our appreciation and love for them. Don't miss out on these limited Rewards:

$5 CAD -- Social Media 'Thank You' -- We will send out a personal "Thank You' via Social Media so the whole world knows how awesome you are.
$10 CAD -- Live Vicariously -- We will send you a Hi-Def image of any of the installed artwork. Set it as your computer background, print your own copy or just stare at it when wishing you were exploring the beauty of nature and art simultaneously. (Also receive the $5 Reward)
$30 CAD -- Sponsor Monster -- Watch your name get blasted on our Sponsor Wall and 'Paint Our Town' Website.  You will also receive a small print in the mail  of one of the artworks, personally signed by the artist.  (Also receive all previous rewards)
$50 CAD -- Poster-ized -- Receive a poster print of any art installation in the Outdoor Art Gallery. (Also receive all previous rewards)
$100 CAD -- Signed Print -- Receive a special edition signed print of your favorite art installation in the Outdoor Art Gallery. (Also receive all previous rewards)
$250 CAD -- Speak Your Mind -- You'll have 30 minutes to Skype with the artist of your favorite work of art. Trying to figure out the best technique for painting your next masterpiece? Then this is perfect for you! (Also receive all previous rewards)
$500 CAD -- Bronze Patron -- Enjoy more than one piece of art at the Outdoor Art Gallery? Receive a signed special edition  catalogue book of artwork displaying all artwork installed throughout the Town and get recognized as a 'Paint Our Town' Bronze Patron! (Also receive all previous rewards)
$1,000 CAD -- Silver Patron -- Meet the artists at a VIP reception prior to the opening of an exhibition of works by the Outdoor Gallery artists who will be exhibiting small originals of the larger works being displayed outdoors.  You will be treated like the important patron that you are - with special recognition at the event.  If you can't make the event, we'll include you by skype or phone so that you will feel like part of the Patron family.  Bring a guest and enjoy the art and the artists.  (Includes previous rewards)
$2,500 CAD -- Gold Patron -- Take advantage of this GOLDen opportunity to meet the artists at a VIP reception prior to the opening of an exhibition of works by the Outdoor Gallery artists. Ride in style to the OAG Gala in a limo and get recognized, not only as a Gold Patron, but as a guest of OAG. On top of everything, you'll also get 10% off all OAG artwork for LIFE. (All previous rewards included)
$5,000 CAD -- Founding Patron -- Your name will be placed on one of the installations as a Patron.  You will receive the Founders invitation to attend the VIP reception, transported by limo to the event and recognized as a Founding Patron.  You will receive a personally escorted tour of the outdoor gallery and assistance in setting one up in your own Town if desired.  Lessons, discussions, studio tours, private dinners with artists will all be made available.  This reward will be customized for every Founding Patron.

Taking It One Brush Stroke at a Time

In order to successfully install the Outdoor Art Gallery, we need your support in raising $12,000 CAD, which will be used to pay for the installations including...

  • Structures for Artwork
  • Legal & insurance
  • Publicity & Social Media
  • Hi-Res Photography of the Art
  • Postcard prints
  • Poster prints
  • Limited Edition prints
  • Postage
  • Fulfillment of rewards
  • Event video/photos
  • Commemorative book
  • Gallery website

Averaged out, each installation costs approximately $2,000.  Our goal is to install a minimum of 6 installations and of course, if we exceed this goal, additional installations will be possible.  We have identified about 40 locations where we'd love to Paint Our Town. 

The Local Impact

The Town of Gibsons, BC has a small population of 4,000 people, and is part of a community of small towns known as the Sunshine Coast. Transportation into the area is very difficult due to the total lack of roads and the sole option is a 40 minute ferry ride across Howe Sound into the Town.

The Town granted the Gallery permission to use public lands and buildings due to the perceived community benefits, which include the added perk of delighting tourists and simultaneously benefiting artists. The Outdoor Art Gallery will brighten up and beautify the Town. It will also benefit local merchants since more art-inspired tourists will spend more time and money in the Town.


Sample Installation #1

Bare, Blank, Boring Wall - Before the Paint Our Town Campaign

   Vibrant, Colorful Wall - After the Paint Our Town campaign  (concept photo)

Sample Installation #2

Typical, Dull Wall - Before the Paint Our Town Campaign

Exciting, Bright & Inspirational Wall - After the Paint Our Town campaign  (concept photo)


Sample Installation #3

Gloomy, Dim & Distracting Wall - Before the Paint Our Town Campaign

Luminous, Vivid & Lively Wall - After the Paint Our Town campaign  (concept photo)


Sample Installation #4

Monotonous, Tedious Wall - Before the Paint Our Town Campaign

Uplifting, Breathtaking & Provocative Wall - After the Paint Our Town campaign  (concept photo)

Art Walk

An art walk map will be printed and distributed so that art lovers can take a stroll and see all the artwork.  The map will show the locations and the names of artists and their works. 

In addition, we will provide a downloadable smartphone application that will map the art walk and provide viewers with information about the art and the artist. 

Funding the Arts

We are making all the artwork available for sale plus we will be seeking ongoing sponsorships and sell prints, cards and books of the artwork.  We are committed to a healthy arts community in Gibsons and thus a portion of any profit will be donated to art related projects and activities in the Town.  The more installations we achieve, the greater the potential funding we can generate.

What About Your Town?

If you live in a small Town, perhaps it would benefit from a Paint Our Town campaign of its own.  Once we've established the Outdoor Art Gallery in Gibsons, we'll have a blueprint for other Towns.  It's part of our mission - to expand the Outdoor Art Gallery concept so that other Towns and artists benefit.  In helping us, you will potentially be helping out other Towns as well. 

Risks & Challenges

To operate an Outdoor Art Gallery, we have some challenges that you, our supporters should be aware of:

  • Weather - ensuring the two dimensional artwork will withstand the weather, including rain, hot sun and wind. To overcome this, we will require that the work be weatherproofed with silicone and varnishes and that the panels used will be suitable for an outdoor environment. 
  • Vandalism - we are concerned that there might be vandalism or "tagging" of the artwork.  In similar small communities where public artwork is on display this hasn't become a major problem.  We believe that continual communication, especially with the Town's youth will sensitize them to the benefits of the gallery. We will be working with the Town's youth outreach counselors to avoid this from becoming a problem.  
  • Theft - while this is always a concern, we will be working with law enforcement in the Town to request they pay particular attention to the issue.  In addition, the artworks will be large works and in many cases they will require specialized equipment to remove.  Again, education and awareness are the principal tools to prevent this from occurring.
  • Establishment of anything new is a challenge.  One of the inspirations for the Paint Our Town project was the small town of Chemainus, BC who installed, over a period of 30 years, 42 murals.  We are expecting to install that same number of works in a much shorter time and then rotate the work on an annual exhibition cycle.

Who's Behind this Initiative

The initiators of the Outdoor Art Gallery have over 40 years of business and art experience. 

William Baker is a lifelong entrepreneur, having started and built several companies.  He is also a Chartered Professional Accountant.

Elizabeth Evans is an award winning artist, having studied with some of the legends in Canadian art - notably Arthur Lismer, a founding member of the Group of Seven (Canada's most famous group of painters). Her work is collected worldwide by museum and corporate collectors including the Royal Palace in Monaco. They've lived in Gibsons for about 5 years and count every day spent there as a special day.

 Vandalism - we are concerned that there might be vandalism or "tagging" of the artwork.  In similar small communities where public artwork is on display this hasn't become a major problem.  We believe that continual communication, especially with the Town's youth will sensitize them to the benefits of the gallery. We will be working with the Town's youth outreach counselors to avoid this from becoming a problem.  
Theft - while this is always a concern, we will be working with law enforcement in the Town to request they pay particular attention to the issue.  In addition, the artworks will be large works and in many cases they will require specialized equipment to remove.  Again, education and awareness are the principal tools to prevent this from occurring. 

Establishment of anything new is a challenge.  One of the inspirations for the Paint Our Town project was the small town of Chemainus, BC who installed, over a period of 30 years, 42 murals.  We are expecting to install that same number of works in a much shorter time and then rotate the work on an annual exhibition cycle.


Who's Behind this Initiative

The initiators of the Outdoor Art Gallery have over 40 years of business
 and art experience.  
William Baker is a lifelong entrepreneur, having started and built several companies.  He is also a Chartered Professional Accountant. 
 Elizabeth Evans is 
an award winning artist, having studied with some of the legends in Canadian art - notably Arthur Lismer, a founding member of the Group of Seven (Canada's most famous group of painters). Her work is collected worldwide by museum and corporate collectors including the Royal Palace in Monaco. They've lived in Gibsons for about 5 years and count every day spent there as a special day.

story:
Underground Runway

The platform for unsigned, under  recognized talent.

This funding campaign is designed to launch UGRW into the next fiscal year. Underground Runway is poised to apply for and receive grants, but before that can happen we must raise the support of individuals--and that means you!

Engaging with UGRW programming, our participants are presented with short and long term strategies for personal and professional growth. Your gift will support our collaborating artists, most of which are Oakland based, of color, students, and between the ages of 18-26. Underground Runway programming bridges the gap towards a professional career, and answers the question of "what next". Students grasp the potential behind their dreams, and under recognized artists are able to share their work and mentor students. During fall of 2013, Underground Runway furthered these collaborative efforts through engagement with a growing community of small businesses and social business ventures in Oakland, including Runway Style House Boutique and Vessel Gallery.

Underground Runway leadership is made up of Creative Director Tiffany Stewart and Executive Producer Hazel Streete.  In 2008 armed with creative intuition, Tiffany Stewart began the launch of Underground Runway Scholarship. The creative concepts undertaken by UGRW display her range of skill as a fashion artist. Hazel Streete is a double alumna of Mills College, having earned her MBA focused on nonprofit management. She joined UGRW in 2012, very much inspired by the work of artists.

UGRW appreciates the support the community has shown us to date--including our nomination for the Oakland Indie Awards. We are grateful for your financial support at this time as we draw in talent to Oakland, and build a platform for unsigned and under recognized talent to proudly stand on!

What we need

This funding campaign will propel UGRW into the next fiscal year with its newly granted fiscal sponsorship. Underground Runway is required by our fiscal sponsor to raise at least $1,000 via support of individuals prior to applying for and receiving grants.

We are working on an operational budget for UGRWs year round programming. Participants, who have diverse backgrounds in areas such as media arts, photography, design and journalism, are often amazed at what they are able to accomplish exchanging skills, talent and resources. Check out some of our innovative collaborations here.

Risks & Challenges

Start up mode is challenging, and UGRW is in it for the long haul! Underground Runway has a solid history of producing art based collaborative events for the Oakland community. UGRW leadership is well equipped for this phase of non-profit start-up mode, and has collective experience in working with, and mentoring youth. We strongly feel that the hardest part of the journey is behind us, after 2 years of programming without a fiscal sponsor. At last, Underground Runway is in a place to raise the money needed, as such the challenges we currently face are mostly irrational doubt--easily overcome by exceptional results found in UGRW collaborations. Click here for one of our greatest examples, the UGRW Magazine Spring 2014 publication.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this funding campaign!

Local to Oakland?

UGRW is having a fundraising shindig, July 26th 2014. Summer Flourish is to be held at a private Oakland location--Click here for information on joining the Summer Flourish Host Committee.

story:
We've just had a beautiful Autumn in Melbourne

I'd like to share my portrayal of it to those out there who like Autumn as much as me!

 

 

Royal Botanical Gardens, Melbourne

 

My Story

 

I decided to drop out of uni and pursue art with all my effort

I went through high school with a heavy emphasis on maths subjects (go figure, Asian parents hey). I got into Aerospace Engineering and studied 2 and a half years. 

During that course I remember feeling like a shell of a human being. I fell into a process of believing that life success was based on grades. I had never learnt about humanities, history, literature. I had an overwhelming feeling that even if I were to graduate and go through that route, I would miss out on developing other crucial facets of my being.

It's been 4 years since that decision

I barely posted content online. I kept my head down and practised nearly every day.

The internet is an amazing resource. I taught myself drawing, 3D modelling, history, humanities, philosophy, health and anything else that tickled my curious side.

During these years I've been humbled. Every year my perspective has changed and I have grown patience and a better long term view.

 

Royal Botanical Gardens, Melbourne 

 

Whats on offer

Here are my latest works. There are 4 pieces to choose from. This will be the only run of prints I do of these pieces!!

They are a culmination of my time and effort over the years. When I began 4 years ago, my drawings were not great. I used 3D modelling as an aid to help my perspective and began really studying art, looking at pieces online and at galleries and museums and tried to take in as much information as I could handle.

These are my latest paintings using acrylic, oil and charcoal. I'm nearing completion of these drawings and nothing feels better than sharing my work! If I know people out there like my style I'll work even harder to complete these pieces to the best of my ability! For real.

Pledge now if you like my art

You'll be supporting me financially and emotionally to tackle bigger and better projects in the future. It's my dream to travel around the world, soak in the sights and portray the world through my lens.

 

Yarra River, Melbourne

 

 

For people living in Melbourne, Australia I'll personally deliver your items and refund 50% of shipping!

The blue bar indicates level of completion

If you'd like a print that isn't in the group of 4 send me a message and I'll happily honour your request!

Have a good day

 

 

 

 


various other creations (Paint, Charcoal, Photoshop)

story:
The exhibition PHOTOTAXIS - the movement towards light, will be held from 25th to 31st October 2018, at Untitled Factory in Paris.

 We sincerely thank you for your support to our project.

                                                  Pierre Bellot - Untitled (Japanese bath), 2017

In this exhibition, we employ light as an artistic expression to stimulate the interaction between human beings. Our interest is developing a discourse on the influence of artificial light on social behavior, expecially after the development of synthetic light sources and electronic devices.

Light plays a vital role in regulating our circadian rhythm, as one of our natural biological rhythms: human beings are naturally dependent on physical and psychological light. In addition, light can easily create and intervene in space, leading to different perspectives of the same space and a feeling of integration in the virtual space. 

In Phototaxis - the movement towards light, we explore different interpretations of light from a scientific and philosophical perspective, with the continuous reference to history of art.

We have invited eight artists to partecipate to our exhibition.

Roland Burkart, a French artist based in Munich and recently featured in Salon de Montrouge , will present a video work.

Mali Arun, a French artist based in Berlin, will present a sculpture that was recently featured in Salon de Montrouge 2018.

Helen Dowling, a British artist based in Amsterdam, will present two commissioned brand-new neon sculptures.

Emilie Brout and Maxime Marion, a duo of French artists based in Paris, will present a sculpture part of their famous installation "The Return of The Broken Screen".

Pierre Bellot, a French artist based in Paris, will present an oil painting on paper that was featured in 100% Beaux-Arts show at La Villette.

Matteo Fieni, a Swiss artist based in Paris, will present a serie of photographs recently displayed at Cité Internationale des Arts, as the artist is resident there.

Ellen Barratt, a British artist based in London and who just graduated from art school, will present her immersive installation. 

                               

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Mali Arun, Kein Licht (Sans lumière), 2017

 

We need a total of 1000 euros for the exhibition.

All the funding will be used in 4 parts:

1. Venue rental: 65% of the funding will be used to rent a place to hold the exhibition;

2. Support of artists, insurance and transportation of artworks: 25% of the funding will go to the artistic support;

3. Venue installation and vernissage: 7% of the funding will be used to buy equipment and materials for exhibition and vernissage;

4. Communication: 3% of the funding will be used for printed materials.

 

We take this opportunity to thank you for your support and for believing in this project.

story:
I started Youtube in 2014 as a way to let my creative energy flow. A couple years later, I decided to share the one thing I felt I was good at; art. But after a while I was tired of creating speedpaints and traditional art videos - I wanted to step outside the box to do something I hadn't seen on Youtube before; I decided to make relatable art content in a series of "artist problem" videos. They became a huge success and my career took a 360 degree turn and I found myself a full time artist and Youtuber.

I still receive hundreds of comments every month with people sharing their relatable art problems and experiences with me. I realized very quickly that MY art problems were EVERY artists problems too. And so, the idea for "Artist Problem Pins" blossomed. 

THE PINS;

I would love to create an entire series of pins that relate to being an artist. There are thousands of pins out there, but none like what I have designed. None that actually represent what it means to be an artist.

Whether you know me or my channel or not, these pins are something I have designed and drawn from scratch, and I feel that they are fun and relatable for every artist out there. To create something the artist community can wear or display with pride, to say "yeah. I'm an artist." 

THE REWARDS;

If I don't want all the pins but pledge for some of them, how do I tell you which pins I want?

When the campaign has ended, I will send you a direct email asking you for the pins of your choice. MAKE SURE that you enter the correct details and keep an eye out on your emails otherwise I won't know which pins you want!

 

How long until I receive the pins?

The Pins will take approximately 4-6 weeks to get to you once the campaign has ended. It takes a while for indigogo to release the funds to me, so when I get the funds, I have to get the pins manufactured at a factory, which is a lengthy process. I then await the pins to be sent to me, then I can send them to you! If it will be longer or shorter than this, I will let you know.

I appreciate any form of support on making this dream a reality. Whether it be in purchasing the pins or simply sharing on social media to those you think would like them. It would mean the world.

Thanks!

Chloe Rose

http://www.youtube.com/mschlosey

http://www.twitter.com/mschlosey

http://www.instagram.com/mschlosey

Risks and challenges

I do not expect there to be any risks or challenges during this time. If an issue may arise in pin design, I work from home so it should take little to no time to rectify. I am working with an excellent pin maker who is very transparent about what they need from me. They have assured me that the pins will be created and shipped out to me in a very short period of time at the highest quality available. I will consistently update my Kickstarter if any issues arise, alongside giving updates to the project and when you can expect your package!

story:
Hi Everyone!  My name is Mark Arnold and I was born and raised in Pittsburgh, PA.  Before I began ceramics I rode BMX bicycles.  This had given me the opportunity to travel and meet people from all over the world.  After an accident that kept me on crutches for almost a year, I fell in love with pottery at my father-in-law’s studio.  Shortly after, I began taking classes at a community college.

For the past 9 years I have had access to a studio while receiving my BFA from Edinboro University of Pennsylvania, MFA from Southern Illinois University of Edwardsville, and I have just finished up a year artist in residence at Pocosin Arts in Columbia, NC.

My wife, Caitlin McDonald, and I have been fortunate enough to attend the same schools, earning her BFA and MFA in jewelry and metalsmithing along with a BSAE in art education.  She has recently accepted a position teaching middle school art in Elizabeth City, NC where we have just purchased our first home.  The only part now, is I don’t have access to a studio to work in.

Currently, we have a large workshop in the backyard that will make for the perfect studio space but it is lacking electricity, plumbing, insulation, lighting, shelving, and many other studio necessities.  (So pretty much it’s a wooden box on a concrete slab.)  Through the generosity of a local potter, I have received a kiln in addition to the test kiln I already own.

 

By donating to my campaign, you should know that it will help fund turning this space into a fully functioning studio.  Any donations made that exceed the campaign goal will be used for things in the studio that I may have under estimated the cost of, wish list items, and studio upkeep.   

Having my own studio has been a dream of mine for a long time. Not only will I use the space to make my pottery, I also envision it as a space that I can contribute to the arts community here in Elizabeth City.  Just in the short time of being here, I have already found so much support. 

By backing my campaign there are a number of perks to choose from.  Handmade pottery such as mugs, plates, bowl, etc.  All of which will be made in the new studio funded by your generosity.

I am so grateful to be a part of such an amazing ceramics community, none of this would happen without you!  In whatever way you are able to contribute, whether donating or sharing my campaign on Instagram and Facebook, it is all greatly appreciated . . . THANK YOU!!!  If you have any questions or suggestions, please feel free to contact me. If you would like me to ship internationaly please contact me. 

 

And again, thank you for taking the time.

A special thanks to Eric Botbyl for all of his help and support!!!!

story:
TIC TAC ART CENTRE

 

THE PROJECT : To Establish An Art Centre

 

About two years ago, I started to think that it might be time to take a break from jumping on and off airplanes. And it might be time to do what I’ve always done in just one place -dance, perform, teach and create-. Above all, I want to open a place for the real time transmission of Flying Low, Passing Through and Dance Improvisation. That would be the center piece of the project but I also want the visual art to be a part of it.

Today, this dream could become reality since I have recenlty found a suitable location to build THE TICTAC ART CENTRE. Now, our plan is to occupy this place by building two dance studios, an art gallery and several workshop areas welcoming multidisciplinary artists, especially to draw, sew and paint.

 

THE BUILDING : More than 1000 M² !

The place happens to be a former printing house that has recently closed, And I just signed a 9 year lease.

The building is HUGE! There’s enough room for a dance floor that measure’s 300 square meters! The ceiling is 5 meters high and there are no columns.

But there’s more : Next to where I want to build the dance floor, there’s room to build showers, toilets and a big dressing room. There’s space for a lounge where you can relax, eat and drink during breaks in classes or breaks in performances. There’s even room to build another smaller dance studio for Martin Kilvady, an artist from Slovakia.

So far, I’ve only told you about the ground floor !

On the first floor, I would like to build a visual arts studio. Some of you know that I paint a lot these days. Mat Voorter, (who is actually my partner) a Dutch dance artist and costume designer would design and sew costumes there. But we will welcome other artists to come and work there as well.

Outside the main building is another smaller building closer to the street. We’d like to transform that into a gallery for the visual arts and other pop-up activities.

OUR GOALS : An Alternative place for everyone

So you can see that I am thinking big: At the TICTAC ART CENTRE, there will be daily dance classes, intensive workshops, and improvisation performances for the general public -I'm thinking about at least one performance per week, most probably every saturday. There will be performance artists of all levels on a very BIG DANCE FLOOR.

THE TICTAC ART CENTER WILL BE AN ALTERNATIVE ART CENTER FOR MANY OF YOU as well.

The ceiling is 5 meters high and there are no columns.But there’s more : Next to where I want to build the dance floor, there’s room to build showers, toilets and a big dressing room. There’s space for a lounge where you can relax, eat and drink during breaks in classes or breaks in performances. There’s even room to build another smaller dance studio for Martin Kilvady, an artist from Slovakia.So far, I’ve only told you about the ground floor !On the first floor, I would like to build a visual arts studio. Some of you know that I paint a lot these days. Mat Voorter, (who is actually my partner) a Dutch dance artist and costume designer would design and sew costumes there. But we will welcome other artists to come and work there as well.Outside the main building is another smaller building closer to the street. We’d like to transform that into a gallery for the visual arts and other pop-up activities.OUR GOALS : An Alternative place for everyoneSo you can see that I am thinking big: At the TICTAC ART CENTRE, there will be daily dance classes, intensive workshops, and improvisation performances for the general public -I'm thinking about at least one performance per week, most probably every saturday. There will be performance artists of all levels on a very BIG DANCE FLOOR.THE TICTAC ART CENTER WILL BE AN ALTERNATIVE ART CENTER FOR MANY OF YOU as well.

story:
The photo book What Remains is the story of 14 people who have Alzheimers. It celebrates who they are and what they cherish. Although at times documentary in format, it is created as an art piece, intentionally portraying them in a way that does not betray their condition but focuses on the one thing that they love most, that which still today, defines them. It is also a personal series that chronicles my own journey - 3 years of visits to the Saint Monique nursing home, one of Brussels' most diverse and independent nursing homes - getting to know these people, collecting their stories, and reflecting on memory and loss. Now, I'm looking for your help, to publish this work as a book.

Charles and his clarinet. The residents call him the Chef d'Orchestre which amuses and flatters him. He speaks of his band tours with a twinkle in his eye and loves to play, whether for an audience or for the wind.

Why is this book important?

There are currently an estimated 50 million people worldwide living with dementia, with one new case every three seconds.  Dementia knows no social, economic, ethnic or geographical boundaries and currently has no cure.  Each experience of this illness is unique yet dementia is often hidden away, not spoken about, not even diagnosed, often feared or ignored. Those affected are often stigmatized and become, with their families and caregivers, isolated.

This project intends to lift the stigma associated with the illness, give it a real face, humanize it by focusing on the beautiful faces and stories of real men and women who are affected by it. It encourages conversations about dementia beyond whispers in homes or care centers to a wider audience. I believe that if we can change people’s perception of this illness, we can protect those affected from the isolation, support care and research programmes that are inclusive and caring, and create an open dialogue around dementia.

Edith nurtures space, that which sits between breaths, between people, between words. She always loved writing. When she first came to the nursing home she’d often add notes to nurses’ daily journal. What betrayed her, was the fact that her handwriting was so beautiful. 

Who am I and what's my story?

My father, whom I adored was diagnosed with advanced Alzheimers in 2010. A proud, public and intelligent man, he worked hard at hiding his condition, including to us, his family, so to not worry or burden us. Obsessed with secretly understanding my father and what he was going through, my response was to learn all I could about this disease - started reading all I could about the illness, asking doctors questions and even taking online courses, making random connections to the condition everywhere.

One day I read about how Polaroid fades and all the ways people make sure this doesn't happen. I instantly made me think of dementia and how this technology was similar to the illness and how essentially it was a metaphor for the ephemerality of life. In that moment, I imagined a portrait series of people who had Alzheimer's on Polaroid.

In 2015, when my father suddenly passed away and I became a mother shortly after, my series idea haunted me and I had the calling to move it out of my head and finally produce this work - regardless of what came of this work. I am thrilled to be able to show this work in an exhibition for the upcoming September Alzheimers Awareness Month in Brussels. 

    What will your contribution support?

    I have already self-funded collecting all the portraits and stories. If the campaign is successful, we will develop a beautiful art book of these portraits and these stories (polaroid, words, qoutes, ancedotes and annotations). Our intention is to create a book that feels like an art object, a play on paper, an experience, an extension of the accompanying travelling exhibition. Funds will be used to have the photographs professionally scanned, the book designed and printed, as well the shipping and logistics of the perks. 

    If we surpass our goal, this will allow for the exhbit to be translated into other languages than English and for extra copies of the book to be printed and donated to schools, support groups, and nursing homes. We hope that the book will be used as a tool to discuss compassion and care for those with dementia.

    If you have suggestions regarding groups, nursing homes, schools, and other organisations we should connect with, please email me.

    Why Crowdfunding?

    While the What Remains project has always been self-funded, publishing a book is very expensive and requires that I hire others. I also see this crowdfunding campaign, like the book, as a means to engage with a wider audience, open up positive conversations about dementia.

    Risks & Challenges

    I expect the book to be published by September 2018, but because we are in the early stages of the production process, delays may arise. We have, of course, planned and are doing our outmost to avoid delays. I will regularly update contributors with the status of the project.

    Also, given today’s publishing environment, an art book can be a risk. That is why I have decided to distribute the book through this campaign, online and at the galleries where the exhibition will be held. And hopefully at handful of specialized art book shops.

    Thank you very much for your help! 
    Whether you have pledged or helped to spread the word, your support means a lot!

story:
The Pin And Me:

My name is Alexandra and I'm a full time artist from Finland

I've been wanting to do this pin for over a year now and I've also worked months on this design so it's very close to my heart to finish this project.

Why I Need YOU:

To make a hard enamel pin ( size 38mm ) is somewhat expensive and that's why I'm here.

So my goal is to get 500€ in 30 days and with that I can : 

- Order this cute juice box ( Poppy Moth ) pin 

- Design and order backing cards

- Order cute smaller envelopes 

 

Poppy Moth Pin Includes : 

1x Poppy Moth Pin

1x Exclusive Poppy Moth Sticker 

1x Handwritten Thank You card 

 

Poppy Moth Exclusive Sticker Includes:

1xPoppy Moth Sticker 

1x Handwritten Thank You Card

story:
Short Summary

Hello! My name is Chelsea Rose. I believe in bringing art into people's lives on a regular basis. My small business is currently focused on just the work I create and showcase online and in person. I am looking for help to get to the next level in my business to offer regular art parties and produce art print postcards. With your donation or pre-order we can print these cards and I can help develop an art-making habit of people in Jacksonville and Naples, Florida. 

Please consider propelling my small business into 2015! 

UPDATE!
  • TWO GOALS: The feedback I have gotten is: MORE ART PARTIES! And I would love to add that to this campaign! 
  • I am adjusting the quantities for the postcards to allocate funds from this campaign to purchase the storage and supplies for art parties to be held throughout the spring and summer of 2015 (see more below). 
  • Check out the pictures of the unique artworks that people have made through my sessions in December, 2014. 

--------------------

  • I am campaigning for the start up funds to reproduce 8 of my mixed media and watercolor paintings on 4x6 postcards in two series: "The Beach Series" and "The Abstract Series". 
  • Each series will showcase 4 images. See images below or in the Gallery.
  • Each pack will include 8 cards: 2 of each image from the series.
  • On the back of each art print, I will print the layout of a post card! In order to spread the art you can hand it to a friend, post in in your home or mail it to let someone know you're thinking of them. 
  • These cards will be manufactured with the environment in mind: post-consumer waste, recycled content, plant and soy-based inks, chlorine-free processes. Even the packaging will be eco-friendly, biodegradable clear film bags, and stickers.
  • Contributing to my campaign will bring more art to people's lives and will grow by small artistic business exponentially!

Where the Funds Go - Updated!

Money splits up to art parties, product and time:

  • Updated! $1250 goes to the printing and packaging materials of 750 packs. 375 of each series.
  • An original 4X6 inch mixed media and watercolor painting sells for $15. In order to spread the art, a pack of 2 each of 4 images will retail at $12.50 - making each print $1.56! A much better deal than $15 each image. 
  • Boosted costs for post-consumer recycled paper with vegetable and soy-based inks from greenerprinter.com.
  • $250 For biodegradable clear baggies and conscious stickers for product packaging (all 6000 cards will be hand signed and handled with love).
  • From the remainder $1000, half will go to the supplies for 250 12x12 canvases, the paint, brushes and assorted extra supplies to make the art truly special, the other half will go towards a storage unit that is easy to access and outfit it with shelves to make the best use of the space for the next year.  
  • Sustainability: it provides the capital to continue marketing the art parties, innovating new lessons, introducing new techniques and promoting the cards, while creating new images to keep interest in the Chelsea Rose Art brand.  

What You Get

The goodies! You get to pre-order your 'post'able art prints at a discounted price! 

  • Check out your fast track to these beautiful eco-friendly reproductions of original art over on the right in the perks column! 
  • Each print can be sent in the mail OR displayed in a regular 4x6 inch frame on your desk, wall, dresser. Since the series has 8 prints - interchange the four images as for your mood or display them all together! AND you can still send off four!
  • You become a valued member of my team, I'll update with possibilities for new series selections - check out my facebook page or instagram and you'll see the variety of beach scenes I polled my fans on - I love hearing your opinions of my work!
  • If I don't reach my entire goal, the funds go back to you. And we gave it the good ole' college try. I will continue to create and sell original artwork with each 6x4 image going for $15. 

The Good

Your contribution to Help Propel Chelsea Rose Art: A Small Business will change my life and more importantly promote small business, the arts and hand-written communication in the world. I will hand sign each print so that the receiver knows each image is unique. So to break down what's awesome about this campaign:

  • Spreading Art!
  • Making Art 
  • Sending Notes
  • Sharing Experiences
  • Contributing to the growth of a small business

The Hurdles

First things first: This is a Fixed Funding campaign, that means we make it to the goal, or there are no pieces of 'post'able art prints to share. Secondly, paper post is making a comeback, now that we realize it is valuable let's celebrate it - send a postcard to a friend or cousin. 

  • Marketing to larger groups - I am researching appropriate retail stores to target these eco-friendly postcards. 
  • Versatility - With the simple back of this post card it's easy to write a quick note and hand it to a friend, they can post the print on their fridge or use it as a book mark. 
  • These eight images are great, but what now? With the capital that is generated from this campaign I will continue to paint and create images so that more series can exist - the facebook page and the instagram (chelsearoseart) show off my in progress works. 

Every Effort Counts

Think these post cards art prints are super neat and you want to share them with the world? 
  • Go ahead! Pin it, Share it, Tweet it. 
  • You can also just talk about it, show your friends or your family. 
  • Spread pretty pictures and brighten people's days! (Look in the gallery for more images)

These eight images are great, but what now? With the capital that is generated from this campaign I will continue to paint and create images so that more series can exist - the facebook page and the instagram (chelsearoseart) show off my in progress works.     Every Effort Counts

Go ahead! Pin it, Share it, Tweet it. 
You can also just talk about it, show your friends or your family. 
Spread pretty pictures and brighten people's days! (Look in the gallery for more images)

story:
---

HELP US MAKING THE BONFIRE HAPPEN!

Meanwhile mark Saturday 24th of September on your calendar and get ready!
 

When you do something, you should burn yourself up completely, like a good bonfire, leaving no trace of yourself.

Photo by Martina Ovvio Bianchetti‎


What is The Monster is on Fire?

The Monster Is On Fire is a event that is part of the festival of Cerro al Lambro (MI), under the patronage of the Municipality of Cerro al Lambro. In line with the Italian tradition of burning a "old hag" made of wood to celebrate the new year, we will celebrate the end of summer with a big bonfire, in which we will burn a mythological monster. It is not the first time we have done this: this will be the fourth event! In the first we roasted the Dragon, in the second Medusa, in the third a Minotaur, last Year the Kraken and now it's time to burn Modran the Treebeard!

To make the event more meaningful, when the bonfire collapses, leaving only the embers on the ground, people will be able to overcome the security cordon and throw into the fire their Monster. This can be clothes , a diary, a photograph or whatever you want!

In addition, based on the availability of volunteers, during the day there will be workshops for juggling, archery and percussion, and whoever wants to can participate freely or help us build the pyre.

Every Year we try to organize a bigger and better event and you can make the difference helping us!

Photo of Stefano Rizzi‎ - The monster 2015

Why contribute?

To help us make The Monster Is On Fire a permanent celebration every year. There is a very important thing that we would like to emphasize:

THE EVENT IS ENTIRELY NON-PROFIT. All cash collected is used to cover the expenses of the fire, to pay the Red Cross and the Firefighters presidiating the event and the choreographic stuff as banquets and diesel fuel for jugglers. 

Any excess money will be donated entirely to the Civil Protection and everything will be publicly documented. We would therefore like to make it clear that we gain nothing and we are interested only be able to do the bonfire without losing (too much) money.

As every year we will make a document with the expenses.

Photo of Matteo Lopedota

The official pins of The Monster is on Fire:

‎

 

Take a look at our wonderful t shirt, if you donate at least 30 euros we will give you one!

info: 
tmiof2016@gmail.com

+39-333-3695759


Via Mirandola
C/O Cascina Gazzera
Cerro al Lambro, Milan
Italy

map: http://binged.it/14E3k3P

 

---

AIUTACI A RENDERE IL FALO' REALTA'!
Intanto segnate sul calendario Sabato 24 Settembre e tenetevi pronti!

Quando si fa qualcosa, si dovrebbe bruciare completamente, come un buon falò, senza lasciare traccia di sé stessi.

 

Foto di Martina Ovvio Bianchetti‎

 

Cos'è The Monster is on Fire?

The Monster Is On Fire è un'iniziativa inserita all'interno della sagra di Cerro al Lambro (MI) con il patrocinio del Comune di Cerro al Lambro. In linea con la tradizione italiana di bruciare "la vecchia" di legna per festeggiare l'anno nuovo, celebreremo la fine dell'estate con un grande falò che rappresenta un mostro mitologico. Non è la prima volta che lo facciamo: siamo già alla quarta edizione! Nella prima abbiamo arrostito il Drago, nella seconda Medusa, nella terza un Minotauro, l'anno scorso il Kraken e quest'anno bruceremo Modren il Barbalbero!

Per rendere l'evento più significativo, quando il falò crollerà e rimarranno solo le braci a terra, a turno le persone potranno superare il cordone di sicurezza e lanciare nel fuoco il proprio Mostro. Può essere un vestito, un diario, una fotografia o quello che volete!

Inoltre, in base alle disponibilità dei volontari, durante il giorno si terranno workshop di giocoleria, tiro con l'arco e percussioni e chiunque vorrà potrà partecipare liberamente oppure aiutarci a costruire la pira.

 

Ogni anno cerchiamo di organizzare un evento migliore e più grande e puoi fare la differenza aiutandoci a renderlo reale!

Photo of Stefano Rizzi‎ - The monster 2015

Perché contribuire?

Per aiutarci a rendere The Monster Is On Fire un appuntamento fisso, un momento di ritrovo e di unione. C'è una cosa molto importante che vorremmo sottolineare:

L'EVENTO E' INTERAMENTE NON-PROFIT. Tutti i soldi raccolti servono per coprire le spese del falò, il conto della croce rossa e della protezione civile per averli presenti sul posto e le coreografie come le bancarelle e il gasolio per i giocolieri. 

Eventuali soldi eccedenti verrano donati interamente alla Protezione Civile e tutto sarà documentato pubblicamente. Vorremmo quindi che sia chiaro che non guadagneremo nulla e a noi interessa solo poter fare il falò senza perderci (troppo). 

Come tutti gli anni faremo un rendiconto delle spese. 

Foto di Matteo Lopedota

Le spille ufficiali di The Monster is on Fire:

‎

 

Guarda la nostra bellissima t shirt, se doni almeno 30 euro te ne regaliamo una!

info: 
tmiof2016@gmail.com

+39-333-3695759


Via Mirandola
C/O Cascina Gazzera
Cerro al Lambro, Milan
Italy

map: http://binged.it/14E3k3P

AIUTACI A RENDERE IL FALO' REALTA'!Intanto segnate sul calendario Sabato 24 Settembre e tenetevi pronti!
Quando si fa qualcosa, si dovrebbe bruciare completamente, come un buon falò, senza lasciare traccia di sé stessi.
 

Foto di Martina Ovvio Bianchetti‎
 
Cos'è The Monster is on Fire?
The Monster Is On Fire è un'iniziativa inserita all'interno della sagra di Cerro al Lambro (MI) con il patrocinio del Comune di Cerro al Lambro. In linea con la tradizione italiana di bruciare "la vecchia" di legna per festeggiare l'anno nuovo, celebreremo la fine dell'estate con un grande falò che rappresenta un mostro mitologico. Non è la prima volta che lo facciamo: siamo già alla quarta edizione! Nella prima abbiamo arrostito il Drago, nella seconda Medusa, nella terza un Minotauro, l'anno scorso il Kraken e quest'anno bruceremo Modren il Barbalbero!
Per rendere l'evento più significativo, quando il falò crollerà e rimarranno solo le braci a terra, a turno le persone potranno superare il cordone di sicurezza e lanciare nel fuoco il proprio Mostro. Può essere un vestito, un diario, una fotografia o quello che volete!
Inoltre, in base alle disponibilità dei volontari, durante il giorno si terranno workshop di giocoleria, tiro con l'arco e percussioni e chiunque vorrà potrà partecipare liberamente oppure aiutarci a costruire la pira.
 
Ogni anno cerchiamo di organizzare un evento migliore e più grande e puoi fare la differenza aiutandoci a renderlo reale!

Photo of Stefano Rizzi‎ - The monster 2015
Perché contribuire?
Per aiutarci a rendere The Monster Is On Fire un appuntamento fisso, un momento di ritrovo e di unione. C'è una cosa molto importante che vorremmo sottolineare:
L'EVENTO E' INTERAMENTE NON-PROFIT. Tutti i soldi raccolti servono per coprire le spese del falò, il conto della croce rossa e della protezione civile per averli presenti sul posto e le coreografie come le bancarelle e il gasolio per i giocolieri. 
Eventuali soldi eccedenti verrano donati interamente alla Protezione Civile e tutto sarà documentato pubblicamente. Vorremmo quindi che sia chiaro che non guadagneremo nulla e a noi interessa solo poter fare il falò senza perderci (troppo). 
Come tutti gli anni faremo un rendiconto delle spese. 

Foto di Matteo Lopedota
Le spille ufficiali di The Monster is on Fire:‎
 
Guarda la nostra bellissima t shirt, se doni almeno 30 euro te ne regaliamo una!

info: tmiof2016@gmail.com
+39-333-3695759
Via MirandolaC/O Cascina GazzeraCerro al Lambro, MilanItalymap: http://binged.it/14E3k3P

story:
Here's the skinny!

I'm DJ Sir Daniel ofAtlanta. I have had the opportunity to DJ for mostly Gay men of color in various safe spaces from adult entertainment to upscale art events. In 2016 I began to create events that would pay homage to iconic musicians and movements in modern Black music and package it to queer people of color because no one else was. After a run of four successful events last year, I went beyond typical day parties and utilized my voice as a DJ to affirm the community.

Artist Ajmal Miller and I (DJ Sir Daniel) are collaborating on an art/music event called "Prizmatic."  Ajmal is an accomplished Caribbean carnival costume maker and uses his medium to tell a story of the Diaspora, the Orishas, the contributions of Black men to art & industry while deconstructing the narrative of Black masculinity. As the DJ, I will a provide a sonic backdrop for the evening inspired by Pharrell . We will also take the opportunity to honor the cinematic vision of Hype Williams. The event is taking place at a local art gallery under UV lights (black light.)

Your contributions will allow us to patronize a local art gallery to house the event. Art requires materials and your support will guarantee that Ajmal Miller has the necessary mediums to execute the vision. As stated, this is a multi-media installment that requires lighting, editing and video production.

(Photo: Ajmal Miller and DJ Sir Daniel at work)

Break It Down

Below are the levels of support and the perks for your genorosity:

$1300 will allow this groundbreaking event to become a reality.

Other Ways You Can Help

We are aware that your money is valuable and you have responsibilities. Any amount will get us closer to our goal and will be appreciated. Getting the word out about "Prizmatic" on your social media will be greatly appreciated as well. Thanks in advance for your support!

story:
What is MAIDEN LA?

Maiden LA is an inclusive and expansive county-wide survey of art happenings throughout the month of August, that in encouraging the use of alternative spaces considers the city as a platform for generative discourse and exchange. Maiden LA is 100% inclusive, meaning anyone regardless of background, race, age, etc. who submits a project idea, will be accepted to participate. We wanted to start something that eliminated hierarchies often imposed by the art world and society as a whole.  


Maiden LA was created and organized by the two of us, Molly Schulman and Salomeh Grace. We met in college in upstate NY in 2000, and moved to Los Angeles together after graduating. It was at this point that we started what would become a long-lasting dialogue and a string of collaborations. As two artists trying to navigate the Los Angeles art scene, we felt it was important to create an open network for artists, curators, and art enthusiasts. Our idea of a decentralized, city-wide, biennial of sorts had been percolating for some time and so last year, we took the bull by the horns, and reached out to the community with an open call.

Map from Maiden LA 2016: projects spanned from the Antelope Valley to San Pedro

In its first iteration, the positive response was staggering with over 160 participants all across the county! Events ranged from web-based projects, including a blog that addressed an artist's permanent ban from the US (see video below), to a survey of works by 80s L.A. punk rock scene artist Mary Woronov at the Lodge, a Post-It installation at an artist-run children’s museum in San Gabriel Valley, and a talk with Jackie Winsor at Hauser Wirth and Schimmel.

Antonakis on his Maiden LA 2016 project 

 

Why Maiden LA is so VITAL

One of the amazing aspects of Maiden LA, is that the community is invited to see art that they would not necessarily have the opportunity to experience--they are invited to artists’ private studios, or art in the park or on the street or in someone’s kitchen. And one of the most exciting byproducts for us as organizers was hearing that participants were able to experiment and see projects realized simply because we put out an open call and provided a forum for such experimentation. We can’t wait to see what awesome projects people contribute to this summer’s Maiden LA!

 

Why we need your HELP

Last year we were fortunate enough to receive a grant from a group called Common Field, however the rest of the expenses incurred were out of our very own pockets. We are both artists, independent contractors, and mothers and as much as we’d love to be able to fund Maiden LA ourselves, it is an impossibility. That is why we are reaching out to you for support.  

We learned a great deal last year, and in an effort to streamline and refine this year’s Maiden LA, we will need additional funds. Some of the major innovations we have planned are to add support staff to help with community outreach and documenting events, outsourcing the design and printing of our promotional material and event directory, and hosting a Maiden LA reception where everyone can meet and chat and connect.  

Last summer's Maiden LA reception at The Velaslavasay Panorama (photo by Forest Casey)

 

Share the Maiden LA LOVE

Any and all donations help and as a thank you we will be distributing limited edition Maiden LA merchandise and thanking you publicly via social media and our website. We are so grateful for your dedicated support and really couldn’t pull this off without you.

We want our fundraiser to reach as many people as possible.  We understand not everyone can donate, but you can still help us by spreading the word of Maiden LA!

Connect with us on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter.  

Sign up for our mailing list here.

Again, thank you for your support and we look forward to MAIDEN LA 2017!!!

story:
Free Isabelo's Steam Royals Collection Vol. 2 : Princesses

  • My name is Free Isabelo and I'm a comic book artists working out of Las Vegas, NV.
  • This fundraiser is to help bring my artwork to supporters around the world. 
  • Your contributions will help with production, shipping, promotions, and other expenses.

What We Need & What You Get

  • The project takes a lot of time and money for it to be successful. Unlike other campaigns, I try to get your packages out ASAP!!!  
  • This project will have innovative levels of perks! From signed Jim Lee comics, original artwork, and cool stuff... this fundraiser will feature the level where YOU get to decide what "princess" will be added to the collection!!!
  • ALL money raised for this project will go to the FREE ISABELO'S STEAM ROYALS Vol. 2. Even if we don't reach our goal, I will still get you your packages!!!

story:
Brief summary

Hi everyone, my name is Jupiterfab and I'm an Italian artist based in Barcelona, Spain working on social topics around the world.

I am here today because I have been invited to a mural festival in Niagara Falls, Canada, which has been locally held for over 15 years and finally this year they are opening their doors also to international artists and I feel very proud to have been invited!

Unfortunately they do not have that much funds available so they will only be able to cover a part of the costs of my staying.

I am here today, hoping you can help me support the fight against mental health, that being the main topic of the festival.

Your financial support will help me covering part of the costs, mainly the travel from Spain to Canada. I will not receive any salary for this work but I am happy as I believe it is a great opportunity to be part of such an important cause.

The wall I am going to paint over.


The mural and the Festival

The Niagara International Mural Festival (NIMF) is an annual festival focused on street art taking place in St. Catharines close to Niagara Falls in Ontario, Canada, from 13th to 19th June. It has worked, for over 15 years, to beautify some degraded parts of the city and to give local and regional artists an opportunity to express themselves in a big context. This year they decided to become international but the transition between one period and the other is not that easy, so that they are struggling a bit in terms of funds and organization.

For me to be there, they have been able to cover the costs of paint, scaffolding, meals and a place to sleep but not travel expenses and any extra cost I may have.

The mural!


Despite the money issue I decided to work with them because they are professional and genuine and I really like the topic of this year's festival, which is Mental health. In fact, this year's festival is in collaboration with the St. Catharines Mental Health Organization. The hashtag of the event is #paintoverthestigma.

My contribution to the cause will be a mural of 3500 sq. ft depicting the excess in the use of mobile phones, emphasizing how this fact changes our social and daily life and how it can generate new social and mental disorders. In order to generate discussion and make people reflect on it, I will paint a group of people around a table, alienated by playing endlessly with their cell phone instead of talking to or interacting with each other.

If I have your contribution, I will be able to help.


Mural I made in Athens in 2015


Jupiterfab

I work on social art. I think art can be a strong tool to help society to self-reflect about our way of life and to support the communities' work.

I focus my observation on the feelings and emotions of human beings and I depict them in a realistic way, aiming to attract people's attention, make them stop for a second and reflect on modern society and consumerism world and how their rules interfere and change rapidly our habits and our lives, and quite often in a negative way.

I create murals, paintings and sound installations but I consider murals the strongest tool to reach audiences and my favorite media too.

The wall as it will be (the empty wall will be white)

For the last 10 years, I have been collaborating with art galleries as well as public and private institutions worldwide, such as the Court of Justice of Rotterdam, the Barcelona Subway, U of T (University of Toronto) and several City Halls too.

In fact, during the last 7 years I have been working on several social projects about marginalized communities working both on the inside and the outside to improve their situation (check out the section of my webpage about social projects http://www.jupiterfab.com/project/). Moreover, to make my work more intense and more effective, a couple of years ago I founded a NGO and put together a team of professionals working on every single step of a project (preparation, production, logistics, creation, communication).

One of my murals, painted in Richmond, USA in 2015


Art and social issues

As both an artist and a director of a NGO I constantly work on social issues and, in particular, with marginalized communities worldwide suffering from different kind of problems: starving, immigration, integration, gentrification…

This mural is part of a project in which I immortalize a group of people in an urban context showing the state of uneasiness behind their masks.

This mural talks about a serious problem that is getting even more serious every day. The people, and mainly the younger generations, are starting to have socialization problems, because they live and are growing up in a society where everything is virtual and fake.

By contributing to this project I hope we can help people to reflect on this "virtual society" we live in and also help to generate a genuine dialogue about it.

In exchange, I offer my donors some of my art, from an autographed limited edition postcard to a real painting. I believe your contribution can be helpful for society and at the same time you will be able to have a good and unique piece of art for a present ….if you like what I create, of course!!

Please go ahead, if you feel like it. And if you cannot give any economic contribution, please share this project with as many friends and people you can. It will be still helpful to the cause.


A video about a project I am running in Barcelona


The challenge and the wish to help

For the last 10 years I have dedicated my entire life to social art using my experience and my skills as a multinational ex-manager, trying to go beyond a simple art action but working both within the community area and outside so to empower them to negotiate a better quality of life.

I have chosen a double hard road as, nowadays, art and social well-being are no easy roads to ride. But I did so. I chose to quit my job as a manager of one of the most important multinationals in the motorbike market. I left the benefits and the good salary behind to work on what I like and, as you can imagine, money has been a constant issue during my career but at the same time, I had the chance to know many interesting and great people on my path

However, I have always found a way to pursue my dream and how I wanted and I am sure I will be able to make it also for this project!

So, a bit of sun and positive energy from Spain!

Thank you in advance

Jupiterfab


Mural Installation in an Art Gallery 2013
