story:
Who we are

Marc Lewis  (born in London) and Beth Erez (born in Brooklyn) - both sculptors for close to 15 years - have teamed up to create a unique and fascinating totem pole.

Marc has always dreamed of building a totem pole out of metal. Beth wanted to create a large-scale sculpture with wood and found metal. Walking down her city street, Beth came across logs cut from a tree by the municipal tree trimmers in preparation for winter and this was the beginning of Totem Pole #11 . 

Please look at our websites to learn more about us:

www.betherez.com 

www.marclewisart.com

Beth testing location for the beak

Creating the sculpture

It has been a very arduous process sculpting Totem Pole #11, but with an extremely rewarding result. The Totem Pole is 3-4 meters high (almost 10 feet) and will be at least 1-2 meter (3-6 feet) higher once we create a base and install it on location. The Totem Pole is composed of three sections of wood (logs) separated by found metal sculptures – each sculpture representing another aspect of society and a symbolic bird at the peak made of brushed aluminum. 

Marc evaluating next steps

 It took us many sessions to design each of the sculptures, to create them, and then to build them in a manner such that they would be safe for all to view. The wood itself represents closeness to nature, and the division into sections, which are connected, represents diversity.  The lowermost sculpture represents technology and innovation in its robotic appearance.  The middle sculpture is the number 11 (as you can see in photo above).  The number 11 is important in numerology, as it is the first of the Master Numbers.  The Master Number 11 is usually called The Illuminator, The Messenger or the Teacher, as those with this Master Number are here to be inspirational guiding lights, to bring illumination to others and to help raise spiritual awareness.

The topmost sculpture between the top two logs is a circle made of an old rusty pipe inside the wings of the noble bird, which together with the beak and eyes forms a sculpture symbolic of birds of prey – conquering and controlling the desert.  The circle itself suggests wholeness, the spiritual joining together of a proud nation. 

Beak sculpted out of brushed aluminum


So why are we approaching backers on indiegogo?

Together, we have already worked a total of at least 500 hours, periodically, over the last three years to create this artwork, Totem Pole #11.  Each time we meet, it takes us almost two hours just to build the pole and to take it down again. Remaining costs are beyond us and we need assistants who could help us move forward faster.  The cost of the assistants, the paints, the metal for the base, wood preservation, assistance for completing the sculpture and building a base, increasing the enhanced stability of the Totem Pole, moving it to and mounting at its permanent location is estimated at $17,000 USD. We envision the installation of this complex work of art at a public venue in Israel where a larger community can view it but can go no further on our own. We are looking for the generous and inspired support of project backers to help us raise the funds needed to complete this daunting project and to install it in a public venue.   We would like to encourage backers by offering several perks:   postcards, prints of Marc's B&W sketch, T-shirts of a photo of the painted totem, prints of a photo of the totem on site and a plaque on the base.

Once we are funded, we estimate 40-60 days to complete the work including the onsite installation.  If we do not reach our full funding, we will have to make concessions in our final sculpture.  It will take a lot longer to complete - by continuing to work really slowly doing all the physical labor ourselves.  We will not be able to build the base we need to have it accepted in a popular park.  We will use the funds we do receive to pay for the many necessary out-of-pocket costs like fumigation, paint and steel plates. We would be grateful if we could raise enough funds to be able to complete the work and install it in a really great place .  Please contribute to our campaign today!

representing another aspect of society and a symbolic bird at the peak made of
brushed aluminum. 
Marc evaluating next steps It took us many sessions to design each of the
sculptures, to create them, and then to build them in a manner such that they
would be safe for all to view. The wood itself represents closeness to nature,
and the division into sections, which are connected, represents
diversity.  The lowermost sculpture represents technology and innovation
in its robotic appearance.  The middle sculpture is the number 11 (as you can see in photo above). 
The number 11 is important in numerology, as it is the first of the Master
Numbers.  The Master Number 11 is usually called The Illuminator, The
Messenger or the Teacher, as those with this Master Number are here to be
inspirational guiding lights, to bring illumination to others and to help raise
spiritual awareness.
The
topmost sculpture between the top two logs is a circle made of an old rusty
pipe inside the wings of the noble bird, which together with the beak and eyes
forms a sculpture symbolic of birds of prey – conquering and controlling the
desert.  The circle itself suggests wholeness, the spiritual joining
together of a proud nation. Beak sculpted out of brushed aluminum
So why
are we approaching backers on indiegogo?
Together, we have already worked a
total of at least 500 hours, periodically, over the last three years to
create this artwork, Totem Pole #11.  Each time we meet, it takes us almost two hours
just to build the pole and to take it down again. Remaining costs are beyond us
and we need assistants who could help us move forward faster.  The
cost of the assistants, the paints, the metal for the base, wood preservation, assistance for completing the sculpture and building a base,
increasing the enhanced stability of the Totem Pole, moving it to and mounting at its
permanent location is estimated at $17,000 USD. We envision the installation of this complex work of art at a public venue in Israel where a larger community can view it but can go no
further on our own. We are looking for the generous and inspired support of
project backers to help us raise the funds needed to complete this daunting project and to install it in a public venue.   We would like to encourage backers by offering several perks:   postcards, prints of Marc's B&W sketch, T-shirts of a photo of the painted totem, prints of a photo of the totem on site and a plaque on the base.Once we are funded, we
estimate 40-60 days to complete the work including the onsite installation.  If we do not reach our full funding, we will have to make concessions in our final sculpture.  It will take a lot longer to complete - by continuing to work really slowly doing all the physical labor ourselves.  We will not be able to build the base we need to have it accepted in a popular park.  We will use the funds we do receive to pay for the many necessary out-of-pocket costs like fumigation, paint and steel plates. We would be grateful if we could raise enough funds to be able to complete the work and install it in a really great place .  Please contribute to our campaign today!

story:
Our Story

Ski is a Rock n' Roll photographer, Nora is an artist. He's American, she's Hungarian. They are destined to be together, even though now they are a world apart.

About Ski

If there was one phrase that would fit Ski perfectly, it would be "Rock n' Roll Paparazzi". His greatest talent is to capture the essence of a moment in such a way, that it makes you feel you were there right beside him when he'd taken his photos. Ever since he was a child, his love for music has been a defining factor for Ski. Growing up in Newport Beach, CA, his instant draw towards early punk rock was accompanied with his profound interest in photography at the age of 15. Even at that young age he already knew his purpose in life. By the time he turned 18 years, Ski was living in Los Angeles on his own, more often than not in the back of his station wagon, relentlessly pursuing what was to become his greatest passion: concert photography. For over a decade, Ski has been living in Las Vegas, NV, and continues to be well-loved and highly appreciated in rock n' roll circles for not only his outstanding photography skills, but also his charming, vibrant personality. Over the years Ski has mastered the art of studio photography, and has also developed as an artist. But whatever he does, he continues to rebel against conventional creative concepts. All of his photos and artwork are unique and "follow the beat of his punk rock heart".

About Nora

If Nora - or Nori, as she's known by her friends - had to use a single phrase to describe herself, she wouldn't necessarily choose the word "artist", much to Ski's annoyance. She was born and raised in Budapest, Hungary, and ever since she was a child, she has found great pleasure in drawing and painting, and her excellent art teachers in school only fueled her passion for creativity. Having worked in Communications and Public Relations for many years, her artistic ambitions took a backseat for a while, but after a long pause, she once again picked up a pencil in the summer of 2011 and - inspired by her lifelong love for rock music - started drawing her favorite rock stars. She has never looked back ever since: in the past three years Nora has put great effort into perfecting and evolving her techniques, constantly practicing and keen on learning, sometimes venturing from rock music towards other directions. Never having been a trained artist, only recently did she start taking up drawing classes, in order to finally have the opportunity to work with live models. Her artworks range from portraits to landscapes, from pencil drawings to oil paintings, always with a special emphasis on elaborate details. She readily admits, however, that her forte has always been drawing portraits, ever since she was in high school. Being able to capture the emotions of her models and make their features - especially their eyes - come alive on paper is what she considers the greatest reward and accomplishment for herself. Ever since she's known him, Nora considers Ski to be one of the strongest inspirations not just in her life, but in her art as well.

How And When...

...did we meet, you might ask? Well,on Facebook (of all places!) almost a year ago, inadvertently thanks to our mutual friend and rock musician Todd "Dammit" Kerns. Nora asked for Ski's permission to base a new drawing of hers on one of Ski's photos of Todd... and he jumped at the chance to say a big YES, because as soon as he saw her profile picture, he knew that he had to get to know her... and the rest is now history, or so they say.

It was art, photography, and rock music that brought us together in the first place, almost one year ago, so it's only fitting that it should bring us even closer, this time in the physical sense. Going 5997 miles for a first kiss doesn't seem much when two people love each other as much as we do, but unfortunately with life throwing us curves it has so far been impossible to put aside money for a return ticket either to Las Vegas or to Budapest, Hungary. After countless collaborations and endless hours of chats and Skype dates we are surer than ever that we want to be together, and at the moment the only way we can make the first step towards that is to offer you our labor of love.

We're giving up one-of-a-kind photos, artwork, and some very special memorabilia to raise enough money to be able to finally meet for the first time.


What We Need & What You Get

We set our goal at 1500 USD, which would cover one return ticket to Las Vegas for Nora, and a short road trip to California to visit Ski's mom together. Anything we get above that amount would go into a return ticket to Budapest for Ski's visit later this year. Naturally, even if we don't reach our goal, the funds will be put aside for the same purpose; it just means that we would need to wait a little longer to finally meet. Needless to say, it's getting harder and harder to be apart with each day...

So what do we have for you in return for your contribution? A whole range of goodies, and there is more to come each week!

Our Perks Are:

  • If you don't have the money to buy anything, but still would want to contribute, you can pledge for a special "Thank You" Video message or a "Thank You" Post Card from us. It's guaranteed that we will pour our hearts and souls into them!
  • If you are looking into having a high-quality Original Photo Print, you can choose from a selection of unique R'n'R shots (all of them taken by Ski himself, of course) of legendary musicians such as James Hetfield, Kirk Hammett, Lemmy Kilmister, Joey Ramone, Dave Navarro, Scott Ian, James Brown, Sebastian Bach, Rob Zombie, the Sin City Sinners, and many more.
  • Nora also has a range of original drawings, of which you can get yourself beautiful prints to go on your wall.
  • But if you are interested in buying original artwork, she has a selection of her drawings available for that purpose. Her subjects are quite famous, too...
  • What is more, she would love to draw a custom portrait for you, if that's what your heart desires. Now it doesn't matter who the subject(s) is/are, or what the size of the drawing is (limited up to A1 only for shipping purposes), it comes at a fixed price!
  • Our friend, and in a sense the person responsible for us getting to know each other, Todd Kerns - Canadian musician who played in Age of Electric, Static In Stereo, Las Vegas's very own Sin City Sinners, and currently in Slash feat. Myles Kennedy And The Conspirators - was so kind as to sign for us a few exclusive photos that Ski took of him, which are now up for grabs - two prints of each photo! 
  • If you are living in or near Las Vegas, and you have been toying with the idea of having a professional photo shoot for yourself, your partner, your child, etc. (at a reasonable price), here is your chance to get it done by Ski. If you want to have it Rock n' Roll style, even better! If you have any questions for him about this perk, feel free to post them in the Comments section!

Of course there will be more brand new perks coming up every week, so keep an eye on this page!

When Will You Get Your Perks?

  • The video and the post cards will be sent all the way from Las Vegas, so sometime during the summer months, hopefully in July/early August.
  • The photos, prints, and drawings will be mailed to you by early June the latest (as soon as they are ready for shipping).
  • For the photo shoot you and Ski will need to set a date together.


Your Contribution Will...

...help us realize a dream that has played a vital part of our lives for every single day of the past year. With your help we will be able to hold each other, kiss each other, and after so much time spent on Skype, look each other in the eye for the first time. This may not seem much to some, but for us it's everything.

Also, beyond our personal happiness, we would be absolutely delighted if you gave any of our artwork a loving new home. For two people who love to create and appreciate art and beauty as much as we do, your finding pleasure in our creations is a source of happiness in itself.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to help us, but for some reason you can't contribute by purchasing any of the listed perks, it's not a problem - we've all been in that kind of situation at some point, haven't we. But there are other ways to help us, too!

If you know somebody who might be interested in what we can offer, please, don't hesitate to let them know by sharing this page with them!


We Would Like To...

...thank all of you for your time and help from the bottom of our hearts. We hope that in return we can give you something that - in every case - was or will be a labor of love.

story:
XUZA is a two level interactive art car, designed to carry close to 40 passengers on many journeys throughout Burning Man. XUZA is also a mobile sound installation and will be hosting many amazing DJ's and  vocalists  at various locations around the Playa.

There are several aspects to this build which are extremely important to us; safety, safety, safety, and of course a jaw dropping, beautiful art car.  We are not cutting corners and are building this vehicle to be structural stable as well as mechanical sound.  We have already invested close to $8,000 to bring XUZA to where she's at now! We did the math ( thanks to the help of a spreadsheet) and with a $14,444 goal.....(we love the 4's), we will be able to make this one of the safest, reliable and amazing art cars at Black Rock City. 

Your contribution will go to the following key expenses:

  • Building Materials: Tons of steel which are going to be used for the structure of the rig and ensure safe operation in the middle of this beautiful dust bowl we call home. 
  • Lighting: LED's, LED's and more LED's! Yes XUZA is a 16th century Chariot... but this 21st Century transformation needs to be far more spectacular then that Bucks Rogers buddy "Twiki" We will be investing in two short throw projectors  for the visuals on the entire side of the rig that will be used when XUZA is throwing a party. We will also be incorporating long throw UV Cannons which will illuminate the UV reactive flags as our Flag Spinners are painting the sky.
  • Sound:  Loud doesn't necessarily mean good We understand and respect our neighbors and will be doing our best to minimize "Noise" pollution. We are designing a sound system that is loud enough to engage our party attendees but won't bleed into another party halfway across the Playa
  • Transportation / Fuel: Even though we live in Nevada, it's still a 15-18 hour journey from Las Vegas to Black Rock City. We're aprox. 1,100 miles roundtrip  plus an estimated 100 gallons of fuel which will be used for XUZA Playa Opperations.

This campaign means so much to the entire XUZA team!! With your help you will be able to make "the vision" a reality and bring XUZA, complete with all of the bells a whistles, to the Playa this year!  Well not just bells and whistles...we're also talking  about blinky shiny things,  comfy fuzzy things, loud drummy things...and so much more.... oh, the things we have to show you!!!

We understand that times can be tough and making the commitment to go "home" can break the bank for some, but please don't feel left out if you can't contribute monetarily, there are plenty of ways you can help:

  1. We can always use another set of hands during the final months of our build. If you're in the Las Vegas Area, reach out to us on our Facebook page and come on by.
  2. Share our information to your social networks. Check out the Indiegogo share tools!
  3. Join our support camp at Burning Man 2014.  We will be looking to fill the week schedule and will be looking for volunteers who would like to join us on the playa as "spotters" Greeters" and "loaders"

Everyone please share our info throughout your network as every dollar counts!

Thank you so much and we look forward to sharing  an  EPIC experience with YOU!!!

- Mike C
"Justin Case"


Contributions in the $28 Category will receive a limited edition XUZA Laser Cut Wood Pendant



Contributions in the $350 Category also receive an limited edition illuminated Pocket square from http://www.illuminatedcouture.com/


A Note From Mike:

In years past I've always had a tough time readjusting to the default world. My decompression time usually lasted a week or so. After the 2013 burn, I had no withdrawals,  I was so pumped up with excitement to begin this project and It only took a week for me to acquire the vehicle.   I remember trying to explain this "Mayan Temple" to a very close friend as I was telling her how this whole vision came to light and so I  jumped on my computer and started to do a  Google search for images.  It took some time, I mean, doing a search for "Burning Man" and "temple",  you'll get a return of 25 years of the actual Temples but very, very few of this particular art structure.  

We learned the "Mayan" Temple had a name:  "Temple of Kukulkan" and  finally found a picture, a random photographer by the name Arin Fishkin had an amazing album of images from the 2013 burnPhotographer Arin Fishkin's Burning Man 2013 Album  
I was showing the image to my friend and  began to zoom in, reminiscing and admiring the image that Miss Fishkin had captured....and that's when I received the shock of my life......  Miss Fishkin actually captured the MOMENT!!! That 30 seconds of clarity when I became one with the Playa, that moment that I had the vision.  What are the chances?  I am still blown away..... I have yet to meet Miss Fishkin, but when and if I do, big hugs and a huge thank you will be had :-)

As I was doing more research I discovered another "Are you kidding me?" moment.     I've been wanting to attend Burning man for at least 10 years prior to my eventual first burn in 2010, but there was always something that prevented me.   When I finally received a gifted ticket to the 2010 Burn I knew the life I had known would forever be changed!  
This is the first picture that was taken of me when I received my ticket "home"..happy guy huh? :

                                       

What's the Significance? Ready for this? 

The design of the 2010 Burning Man Metropolis Ticket was created by..... Yup......
Arin Fishkin!!!!! 

http://arinfishkin.com/burning_man_ticket_2010.html


......... just another "power of the Playa" moment. 

-Mike C
"Justin Case"

story:
Short Summary

My name is Kirstie van Haarlem, I have seen 23 springs and I have a history of creative studies, from creative design to interior design. I found these studies very interesting, but none could make me truly happy. I wanted to create myself, and I realized I found it very hard to live up to someone else's measures. 

I am trying very hard to make a book of handcrafted mandala's. These handcrafted mandala's can be colored by anyone who finds it fun to do. Mandala's have been a work of art since the very old India, but this symbol is known in almost every culture. I have been drawing for a very long time now, and I have recently discovered that making my own mandala's not only gives me positive energy, it strengthens my concentration, it makes my hand more steady and it makes my thoughts clearer.

The main goal of my 'advanced mandala book' is to help people experience the same growth as I have while making them. The colors you use while coloring these mandala's will show you your emotion. So, by using the colors you feel the need to use, you can get to, among all other things;  know your emotions a little better! 

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

I don't need much to achieve my goal. I need 500,- to realize 50 'advanced mandala coloring books'. The 500,- will only be used for producing these books. While producing, most of the money will go to paper. I will make sure the paper is of the finest quality, so you don't only have to use pencils, but you can also use cottor-pins. The materials I use to make these mandala's are all at my own expence.

What makes my mandala's unique? I have put my heart and soul in it. Each mandala I make are made with a a lot of time and effort. Not only are they handcrafted piece by piece, they are faultless. I make my own shapes and I do not only use geometrical forms. These mandala's are advanced because I make the finest lines and the smallest forms. You must be concentrated to stay within these lines.

If I don't reach my entire goal, I will use the funds to buy material and expand my skills. By expanding my skills I will be innovative and hopefully I will gain more funding for my final goal; realizing my 'advanced mandala coloring book'. 

The Impact

This if my very first attempt to be succesful in drawing mandala's and producing them as a book. Although I have always been a creative person, I have never put an effort in producing and having succes. I simply want people to have fun drawing and being creative. Because even if you are the most uncreative person in the world, by coloring my mandala's you will see that a creative mind lies within each and every person, even you! I want to be part of making people happy and excited to achieve things. By making mandala's I hope I can contribute to helping people be more clearer in thoughts and concentrated. If I reach my goal, every donation above 30,- will get a handcrafted name entry, conglomerated in one mandala. Every donation above 50,-, I will be sending a copy of the first example, and also their handcrafted names, conglomerated in one mandala.

Other Ways You Can Help

Whenever you can't contribute, I will appreciate it very much if you could just spread the word by sharing this page!
story_txt: Short SummaryMy name is Kirstie van Haarlem, I have seen 23 springs and I have a history of creative studies, from creative design to interior design. I found these studies very interesting, but none could make me truly happy. I wanted to create myself, and I realized I found it very hard to live up to someone else's measures. I am trying very hard to make a book of handcrafted mandala's. These handcrafted mandala's can be colored by anyone who finds it fun to do. Mandala's have been a work of art since the very old India, but this symbol is known in almost every culture. I have been drawing for a very long time now, and I have recently discovered that making my own mandala's not only gives me positive energy, it strengthens my concentration, it makes my hand more steady and it makes my thoughts clearer.The main goal of my 'advanced mandala book' is to help people experience the same growth as I have while making them. The colors you use while coloring these mandala's will show you your emotion. So, by using the colors you feel the need to use, you can get to, among all other things;  know your emotions a little better! Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?What We Need & What You GetI don't need much to achieve my goal. I need 500,- to realize 50 'advanced mandala coloring books'. The 500,- will only be used for producing these books. While producing, most of the money will go to paper. I will make sure the paper is of the finest quality, so you don't only have to use pencils, but you can also use cottor-pins. story:
Please Help Us Reach Our Goal!

Each year, AFC supporters come together to support the AFC children at our Washington, DC art auction benefit.  This year, we are growing our community through a second event in NYC, and by providing an online forum for those who are unable to attend our benefits to join us in our annual effort. 

Artists For Charity relies on the success of these events to keep our programs running! These funds enable us to provide a home and a future to the kids growing up in our children’s home, to extend a lifeline to HIV+ children struggling in impoverished circumstances, and to transform the environment of sick children fighting for their health inside hospitals with limited resources.

We know how much our children mean to everyone in the AFC family across the globe, and we know that many of our supporters are unable to make it to these auction events.  This year, we are offering those who can’t attend an opportunity support AFC by contributing right here!  Our event auctioneer, Steve Talbot, has generously donated his company’s services, valued at $13,000, to launch this fundraising campaign. Please help us meet our goal of matching that grant!

Our programs need your support more than ever. As our awareness of how much we are needed grows, so do our programs.  If we meet our goal, we will be able to expand our ArtHeals program to offer clean blankets and essential care packages to children in the hospitals we serve.  The need for these items is great, but with your help we can meet our goal and make it happen!

Artists for Charity is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization, and all donations are tax-deductible.  You will receive a receipt with our thanks for your contribution.  No amount of help is too small, and all donors will be entered in a drawing to win a piece of original art from AFC’s collection!  

Don’t forget that you may donate in the name of a friend, and opt for your thank-you gift and letter of thanks to be sent to them.  With the holidays around the corner, this is a wonderful way to honor a loved one with a gift that will truly give forever.

There has never been a better time to show the children of AFC how much you care.  Join the family of supporters today!

story:
Born in 1973, Kianoush Ramezani is an Iranian artist, cartoonist, and human rights activist, who left Iran due to his involvement in Iran's Green Movement and his position in the Cartoonists' Rights Network International (CRNI). He has taught many courses and delivered lectures on the cartooning process, freedom of expression, and human rights. He has also founded and curated several cartoon expositions in France to support human rights in Iran and exiled international journalists. Kianoush received the first International cartooning award of 2012 from Kofi Annan and the mayor of Geneva. Kianoush Ramezani’s cartoons have appeared regularly on Iranian websites such as "Khodnevis","Nabz-Iran","Iranian", etc. and in International publications and media such as "Courrier International", "Arte" and "TV5 Monde" website. Kianoush Ramezani has lived in France since 2009 as a political refugee.

  • I'm trying to publish my first book with the title of "World Visual Diary" and that's why I'm here to have your support. it will be a collection of cartoons that I created since 2010 till today about the World conflicts and issues. this book will be published by your support and you will give me much more motivation to continue my carrier and missions

story:
Drawing for debt relief.

Hello, my name is Brittany and I am in need of some help. I have $3500 of debt mainly medical, that I need help paying off. I am trying to live on my own but I can't because of the debt I'm in.

The only talent that I do have is my ability to draw. I will draw my hand off to pay for my debt. Even if only a penny if given, I wouldn't care, I'm that determined to rid this nasty debt. I have a small part time job but, I don't make enough to chip away the debt and to help out with bills and, with the economy being so bad now, it's hard to find another job even though I tried my best to look for another. :(

Even though this is not much for me to give,I would want you to have something in return for your support as well. I wish I could do more.

Here is some of my artwork, I hope it interests you.

Thank you for reading this.

story:
The collaborators


Christopher Levenson | poet

Christopher Levenson, who was born in London, England, and came to Canada in 1968 to teach English and Creative Writing at Carleton University, Ottawa, has published ten books of his own poetry — an eleventh, Night Vision, is due from Quattro Books of Toronto in Spring 2014. He was also co-founder and first editor of Arc magazine (from 1978 to 1988) and has published two books of translations from seventeenth century Dutch poetry. He moved to Vancouver in August 2007 with his wife Oonagh.

Sigrid Albert | artist

Sigrid Albert has a Bachelor of Graphic Design from Emily Carr University, and has 19 years of experience in the communication design field. Her specialty is publication design for corporate or institutional clients, book and cover design for publishers, and websites. Over the last several years she has developed an art practice by drawing on location in her East Vancouver neighbourhood, and wherever she goes. She loves zines, street/public/spontaneous/outsider art. Visit her blog at urbansketcher.ca.

Peter Braune | master printer

Peter Braune has been a Master Printer and owner/operator of New Leaf Creative Solutions on Granville Island since 1986. He is one of the foremost Master Printers in Canada and has produced collaborative work with artists including Robert Bateman, Bill Reid, Gordon Smith and Steven Shearer. Peter has worked in Singapore and New York as a Master Printer. He assisted with the establishment of the Singapore Tyler Print Institute in 2000. Peter is also an accomplished fine artist and has sold work across Canada.


The collaboration

The poetry in "Getting To Know You" describes Christopher's experience of discovering Vancouver. Anyone acquainted with this city will find familiar landmarks, vistas, and situations in these poems. After 5 years of living here, our poet operates somewhere between "outsider" and "seasoned citizen." He is still becoming a Vancouverite. And as such, he is in a perfect position to comment on Vancouver becoming a bigger version of itself, and on the in-between spaces that this growth produces. Here is an exploration of the stillness and solitude that exists within the frenetic, electric pace of the city. These poems recount the drastic changes we impose upon our urban environment, and concurrently, the subtle ways in which we are changed by it.

Over the course of six months, Sigrid visited the locations of the poems to collect sketches and photographs. Although she has created many drawings in her lifetime, this is her first attempt at copper plate etching. She has been trying all kinds of techniques including hard ground, drypoint, aquatint, burnishing, scraping, and soft ground lift. Her strong attention to detail, and her mastery of line and shadow translate beautifully to the copper plate, resulting in some rich pieces of art. Sigrid has chosen her favourite long vertical format for her etchings, and this goes particularly well with the subject of the poems.

Our book covers will be printed on custom designed paper made by local paper maker, Reg Lissel. The poems will be printed on a Vandercook Universal I, from polymer plates created at Blackstone Press. We electroplate our copper plates with steel. These will be printed on a Takach etching press onto Arches Text Wove etching paper. All printing and book binding will be done at New Leaf Editions on Granville Island.


All funds raised will go towards the cost of materials.

Any extra funds raised will be divided between the collaborators.


The Book

The broadsheet:


Book spreads showing four of the poems and etchings:

story:
As many of you know, for the past year I have been studying and performing contemporary Butoh dance in New York City. I have performed solo Butoh-inspired performance pieces throughout the city, and have been training regularly and guest performing with the Vangeline Theater, an esteemed Butoh dance company based in New York. It has been a wonderful expansion of my physical theater and performance background, and I am honored to be able to share my evolving work with others. 

My theatrical and movement-based roots in Atlanta, Italy, and Chicago have all influenced my work to this point, and I am beyond excited to explore my art more deeply. I was recently afforded the opportunity to present two new solo works in Berlin, Germany, as part of the city's annual Month of Performance Art (MPA-B 2015). Along with several other Hispanic/Latin identified artists working under the name PERFORMEANDO, I will be performing work at three locations between May 27 and June 2. I am incredibly humbled by this chance to share myself with a larger audience, but, like many artists in this country, I am unfortunately not in a financial position to afford the logistical costs on my own.

I am terrible at asking for help, but at this point in my career, I am unable to cover the cost of this trip independently. The funds raised here will help cover the cost of travel, lodging, and meals, pay my sound designer, and assist with costuming. No amount is too small and even just spreading the word and sharing this campaign with friends and family would be incredibly helpful. 

Any money raised beyond my basic costs will go directly to further training in New York as well as to helping bolster my presence as an artist in the city (website creation, etc.)

I am so grateful for any help, and in exchange for your kind donations, I have created a few incentives (tarot readings, hugs, tears of gratitude, etc.). Thanks so much for the support!


Please read more about the work being presented in Berlin: 

The first presentation will be a Butoh-inspired dance examining constructs of "border masculinity" as it relates to growing-up queer in a multi-racial home in El Paso, Texas. Using the German commands my father used on his Belgian Malinois along with physical elements of the “macho” expectations of me by the society of my youth, I will reinvent the Tex-Mex pressure of masculinity placed on myself in an effort to empower the little boy who was once subjected to them. This is a dance of chaos and healing, of violence and peace, of revisiting the ghosts of the past that once said my existence was not enough and proving them wrong. 

The second is a consecration ritual using physical elements from Texas, New York and Berlin to explore the duality of the internal and external territories we traverse in our most sacred moments.Through the sharing of a private ritual, I will explore the intrusion of the external audience on my internal territory, while simultaneously existing as an encroaching force on my physical surroundings through sound, light, and presence. This is a condensed version of a group durational dance piece, a welcoming of summer, and a remembrance of shadow as light becomes more abundant.

story:
Short Summary

The Triangles festival is supposed to be an experiment, deliberately allowed to be chaotic, where everyone will find his and her place. Creativity is on the loose as this is the only possible path for it.

All participants are welcomed to present themselves or their art. The music played will be electronic, acoustic and sometimes even spontaneous. Talks, cabaret and artistry are among the performances.

The Triangles festival offers everyone to take part in what’s meant to be an open space to express yourself in every artistic way possible. Important There is no entrance fee nor will there be a guest list. The premise for everyone taking part in our festival is to look after oneself and his/her surrounding.

The Location of the Triangles 2015 is secretly, you will be informed about after funding.

What We Need

  • Soundequipment (Münchner Kulturreferat)
  • 5 KVA Stromaggregat von FFL Rieger
  • Benzinkosten für Aggregat und Transport
  • Benzinkosten für Künstler
  • Deko und anderer Schick-Schnack
  • Getränke für Künstler und Orgateam
